description:
Dale A. Carlson has been active in San Francisco politics and civic affairs for more than 30 years. He was the founding chairman and president of the Treasure Island Development Authority (TIDA); a member of the Bay Conservation and Development Commission (BCDC); a development advisor to the San Francisco Port Commission; a member of the Library Commission that sponsored a $109.5 million public bond measure and raised $35 million in private donations to build San Francisco’s new main library; and chairman of the San Francisco Elections Commission. He has served as a board member of more than a dozen non-profit agencies, cultural institutions, charitable foundations, environmental advocates, and neighborhood associations.

He was the chief communications officer for the California Institute for Regenerative Medicine, a state government agency managing a $3 billion stem cell research project. His responsibilities required direct interaction with state elected officials and members of the legislature. Carlson was the agency’s principal spokesperson, and placed stories with Barron’s, the PBS NewsHour with Jim Lehrer, ABC World News with Charles Gibson, Science, Nature, and The New York Times, as well as with daily local newspapers and media outlets.

At the Pacific Exchange, Carlson led press and media relations, government and public affairs, marketing and corporate communications, and investor relations for more than 18 years. Legislation he wrote and advocated was adopted by the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, the California Legislature, and Congress. He led the team that negotiated a package of financial incentives with the Mayor’s office to help the Exchange build a new trading facility in San Francisco, and steered the project through environmental review and design approval at the City Planning Commission

Carlson currently works as a strategic communications and public affairs consultant. His current clients include an investment bank specializing in auto dealerships; a biotech firm developing radiation counter-measures for the federal government; the San Francisco Wholesale Produce Market; a collection of Russian theatrical art; and a group advocating stock market and high-frequency trading reform.

He lives in San Francisco with his wife, Meagan Levitan, a San Francisco Recreation and Parks Commissioner and elected member of the Democratic County Central Committee, and their two daughters. An avid sailor, Carlson has been racing on San Francisco Bay for three decades.

Host: Karen Crommie
name: Dale Carlson: Can San Francisco's Short-Term Rentals Be Regulated?

description:
HTML 5 Application Development Class

2 Day Training

What: This is a 2 day HTML5 training class that begins at 9:00 AM and ends at 5:00 PM each day.

Description: Get the insight into HTML5 Application Development with this 2 day it training course. 

The class begins with an introduction to HTML5, Document Object Model and an overview of JavaScript. Following this, Event Handling mechanism is explained. Following this Forms, Audio and Video APIs are explained. The morning session concludes with exercises that cover AJAX, HTML Forms, Video and Audio API.

Following lunch we start out with HTML5 Canvas. Canvas API is explained. Following this, a couple of HTML5 Canvas/Graphics libraries are explained. Students will work on building an HTML5 Applications from scratch using Canvas, Canvas Libraries that integrates Canvas with Audio, Video and Drag and Drop APIs. This concludes the session for first day.

Day 2 morning session starts with Communication API. This follows an explanation of AJAX, XMLHttpRequest and Cross-Domain Messaging. Then we cover Web Workers, Web Sockets and GeoLocation APIs. This session concludes with hands-on exercises using these topics.

Following lunch, we cover storage API. This covers how to store HTML5 data on local machine and in remote cloud. Following this, how to develop and configure offline applications. Then WebGL is explained. The session concludes with the review of topics covered in the class and how to improve performance of HTML5 applications. 

This is a 2 day it training course that requires a commitment from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on both days. Morning coffee and Lunch are included for both days. The class size is small so that individualized attention can be paid to all the students. Many opportunities for Q&A are offered to the students. The instructor for this class is an experienced programmer/instructor. We have been successfully teaching this class since 2011. 

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

Summary

[DAY 1]

------MORNING------

- Introduction to HTML5

- Review of DOM and JavaScript

- Event Handling in HTML5

- Forms API

- Video and Audio API

------AFTERNOON------

-Canvas API

-Drag And Drop API

-Integrate Audio and Video API with Canvas

-HTML5 Graphic Libraries

-Developing Canvas Applications using Custom Libraries

------------------------------------------------------------

[DAY 2]

------MORNING------

-Communication API

-XMLHttpRequest and Cross-Domain Messaging

-Web Workers and Web Sockets API

-GeoLocation API

------AFTERNOON------

-Local Storage API

-Storage over Cloud

-Introduction to WebGL

-Offline Applications API

-Optimizing HTML5 Applications

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

Contact: [masked]

 Benefits 

Career: Lay your own path to success. Learn HTML5 and taste the fruit of success that comes from being in demand. 

Make more money: HTML programmers make on average $30,000 more per year than professionals who only know Microsoft Office. 

Be in control on the web: HTML is the foundation of the web and knowing HTML is essential for developing and managing a successful online presence. 

Increase strategic value: Become indispensible to your employer. 

Get a promotion: If you are looking for a promotion or a new job then knowing HTML will increase your chances of success. 

Mobile applications: HTML is used for Cross Platform Mobile Application Development; learn the language that is powering mobile applications. 

Value to businesses: HTML is of importance to all businesses because of its integral value to the web. 

Better work life balance: Knowing how to code can lead to a circumstance in your life where you have better control over your career choices and work options. Most employers allow programmers the freedom to decide their own schedule and also offer more opportunities to work from home for programmers than non programmers. 

A standard practice: It is integral to know how to program in todays competitive environment. If you have been looking for a language to learn then make HTML your 1st choice. It will give you a lot of power in a very little time. Let’s face it; sooner or later you will have to learn how to program. Why wait? 

You can do it: Learning to program is not as hard as you think. With our coaching you will be able to bridge the programming gap. 

Beneficial to all employers: Getting training in HTML5 is of value to all companies as it helps employees produce better quality work. HTML5 can make the difference between average quality output and excellent quality output. It is of value to any position that requires communication or data interaction. The skills learned in this class are applicable to all departments of any company including but not limited to IT, Data Analysis, Sales, Strategic planning and Marketing. The skills taught can be implemented in daily online tasks. 

Why:

-  HTML5 offers faster image downloads, especially for mobile users

- HTML5 offers improved SEO

- HTML5 offers Sophisticated animation effects

- HTML5 offers Easier Web and Mobile App Development

- BBC is turning towards HTML5 for application development

- Zynga used HTML5 to make Words With Friends, FarmVille Express, Zynga Poker Mobile Web and CityVille Express. Zynga continues to use HTML5 for product development globally.

- SAP is using HTML5 for Enterprise Mobile Apps

- HTML5 is one of the most desired skills by employer

 How to Register:A. Please sign up on eventbrite:  

http://startupsaturdays.eventbrite.com/

B. If you are already on Eventbrite then please select the number of tickets you would like to purchase from above. C. If you have an employer sponsored education program then please contact us at: [masked] can work with various reimbursement and employer sponsored educational programs. 

Startup Saturdays - Complete Listing

http://startupsaturdays.eventbrite.com/

Make more money: HTML programmers make on average $30,000 more per year than professionals who only know Microsoft Office. 

Be in control on the web: HTML is the foundation of the web and knowing HTML is essential for developing and managing a successful online presence.

Better work life balance: Knowing how to code can lead to a circumstance in your life where you have better control over your career choices and work options. name: HTML5 Application Development Training - All levels

description:
HTML 5 Application Development Class

2 Day Training

What: This is a 2 day HTML5 training class that begins at 9:00 AM and ends at 5:00 PM each day.

Description: Get the insight into HTML5 Application Development with this 2 day it training course. 

The class begins with an introduction to HTML5, Document Object Model and an overview of JavaScript. Following this, Event Handling mechanism is explained. Following this Forms, Audio and Video APIs are explained. The morning session concludes with exercises that cover AJAX, HTML Forms, Video and Audio API.

Following lunch we start out with HTML5 Canvas. Canvas API is explained. Following this, a couple of HTML5 Canvas/Graphics libraries are explained. Students will work on building an HTML5 Applications from scratch using Canvas, Canvas Libraries that integrates Canvas with Audio, Video and Drag and Drop APIs. This concludes the session for first day.

Day 2 morning session starts with Communication API. This follows an explanation of AJAX, XMLHttpRequest and Cross-Domain Messaging. Then we cover Web Workers, Web Sockets and GeoLocation APIs. This session concludes with hands-on exercises using these topics.

Following lunch, we cover storage API. This covers how to store HTML5 data on local machine and in remote cloud. Following this, how to develop and configure offline applications. Then WebGL is explained. The session concludes with the review of topics covered in the class and how to improve performance of HTML5 applications. 

This is a 2 day it training course that requires a commitment from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on both days. Morning coffee and Lunch are included for both days. The class size is small so that individualized attention can be paid to all the students. Many opportunities for Q&A are offered to the students. The instructor for this class is an experienced programmer/instructor. We have been successfully teaching this class since 2011. 

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

Summary

[DAY 1]

------MORNING------

- Introduction to HTML5

- Review of DOM and JavaScript

- Event Handling in HTML5

- Forms API

- Video and Audio API

------AFTERNOON------

-Canvas API

-Drag And Drop API

-Integrate Audio and Video API with Canvas

-HTML5 Graphic Libraries

-Developing Canvas Applications using Custom Libraries

------------------------------------------------------------

[DAY 2]

------MORNING------

-Communication API

-XMLHttpRequest and Cross-Domain Messaging

-Web Workers and Web Sockets API

-GeoLocation API

------AFTERNOON------

-Local Storage API

-Storage over Cloud

-Introduction to WebGL

-Offline Applications API

-Optimizing HTML5 Applications

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

description:
Jason Wyman leads sales and operations for FranklInCovey in the South Bay Area. FranklinCovey provides workshops, consulting and coaching to help individuals and organizations become more effective. They provide solutions in six key areas: leadership, trust, strategy execution, sales performance, customer loyalty and productivity.

At the August 6th networking event, Jason will provide a 30-60 minute concept overview and lead a discussion based on FranklinCovey’s 5 Choices to Extraordinary Productivity. We will explore a central theme of our modern working lives: “Technology has made it easier than ever, and harder than ever, to be productive.” When we deliberately pay attention to the most important things amidst the distractions, we can harness the opportunities and technologies available today and soar to creative and innovative heights.

description:
Join us for free at one of our highly-innovative business-networking meetings - in your city! View our full calendar of business-networking meetings. We welcome anyone to attend a GoRampUp! meeting, once, for free as our guest, so you can learn what the innovative GoRampUp! business-networking experience is all about. Note, we are not able to give you a free meeting at more than one of our many locations.

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting athttp://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance. Without this ticket you will, unfortunately, be declined access to our innovative and exclusive business-networking meeting. WITH a GoRampUp! Golden Ticket, you will be welcomed with open arms!

It can be too difficult to attract new clients. We help you fix that! We're a business-impact community. We're informal and fun, yet, by design, we're extremely effective!

We help people who work for a living to get a much greater payoff from working. We do this in three specific ways under our three CoreSuccess Platforms: 1) We help you move toward mastery with business-networking, 2) We help you move toward mastery with business performance, and, 3) We help you move toward mastery with personal development.

How do we deliver on this promise to our community members? Each month we conduct dozens of business-networking meetings in more than a dozen cities in the SF Bay Area. A member may attend all of our "OpenConnect" business-networking meetings. And our members are welcome and encouraged to attend any and all of these meetings and locations.

Each month we introduce and emphasize a learning and development subject under each of our three CoreSuccess Platforms. For each of the three learning and development subjects that we introduce and emphasize each month, we give you four different ways to learn it: We produce written learning guides, video learning guides, audio learning guide, and we cover the subjects as 15-to-20-minute mini-workshops inside of our 60-minute business-networking meetings. There's no registration or initiation fee to join. Membership in GoRampUp! is month to month. You enroll when you like, even mid-month, and you depart when you like.

Be sure to see our website to learn about our generous enrollment incentives

Also, be sure to learn about our 100-Satisfaction Money-Back Guarantee

Would you care to come to this meeting, at no cost, to see if there’s business-value for you?

• Free-Meeting Guest-RSVP and Golden Ticket Request

• View complete meeting details

• Invite a Buddy to join you

One last thing: You REALLY should check out actual testimonial videos by our members: See them here

This page was created to produce awareness of our event. However, OUR PAGES ON THIS SITE CAN BECOME OUTDATED. The authoritative source for our meeting dates/times is http://www.GoRampUp.com/calendar. Be sure to check it prior to traveling to a meeting.

description:
This month we have an Email and Sales / Marketing analytics theme! Thanks to Yesware for sponsoring!

5:30-6:45 Networking, Food and Drink

6:45-7:15: Andrew Hall, Customer Confidence Manager, Yesware

7:15-7:45: Natan Ovadia, co-founder and product advisor, Boost Optix

7:45  Prize Raffle: Bring your Business Cards!

7:50-8:30 Networking & Wrapup

About our Speakers

Andrew Hall

Andrew Hall was the first hire for Yesware's Customer Confidence team and has built the team to 5 people over the last year and a half. Andrew is responsible for knowing the product inside-and-out, helping customers make the most out of the service, and ensuring that Yesware is constantly capturing customer feedback.

Andrew will explain the basics of Yesware, review how we integrate into Salesforce, and go over some examples of reporting and analytics that we've created for customers. Yesware is a free add-on for Gmail that helps you sell more effectively right from your inbox.

Natan Ovadia

Boost Optix is an upcoming sales automation platform that bridges the gap between email communication and sales performance.   Built directly for sales operations teams with value presented to all members of the sales team, Boost Optix is a back end platform that that automatically attaches emails to CRM leads/accounts and automates your sales teams’ workflow by parsing email data.  During our product presentation we'll be showing our integration with Salesforce.com and how our automation system functions.


The presenter for Boost Optix will be co-founder and product advisor Natan Ovadia.  Natan has experience working in account management, business development, sales operations and CRM administration for Salesforce.com over the last 7 years and is now responsible for directing product vision for Boost Optix.
name: August 6 Salesforce Data Analytics Meetup: Yesware & Boost Optix

description:
This is a weekly Wednesday meet-up held in Sunnyvale.

Due to the popularity of these local courts after 6:00 p.m., we'll start at 5:30 p.m. Please try to arrive on time to help us secure as many courts as possible.

If you don't see us when you arrived at Mango courts during the busy USTA leagues seasons, look for us at our alternative location at "Fremont High School", 1279 Sunnyvale Saratoga Rd., Sunnyvale, CA 94087

https://maps.google.com/maps?hl=...

Please be sure to RSVP, and kindly remember to update them in a timely manner should your plans changed, preferably by noon. (Members with a history of no-shows or last minute cancellations will be removed from my future invitation and event lists).

Should you plan to arrive later than the scheduled time, please mention it along with your RSVPs, but keep in mind that if you are more than a half hour late, you may lose your spot to a waiting list member. Also note that you may or may not be able to play beyond one hour depending on how busy the courts are.

Members who are on the waiting list are welcome to come out and check to see if there are spaces available around 7:00 since we normally play until about 9 or 9:30. Priority will be applied according to the order of your RSVP.

Rain cancel, unless the courts have had some time to dry.

We appreciate everyone's contributions of tennis balls.

Thanks! See you all on the courts!

Mary is hosting

Our Ladies LOVED this event last month! And we were begged to put it on the calendar again! Here we go, Ladies--Shake Your Groove Thang, Baby!

ALL Sizes and Ages welcome. When I went for my very first time, there were teens to seniors in the class, unfit and out of shape to skinny minnies, all kinds of nationalities--very diverse group, so EVERYONE fit in.

Class Prices at Shimmy Dreams:
First Visit: $15 for first class, $25 for two people Post Drop-in Classes: $20 for one class, $35 for 2 people

What to wear: Yoga pants or comfortable pants and a shirt that allows you to see yourself move. Dance shoes, socks, and bare feet are all welcome. 

Belly Dance is a full body workout that sculpts your abs, hips, back and arms -- plus you’re guaranteed to have fun! Come experience the joys of belly dance! Level 1 & 2 Classes (Beginners): Learn the shimmies, isolations, steps, and sensual moves of Belly Dance. You will also learn some easy cymbal and veil combinations. No previous dance experience necessary, just a fun attitude! For Level 2 dancers, you will have the opportunity to work on your layering techniques to create effective muscle memory in your dance.

description:
Pssst! This hack night is cosponsored with the Tinderbox meetup. Check out Tinderbox for additional information about our hack nights and other events. Also, please RSVP at the Tinderbox meetup.

Every 4 weeks we gather a diverse mix of developers and designers who want to code and collaborate for a couple of hours after work. 


Bring a project or enthusiasm for working on someone else's. If you want to give a short presentation or run a workshop, we have the facilities and completely welcome ad-hoc organization.

We are technology agnostic. However, we're most familiar with and will be the most help with Ruby, JavaScript, and Objective-C (iOS).

We kick off with a brief daily-style intro where everyone gives their name, says what they're working on and whether or not they want a hand... then we'll get our hack on. There will be at least a couple Carbon Five folks around to help out.

Doors open at 6p, kick-off at 6:30, doors close at 9:45. We provide the infrastructure, food, beverages and some helpful hands.

Feel free to run ideas by us if you're thinking about a preso or workshop. It's not required, but it'll help us make sure we have what you need.

Find out more at http://www.meetup.com/tinderbox.
name: Hack Night at Carbon Five

description:
Our TranscodeSF Co-Working Space & Study Group for folks that want to learn, mentor, and work together. We welcome all trans, gender non-conforming, and allies of all levels, beginners are encouraged to attend. You can move at your own pace in this group, so it doesn't matter if you are a fast or slow learner, or if you attend every week. We will have Open Source and other training materials that you can walk through with a TA and other members. You are also welcome to use your own materials, collaborate on side projects, or pitch a new idea. We meet every Wednesday from 6pm to 8pm at the SF LGBT Center. Free food is included, with gluten-free and vegetarian options. Please share and invite friends!

Format:

The space opens at 6pm, with check-in starting at 6:30pm. During the check-in members can share their goals, projects, questions, and partner on new ideas. At 7:30 members will have the opportunity to share back their work or pitch their project. Format is open to group discussion and suggestions. Hosted by SF LGBT Center - 1800 Market Street - SF, CA

About Transcode: TranscodeSF is a collaboration partnership with the SF LGBT Center’s Trans Employment Program (TEEI). The mission of TEEI is educating employers as well as connecting job seekers to trans friendly and sustainable employment. Additional TEEI services at the Center include one-on-one coaching and job search support for all trans* individuals.
name: TranscodeSF Co-Working Space

description:
You just bought a new camera:

Are you frustrated with your photography results? Are your images blurry, out of focus, or not as exposed as you would like them to be? Have you watched photography tutorials and videos online and you are still getting the same old poor results?

Join me as I walk you through some simple techiques you can use on your cameras  and how to apply them in automatic or manual in just 2 hours. You will also learn about the red flags to look for before you even make the image.

Details about the class:

This 2 hour class will better familiarize you with how your camera works and how you can use and apply the 3 most important functions shutter, aperture, and ISO on your camera. With this knowledge you will increase your ability to make more compelling photos.

You will learn and apply:

• Shutter Speed Operations

• Aperture Applications

• ISO

Class break down:

• 6:15 PM- 6:45 PM Shutter Speed Presentation and Application

• 6:50 PM- 7:20 PM Aperture Presentation and Application

• 7:25 PM- 7:45 PM Shutter Speed, Aperture, and ISO Application

• 7:50 PM- 8:00 PM Q & A

On the last Saturday of the month of August we will on location in Newark for a free special 2 hour workshop.

Requirements:

• Digital Camera

• Camera Lens

• Tripod (Optional)

• Pen or Pencil and a Note Pad

Class Fee: Free (Sponsored by NPC and DNP IMS America)

Keith B. Dixon is a commercial freelance photographer who specializes in corporate event photography, executive and company portraits, and editorial assignment work in the health care, computer technology, biotech, real estate, and construction industries. Keith’s worked has been published in various trade magazines in the San Francisco Bay Area, Sacramento, Nationally and abroad.  Keith has photographed US Chief Judges of the US Appellate Courts and several other Bay Area Executives and Celebrities. Keith primarily services the San Francisco Bay Area, Southern California and Seattle and all of the US.

Read photography articles by Keith on examiner.com

Every 4 weeks we gather a diverse mix of developers and designers who want to code and collaborate for a couple of hours after work.


Bring a project or enthusiasm for working on someone else's. If you want to give a short presentation or run a workshop, we have the facilities and completely welcome ad-hoc organization.

We are technology agnostic. However, we're most familiar with and will be the most help with Ruby, JavaScript, and Objective-C (iOS).

We kick off with a brief daily-style intro where everyone gives their name, says what they're working on and whether or not they want a hand... then we'll get our hack on. There will be at least a couple Carbon Five folks around to help out.

Doors open at 6p, kick-off at 6:30, doors close at 9:45. We provide the infrastructure, food, beverages and some helpful hands.

Feel free to run ideas by us if you're thinking about a preso or workshop. It's not required, but it'll help us make sure we have what you need.
how_to_find_us: Next to Kate 'o Brien's
name: Hack Night + Mobile App Tech Talk by Jordan Hamel

description:
Come hear funny and sometimes terrifying war stories about operating Hadoop at scale in production -- rogue user jobs that took over the cluster, tasks that suddenly stopped completing and disks that thrashed for days. There will be free drinks and food, and a chance to win an iPad mini.

We’ll be hosting a panel discussion with distinguished Hadoop veterans. They’ll share their war stories and what they learned and our CEO Sean Suchter will moderate the panel. 

AGENDA 
6:00 Arrive – Get thru building security, drinks & appetizers 
6:30 Kickoff – Introductions 
6:45 Panel discussion – Hadoop war stories 
7:30 Mingle 
8:00 iPad Mini Giveaway

Pepperdata was founded by former Yahoo and Microsoft executives Sean Suchter and Chad Carson, who bring real-world experience as the first users of large commercial Hadoop clusters at Yahoo, and then used large-scale, high-velocity data at Microsoft to join social data from Facebook and Twitter with Bing web search. More @pepperdata or http://www.pepperdata.com. We’re also hiring! Visit www.pepperdata.com/careers for more information.

PARKING

description:
Startup Finance: Valuation

About: Learn how to value a startup.

Finance is a powerful global force and valuation lies at its core. Valuation makes or breaks a company. It is critical to understand valuation as an investor, entrepreneur, consultant and employee.

There are many circumstances in which valuation is critical:

A. You are looking to raise funding for your company.

B. You are looking to invest in a startup.

C. You are looking to work for a startup and your success is tied to the startup’s success.

D. You are about to get paid in equity.

E. You are interested in selling your business.

This class is focused on startup valuation with entrepreneurial and non-public valuation needs in mind. We cover concepts such as pre-money, post money valuation and valuation equations used for private companies. We will be looking at Startup Valuation from the financial perspective. You can expect to walk away with a few equations and ideas on how to make financial projections.

This class is ideal for entrepreneurs, investors and anyone interested in working for or with a private company. Attendees to this seminar will walk away with a better understanding of the valuation process.  Attendees can expect to walk through a financial example of valuation.

Testimonials:

“This is one of the best finance classes I have ever taken.”

- Andrew

“I took the “Startup Finance Valuation” class; excellent job. This class is a must for all entrepreneurs. MBA classes do not teach how to value a startup, this class does.”

- Danny

“After taking this class I have a clear perspective on valuation. I recommend this class to all entrepreneurs. Thank you for a very informative class.”

- Bonnie

“I have been in banking for over 20 years and this class taught me valuable concepts not covered by all the classes I have taken throughout my career.”

- Yaakov

description:
Learn about the latest in audio research at Adobe and join your peers in the speech/music/audio signal processing industry in the bay area for drinks, bites and networking! 

This is a FREE event hosted by Adobe. Food, beer and wine will be provided courtesy of Adobe.

Agenda

6:30 - 7:15 Networking reception

7:15 – 7:20 Introduction to BISH Bash

7:20 – 7:55 Talk on audio research at Adobe, by Gautham Mysore


7:55 – 8:15 Shoutouts (introduce yourself, share any challenges you are currently facing, share hot new signal processing technology, ask questions about industry trends)

8:30 - 9:00 Networking reception continued

Talk Abstract


In addition to pixels, audio is of great interest to Adobe as it finds itself in a number of products such as Audition, Premiere, and now in consumer products such as Adobe Voice. In this talk, I will introduce Adobe Research and how it fits into the company. I will then discuss a few audio technologies that we have developed along with some demos.

Speaker Bio


Gautham Mysore is a senior research scientist at Adobe Research. He develops machine learning and signal processing algorithms for various audio applications. He received his Ph.D. and M.A. from the Center for Computer Research in Music and Acoustics (CCRMA) at Stanford University and his M.S. in Electrical Engineering also from Stanford. He is currently a member of the IEEE Technical Committee on Audio and Acoustic Signal Processing and a vice chair of the AES Technical Committee on Semantic Audio Analysis.


Parking

There is generally some amount of street parking in the area. There are also a few parking garages on Townsend St. as well as King St. (between 7th and 8th St.).
name: BISH Bash bi-monthly meetup: Hosted by Adobe

We have to be prompt because they *usually* get to go home at 7 but will stay until 7:30 for us. I tipped $7 today. I'll probably tip $10 the night of for a total of $45. But, hey, that's still only $9/week if the darn pedi lasts 5 weeks, right?!

description:
Maptime is, rather literally, time for mapmaking. Our mission is to open the doors of cartographic possibility to anyone interested by creating a time and space for collaborative learning, exploration, and map creation using mapping tools and technologies.

This open learning environment for all levels and degrees of knowledge offers intentional support for the beginner. Maptime is simultaneously flexible and structured, creating space for workshops, ongoing projects with a shared goal, and independent/collaborative work time.

Inspiration for Maptime comes from both hack nights and knitting circles. Both are models of spaces for people to create and learn together. Our goal is to provide this space with an open heart and without pretension. You can bring your own projects to work on, or just hang out and socialize or ask questions. Some people are experts, and some people are just getting started, but all of us are learning, so why not do it together?

Maptime is hands-on, so don't forget to bring your laptop!

We also have plenty of bike parking upstairs, so no need to leave your bike at street level.


For more information about Maptime, visit maptime.io. Also, follow us on twitter at @MaptimeSF.
name: Maptime!

description:
RSVP on EventBrite


Recent years have seen the rise of companies that serve well-established needs in people’s lives with novel supply chains built on the resources and hard work of individuals rather than faceless corporations.

AirBnB provides travel accommodation by aggregating rooms, apartments and houses from individuals around the world. Good Eggs provides home groceries by aggregating food available directly from local farmers and foodmakers. Lyft provides daily transportation by connecting passengers to people with cars and spare time.

Travel accommodation, groceries and transportation are age-old needs. These companies are serving them in new ways with hybrid online/offline services that build on the ubiquity of internet technology to organize complex supply systems into simple-to-use services for their customers.

How do you design and deploy a brand across digital and physical experiences? How do you provide a consistent customer experience when much of the product experience is provided by a third party?

Join us for a conversation on the challenges, learnings and opportunities in designing for these kinds of services.

This event is a panel discussion with leaders in design from AirBnb, Good Eggs and Lyft.

Andrew Schapiro, Design Lead, AirBnB
Robin Bigio, Creative Director, Good Eggs
Frank Yoo, Director of Product Design, Lyft

Doors open at 6:30pm for great nourishing local snacks and drink from Good Eggs producers. Panel discussion starts at 7:30pm. Doors close at 9:30pm.

RSVP on EventBrite
name: A Conversation on Service Design with AirBnB, Good Eggs and Lyft

description:
Women in the Bay Area - join us on August 6th for our eighth conversation of 2014, with actress Elisa Donovan. This month we'll be talking about Authenticity, and this promises to be a thought-provoking and inspiring conversation. 


Reserve seats here: http://www.rosiesdaughters.org/calendar/2014/8/6/a-conversation-about-authenticity-with-elisa-donovan

The proceeds from your ticket, along with some help from our sponsor, cover food and drinks, so come hungry! If you would like to attend but can't afford ticket costs, scholarships are available by emailing [masked].

About Elisa Donovan

Elisa played the role of feisty fashion-victim Amber in the pop culture Paramount Pictures feature-film Clueless. She went on to reprise her role for three seasons in the follow-up television series. Next, she performed on three seasons of the ABC/WB TV-series Sabrina The Teenage Witch. She has had recurring roles on Beverly Hills 90210, Judging Amy, and Jack & Jill. Among many film roles, she was notably featured alongside Will Ferrell in another comedy classic feature film, A Night at The Roxbury. In 2013, Elisa was voted "Reader/Fan Favorite" by People magazine for her celebrity Mommy blog (http://celebritybabies.people.com/category/elisa-donovan-blog/). Elisa was also hand-picked by Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg to be the voice for the audiobook of her #1 bestseller Lean In and Lean In for Graduates. The audiobook was #1 on the charts for many months and submitted by the publisher for a Grammy nomination. In addition to her acting career, Elisa also assists in counseling and supporting women struggling with eating disorders, and is a proponent of spreading awareness and recovery. She has had pieces published in the Chicken Soup for the Soul series as well as having her anorexia recovery story featured in the book Feeding the Fame and documented for TEEN People. Elisa has spoken about recovery on many television shows, including 20/20, Entertainment Tonight, Access Hollywood, and Dr. Drew's Headline News.
name: A Conversation about Authenticity with Actress Elisa Donovan

description:
THE RUN:
This week's 3.9-mile loop visits urban parks Jefferson Square and Civic Center Plaza.  It also briefly parallels the Central Freeway, challenging you to figure out why the same street needs three different names: Duboce, 13th, and Division.
Click here for the printable full-size map.

THE BAR:
This week's bar was doubly recommended by Emile and Ken!  It opened last year and has an old saloon vibe in a new package.  It has two entrances, meet on Polk St.
Drinks: full bar with 14 taps.  Birthday shots for Barry & Jamie!
Payment: cash, credit cards ($25 minimum)
Serves food: yes, BBQ until 1am!  menu link
Allows outside food: no
  Still have questions? Check the FAQ, then ask away!  #1 most frequent question: Is there somewhere to store my stuff during the run? No. Store your ID and beer money in your pocket. Don't bring any other "stuff."
name: Run & chug 8/6

description: Let me know of suitable venues in SF or East Bay for our monthly meetup!
name: Bots & Beer - Silicon Valley

description:
With over 200,000 subscribers to her YouTube channel, come hear Jaclyn Glenn talk about atheism in person! She will show you ways to de-stigmatize the word, and help you learn how make atheism a positive thing! 

She begins her discussion with her journey out of childhood indoctrination and ends with her rise to YouTube stardom, giving straight talk all along the way helping us all learn how to deal with relatives, co-workers or even strangers, despite your possible hesitation or incomplete readiness. She helps us all cope in this society as atheists, and helps some of those on the fence get past their fear. You’ll be glad you came! 

See more about Jaclyn here: http://jaclynglenn.com/about/


Come early to have dinner and drinks, meet Jaclyn, talk with friends and meet new members before Jaclyn's presentation begins at 7:15 PM.

As we are helping to pay for her travel and speaking fee, there will be a $10 charge at the door. No Brown Paper Tickets this time, just bring a little cash. Supporting these events will allow us to do even more in the future, so thank you all for that!

More media with Jaclyn:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ei_8ZlLGtQw&feature=youtu.be

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q2hZQZ4GwFw&feature=youtu.be
name: Jaclyn Glenn: "Make Atheism a Positive Thing"

description:
Dear San Francisco IGDA Members,

We are thrilled to present a Matthias Worch of 2K Games at Dolby Labs on Wednesday, August 6th at 7:00 PM.

Title: Decisions That Matter - Meaningful Choice in Game and Level Design

Description:

Why is a game "a series of interesting decisions"? What is "orthogonal unit differentiation" and why is it important? Meaningful choice is one of the staples of good and compelling game design, but as a concept it is still poorly understood. This talk from the Game Developers Conference in 2014 is a detailed exploration of choice in games: why it is important, how it ties into the psychological underpinnings of why we play games, and how it connects to other fundamental game design concepts like the space of possibility, motivation, player agency and the actual level design of a game. Viewers will leave with a deeper appreciation of how games become fun and compelling at a fundamental level.

Matthias Worch  | Design Director, 2K Games
Matthias is the design director at a new studio at 2K Games in Novato, where he is overseeing the design effort on an unannounced game. Over the last 16 years, Matthias has worked in design, technical art and project management roles at LucasArts, EA, Factor 5, Legend Entertainment and Ritual Entertainment. Past titles include Star Wars: 1313, Dead Space 2, Star Wars: Rogue Squadron and Unreal 2. http://www.worch.com

Location:
Dolby Laboratories Inc.
100 Potrero Ave, San Francisco, CA
http://maps.google.com/maps?q=maps+dolby+labs&ie=UTF8&oe=utf-8&client=firefox-a&ll=37.768773,-122.406514&spn=0.007947,0.009602&t=h&z=17&iwloc=A&layer=c&cbll=37.768269,-122.40778 

That's the brick Dolby building and not the glass one! 

For information regarding wheelchair access please contact: [masked].

-The San Francisco IGDA Organizers-

</a> <a href="http://www.twitter.com/IGDA_SF"> 
The San Francisco IGDA is sponsored by:
</a> <a href="http://usa.autodesk.com/media-entertainment/games/">
name: IGDA San Francisco Event: Matthias Worch, 2K Games

group.name: The San Francisco Photography Meetup Group

description:
Let's meet our old friends at the Crossroads Cafe for a nibble and sip after work!
We'll talk about our Photographic New Adventures while looking at each other's work.

As this venue is a bit loud, don't expect a "talk" or "speech" or "shoot"; but rather to chat, mingle, review one another work and discuss our photo opportunities.

Please Note:
This is a Public Meetup - Images brought and shared should be of a public nature!

IE: publishable on a Billboard in the US.  Nothing beyond an R Rating should be presented at our group meetings, please.  If you would like to share stronger images, please vet your viewer and do so outside of the SF Photography Meetup Group.
Thanks.

Our Meetup is NOT intended to be a place for Marketing or Business Promotion, but rather a gathering of like minds to discuss the Art and Technology of photography. Folks are welcome to leave literature or fliers regarding upcoming events or services offered on the sign-up table and answer questions only. Presentations or other sales/marketing should be set up at least one week in advance though the meeting host. This will encourage continued comradery and discourage aggressive marketing at future meetups, ensuring a collaborative environment for all. Thanks.

Please bring your book(s), your portfolio, pictures or new toy/gadget to share with the group.

Bring an image that inspires you...
An image that you really want to make...
Maybe you don't know how, or need someone to go with you to hold a reflector or light.
If you want to know how someone made their awesome photo now's your chance to find out.

Don't have a book yet? Bring a Print!
Come be inspired to build a portfolio, see what others have done and learn how you can build your own!

Don't have a Print?
Bring and image (magazine or book, printed off the web?) that inspires you - one that you'd want to make!

digitalShe's directions to Crossroads Cafe, here:
Cafe in a bookstore at the End of Delancy Street, note, there is generally parking - though now you're gonna pay for it all evening.
Delancy is crossed by Brannan and just off the Embarcadero.

From S Bay: Exit 280 at 6th St, follow 6th two blocks and turn right on Brannan St. Keep driving, it's a long ways... Delancy is the last street on the Right from the Embarcadero.

From E Bay: Exit @ 5th St and turn LEFT onto 5th. Follow for two bocks and turn Left at Brannan St, follow to Delancy Street and turn Right.

Muni: Take the N-Juda or the T/K link.
Exit @ The Embarcadero & Brannan St‎ Station, walk south toward the AT&T Park and look for a Cafe called "Towns End" in neon... Crossroads is the little grassy gated area directly across from this cafe... look for the small bookstore at the end of the block in the cul-de-sac, that's the cafe!

BTW - Be sure to say "Hey, Thanks!" to the staff that let us hang out!
Plan to grab a bite here! Crossroads has light snacks, dinners and deserts along with assorted beverages.  A nice place to relax and mull over this photo stuff with other chill folks...
how_to_find_us: Look for the Name Badge!
name: The San Francisco Photography Meetup Group Monthly Meetup

description: The Poisonwood Bible is a story told by the wife and four daughters of Nathan Price, a fierce, evangelical Baptist who takes his family and mission to the Belgian Congo in 1959. They carry with them everything they believe they will need from home, but soon find that all of it—from garden seeds to Scripture—is calamitously transformed on African soil. What follows is a suspenseful epic of one family's tragic undoing and remarkable reconstruction over the course of three decades in postcolonial Africa.
name: The Poisonwood Bible by Barbara Kingsolver

description:
Here's one of our basic wire classes for those who have completed the first two courses in our GINA 3 series to be held on the first Wednesday of each month. 

----------------------------------------------------------------

Prerequisite for this class is the successful completion of Jewelry Making Basics -Beginners Level 1 and Level 2 - Sorry, no exceptions

----------------------------------------------------------------

Wires swirl gracefully in a herringbone pattern around a lovely dark colored bead. This is the herringbone weave, and it is great way to develop great wire "control".  Join us for a two hour class in making this lovely wired bracelet.  Above is just one of THREE versions that will be taught in class.

 

Here's What You'll Need to Bring:

1 Flat Nose Plier

1 Found Nose Plier

1 Chain Nose Plier

1 Flush or Side Cutters

1 Bead Mat

8-10 Beads about 10 mm in size (this is ia 10 millimeter bead, not a size 8 or size 11 sead bead)

1 Beadsmith Coil 20 Gauge Silver Coated Wire or copper wire

1 Beadsmith Coil 24 or 26 Gauge Silver Coated Wire or copper wire or colored craft wire

 

So join me in making a great herringbone bracelet!!
how_to_find_us: Across from the Stevens Creek Nissan Dealership and at the corner of Stevens Creek & Albany
name: GINA 3 - Beaded and Wired Herringbone Bracelet

description:
Last year, the New York Times printed an article entitled “Generation LGBTQIA” that focused on young gay identity and new terminology trends at colleges and gay community help groups. There seems to be a growing need to be clearer and more specific aboutidentities that have previously clumped under LGBT.

According the NY Times reporter, “part of the solution has been to add more letters, and in recent years the post-post-post-gay-rights banner has gotten significantly longer, some might say unwieldy. The emerging rubric is “L.G.B.T.Q.I.A.,” which stands for different things, depending on whom you ask.”

Do you know what all the letters mean? Let’s explore together diverse identities within the gay community. How connected are you to those within our community who are differently gay and how much mutual support do we give and receive?

What about coalition building with other communities beyond the rainbow flag?  What commonalities do we have with other communities and what may be some of our differences?  Let’s share our experiencewith living our identity and having it more widely understood and appreciated. Who are our allies and who have we had more difficulty reaching?

Discussion Questions:

1. What do we all the groups under the rainbow flaghave in common? How are we different?

2. How does our life experience differ?

3. What relationships do you have with each of the other groups under the rainbow flag?

4. What groups do you want to have more knowledge and understanding of?

5. How connected are you to those within our community who are differently gay and how much mutual support do we give and receive?

6. a. How do you feel about the NY Times reporter’s observation that there seems to be a growing need to be clearer and more specific about identities that have previously clumped under LGBT and the solution has been to add more letters?

6. b. According the NY Times reporter, “part of the solution has been to add more letters, and in recent years the post-post-post-gay-rights banner has gotten significantly longer, some might say unwieldy.

7. The LGBTTIQQ acronym- stands for Lesbian Gay Bisexual Transgender Intersexual Queer and Questioning and is meant to be an inclusive term for those who have often been discriminated against and/or marginalized.

8. UC Davis LGBTQIA Resource Center defines an ally as “ a person who confronts heterosexism, sexism, homophobia, biphobia, transphobia and heterosexual privilege in themselves and others out of self-interest and a concern for the well being of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, intersex and asexual people and believes that dismantling heterosexism, biphobia, transphobia and genderism/cis-sexism is a social justice issue.”

Based on this definition, whom do you see asyour allies and whom do you not see as yourallies?

9. What about coalition building with other communities beyond the rainbow flag? Shareyour experience with living your identity and having it more widely understood and appreciated. Who are your allies and who haveyou had more difficulty reaching?

10. In your opinion, what is needed to gain individuals and groups as allies?
name: Allies – Those Under the Rainbow Flag & Coalition Building w/ Other Communities

description:
On First Wednesdays, SCV Knitting Meetup meets at Peet's for knitting and show & tell of recent finished objects. Come ask questions, come show off, but what ever you do, come knit with us

We sit inside at Peet's in Saratoga -- we have to move some tables and chairs around to accommodate our large group in their small space.

Please note that Peet's does NOT serve dinner -- just delicious coffee, tea, and munchers. Remember it is only right that we patronize the venues that host us. Please buy something from the meetup location!

Happy knitting,
-spinnity / mary / organizer


*******

WHO ARE WE: SCV Knitting Meetup is a loosely organized group of knitters who meet around the valley on Wednesday nights to stitch together. New knitters, new members, knitters of all ages, abilities, and inclinations are welcome.
how_to_find_us: Look for the group of people with sticks!
name: First Wednesday Knitting Meetup

description:
This is a two-hour step-by-step class that teaches you how to paint a masterpiece! Even if you are not very artistic (I'm definitely not), everyone's painting ends up look amazing. We'll be painting the golden gate bridge...check out the details here: http://www.paintnite.com/pages/events/view/alameda/833291.

The class is usually $45, but Living Social has a deal for $25 ( http://www.livingsocial.com/deals/1102169-two-hour-social-painting-event-from-paint-nite?ref=mobile-email-share-post-purchase&rpi=164936914&rui=195604253). I suggest purchasing your tickets in advance, because the classes usually sell out.

They have pretty good prices for food & drinks. Come early if you want to eat or get a drink before the class starts. I'll probably get there at about 6:00.

I can't wait!
name: Paint Nite: Golden Gate

description:
Are you a single man or woman frustrated about how to meet people? Or how to take the first meeting to a first date?

Or maybe you are ina relationship, and want to learn tools, which can make you even more attractive to your partner.

What if you had easy tools that gave you the confidence and skills to create rapport and magnetic attraction?

Come join us for this fun, interactive 2-hr CO-ED mixer where you will learn:

*How to build easy rapport with any stranger you meet.

*Find out about "the inner game" that gives you the confidence to become a magnet to the opposite sex.

*Learn the biggest key to attraction.

*Learn the #1 thing women need from a man to open up.

*Learn the #1 thing that men need from a women to be attracted and stay attracted.

AND...

Experience powerful Neuroscience, NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) Re-
patterning exercises to work with your brain to begin to effortlessly shift any limiting beliefs that are keeping you from meeting and attracting the opposite sex.

Admission: Price: $20 on Meetup until 6 pm on Monday, August 5th. / Price: $25 on Meetup thereafter. $25-$35 sliding scale at the door.

This 2-hr workshop is a meetup collaboration between Meriana Dinkova, the organizer of Sex Magic and Tim Gallagher, the organizer of Magnetic Man - Irresistible Attraction For Men Dating Women.

SEX Magic http://www.meetup.com/SexMagicSF/

Magnetic Man - Irresistible Attraction For Men Dating Women Meetup Groups
http://www.meetup.com/Magnetic-Man-Irresistible-Attraction/

The Facilitators:

Meriana Dinkova is a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (MTF Lic#45696) and Life- and Relationship Coach. She works with individuals and couples in her private practice in SF, the East Bay and over Skype. She facilitates workshops and retreats in the US and internationally. For the last 18 years she has studied and practiced a variety of tantric, meditative and therapeutic methods involving the connection between spirit and body and the ways our attention influences our experience, particularly in the realms of connection, mindfulness and sensuality. For more info go to http://www.merianadinkova.com 

Tim Gallagher: As a dating and relationship expert, Tim Gallagher's passion in life is to help singles to be more successful at dating and relationships. His extensive background, experience and expertise as an Neuroscience NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) practitioner allows him to provide his clients with much more than dating and relationship coaching, tips or techniques. What he offers is what he refers to as " Inner Game" personal transformation, allowing his clients to "feel" their confidence, charisma, presence through integrated internal states. This unique process is both permanent and effortless and allows his clients to naturally exude highly attractive qualities without having to think or "act" a certain way. Along with inner game personal transformation, Tim's Magnetic Man Program helps men better understand attraction and women, including their relationship needs – what they think, how they act, and what they really want. His series of Magnetic Man courses empowers men to make healthy, informed choices when it comes to dating and relationships.

Tim works primarily with those whom he resonates most with - men who possess strong values, unquestionable integrity, and a healthy attitude towards women. Through his dating and relationship courses and VIP 1-On-1 High-Impact Breakthrough Sessions, Tim offers something for any man who wants Inner Game personal transformation and to be successful with dating and relationships. For more information about Tim or the services that he offers, please visit <a>www.nlpsfca or</a>

<a>"></a>http://theattractioninstitute.com/magnetic-man/
name: NLP Tools For Overcoming The Fear Of Meeting & Attracting The Opposite Sex

group.name: The Bay Area Spiritual Experiences Group

description:
"Each activity contains within it the seed of a spiritual lesson." The Spiritual Life, How to Live it Everyday, Harold Klemp, p. 115

Every event in our lives has a lesson and/or blessing for us. Discover ways to unearth those gems of wisdom each day.  

You are welcome to any of our free Wednesday night spiritual exploration classes. Each Wednesday night class gives you tips and daily spiritual exercises to try. Join in the discussions, try out the exercises, share your experiences, or just listen.


You are welcome to come to any or all Wednesday night classes and stay as long as you like. All classes are free.
how_to_find_us: www.eck-ca.org
name: Spiritual Exploration: What is Life Teaching Me Now?

description:
4v4 pickup (4 simultaneous games if there are enough folks). Second session begins at 8pm. Each session is one hour long. Teams are capped at 5 per side to ensure playing time for folks. Substitutions are enforced by the facilitator every 2 minutes so playing time is even spread evenly and everyone can just focus on having fun playing rather than worry about who's going to come out to make room for them. :)

The vibe is laid back and fun. Like all SoccerFours sessions, teams are made up at the field, and scores aren't kept. There are no leagues. It's just organized pickup soccer run by a facilitator. $6/person for the session. RSVP here and bring cash to the field or sign up on our main site if you'd like. (If the slots here are full, try our main site to see if there are any left.)

Let's have some fun! :)
name: Wednesday SoccerFours 8PM

description:
NOTE: This event is every Wednesday! (Note - the date will automatically change to next week as it gets close to the event starting time because this event is recurring, but this crawl still happens every Wednesday at 8:30!)

We will be joining my other group and picking up a groups of backpackers from local hostels - here is the main event link: http://www.meetup.com/San-Francisco-things-to-do/events/82926222/

Hi everyone - There's a pub crawl run by volunteers at hostels in SF so that there's a place for backpackers and locals to meet each other. The event gets a bunch of travelers from all over the city along with locals. Come join us, have some drinks, and meet some new peeps. When you arrive, tell the girl at the door you're with the meet up so that everyone can find each other. RSVP is required for planning purposes. Thanks!

Here's the INFO:

We do a weekly rock-paper-scissors tournament pub crawl on Wednesdays. Everyone competes while moving from bar-to-bar so that it's easy to meet new people. Winner of the tournament gets a bar tab. We mainly get about 50-60 backpackers who are staying at hostels around the city.

Free to enter Rock Paper Scissors Tournament & Free Pub Crawl with drink special purchase.

Tournament champion wins a bar tab. Drink Special: Get drink coupons at the first bar so that wells and premium beers are $3 or $3.50 throughout the night. Prizes for best athletic wear.


--> Compete in Rock Paper Scissors tournament qualifying rounds while moving from bar to bar.

 --> Top players from qualifying rounds plus several wild card players compete at the final bar. Champion receives a bar tab.

 --> Dance Party following tournament.

'Like' us on Facebook *and* RSVP you're attending and get a $1


LIKE US HERE: https://www.facebook.com/beerpubcrawl 

RSVP HERE: https://www.facebook.com/events/175140762606215/

WHEN: Every WEDNESDAY! WHERE: Meet at NORTHSTAR - 1560 Powell St. (near the corner of Green St), SF 

TIME: Signup at 8:30PM. ***YOU MUST ARRIVE BY 9PM TO COMPETE in the rock paper scissors tournament. Pub crawlers/non-tournament players also welcome.
name: Drinks with International Travelers

description:
Meet at MP summit on 6:30am (请注意是山顶聚集时间)
Find more details at https://www.facebook.com/events/699305720128073/

The sunrise occurs at 5:58am.
Mission Peak Weather Forecast: Clear 70F ~ 79F

Starting from Stanford Gate, the round trip is about 6 miles, elevation gain 2000ft.

Notes:
1. The place to meet is the MP SUMMIT, not any trailhead. 2. You may have your own pace in ascending, so, start at the time with your defined pace. Most of our MP lovers starting around 5:40am from Stanford gate. 2. NEVER use the shortcuts and closed trails!
3. Headlight or flashlight is recommended in Winter.
4. You are more than welcome to bring your favorite hiking, backpacking or camping gears with you, and have a show on the MP summit. At most times, there will be food and drinks with team to support your show.

MPWF
http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mission-peak/forecasts/76

Horse heaven trail:
http://www.everytrail.com/guide/horse-heaven-trail-to-mission-peak

Trail route in Google Maps (alternative trail):
http://goo.gl/maps/OIsO

Trailhead address for newbie:
2000 Stanford Ave
Fremont, CA 94539
(37.50433,-121.9083)
name: Mission Peak Sunrise hike Thursday #110

group.name: Walnut Creek, Lafayette & Concord Business Networking

description:
Join us for free at one of our highly-innovative business-networking meetings - in your city! View our full calendar of business-networking meetings. We welcome anyone to attend a GoRampUp! meeting, once, for free as our guest, so you can learn what the innovative GoRampUp! business-networking experience is all about. Note, we are not able to give you a free meeting at more than one of our many locations.

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting athttp://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance. Without this ticket you will, unfortunately, be declined access to our innovative and exclusive business-networking meeting. WITH a GoRampUp! Golden Ticket, you will be welcomed with open arms!

It can be too difficult to attract new clients. We help you fix that! We're a business-impact community. We're informal and fun, yet, by design, we're extremely effective!

We help people who work for a living to get a much greater payoff from working. We do this in three specific ways under our three CoreSuccess Platforms: 1) We help you move toward mastery with business-networking, 2) We help you move toward mastery with business performance, and, 3) We help you move toward mastery with personal development.

How do we deliver on this promise to our community members? Each month we conduct dozens of business-networking meetings in more than a dozen cities in the SF Bay Area. A member may attend all of our "OpenConnect" business-networking meetings. And our members are welcome and encouraged to attend any and all of these meetings and locations.

Each month we introduce and emphasize a learning and development subject under each of our three CoreSuccess Platforms. For each of the three learning and development subjects that we introduce and emphasize each month, we give you four different ways to learn it: We produce written learning guides, video learning guides, audio learning guide, and we cover the subjects as 15-to-20-minute mini-workshops inside of our 60-minute business-networking meetings. There's no registration or initiation fee to join. Membership in GoRampUp! is month to month. You enroll when you like, even mid-month, and you depart when you like.

Be sure to see our website to learn about our generous enrollment incentives

Also, be sure to learn about our 100-Satisfaction Money-Back Guarantee

Would you care to come to this meeting, at no cost, to see if there’s business-value for you?

• Free-Meeting Guest-RSVP and Golden Ticket Request

• View complete meeting details

• Invite a Buddy to join you

One last thing: You REALLY should check out actual testimonial videos by our members: See them here

This page was created to produce awareness of our event. However, OUR PAGES ON THIS SITE CAN BECOME OUTDATED. The authoritative source for our meeting dates/times is http://www.GoRampUp.com/calendar. Be sure to check it prior to traveling to a meeting.
how_to_find_us: We'll be in the back room past the bar.

description:

description:
The Silicon Valley Entrepreneurs Toastmasters Club welcomes all entrepreneurs, engineers, professionals and students to join the meetings. Please join us if you want to enhance your professional leadership effectiveness and improve your public speaking and communication skills.

Agenda:

11:45 pm: Open for Registration
11:50 pm: Networking
12:00 pm: Toastmasters Meeting
1:00   pm: Adjourn

Every last Thursday of the month, we have a "pitch training session" specially designed for entrepreneurs and startup founders.


Why Should You Join Toastmasters?

Everyone has their own personal reasons for joining Toastmasters, but here are a few of the most common:

Become a Better Public Speaker
Members work through a series of educational programs (at their own pace) designed to improve their ability to write speeches, design presentations, and deliver them.

Overcome Public Speaking Fears
The most positive and supportive audience in the world is a Toastmasters club audience. Speaking regularly in front of a group helps you calm your nerves and communicate effectively.

“Practice” Presentations for Other Audiences
Everyone has different motivations for wanting to speak better. Maybe you want to hone your presentation skills for your career. Perhaps you want to be able to speak out in your volunteer organization. Maybe you want to complement your portfolio as an author, manager, or other professional with speaking gigs? Whatever the case, Toastmasters is a wonderful laboratory for you to practice your presentations and gain valuable feedback.

Gain the Confidence and Courage to Lead
Leadership and communication skills are intimately bound. Some might argue that leadership is nothing more than the ability to effectively communicate a vision. As your communication skills improve, your ability to lead will improve as well.

???
Many Six Minutes readers are Toastmasters, so I’ll pass this question to you.
Why did you join?
What advice would you pass to someone considering joining?
 Let us know in the comments.
name: Silicon Valley Entrepreneurs Toastmasters Open Meeting

description:
We have planned an exciting Networking and Educational Gathering at a member's office in San Francisco.

Dr. Kirsten Hill presents ~ How to Align Your Body, Heart & Soul: A Path to Health & Happiness ~An Interactive Presentation with Dr. Kirsten Hill of Dance With Life ChiropracticAt this workshop, you will learn . . .· How to stop creating stress and find joy instead· Strategies for resolving health challenges & pain by clearing them at the root · Daily self-care practices to cultivate greater energy & well-being in your life. 


Dr. Kirsten Hill founded Dance With Life Chiropractic Family Wellness Center in 2007 with the goal of helping people rediscover health, well-being and passion for life. Dance With Life Chiropractic is the Inner Sunset’s premier wellness center, specializing in health services and education for ambitious professionals, athletes and dancers, busy families with children, and anyone who is ready for a fresh approach to healthcare.  As a licensed chiropractor since 2004, Dr. Kirsten has a gentle approach to hands-on care that facilitates deep healing by restoring balance in the spine and nervous system. Her practice skills include release of pain, core health support, injury and trauma recovery, emotional well-being, pre-natal care and pediatric adjustments.  Dr. Kirsten believes that internal alignment with our life’s purpose and personal values is a vital part of sustaining physical alignment and health. Thus, her chiropractic mission is to bring people to a state of wholeness on all levels–body, heart and soul.  As a wellness speaker, Dr. Kirsten helps people discover new insights about healthy living, gather practical tools for self-care, and enrich their lives.  Dr. Kirsten earned her chiropractic degree from Life Chiropractic College West and also holds a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Texas.  When not busy adjusting or inspiring people, Dr. Kirsten “dances with life” by spending time with her husband and daughter, studying languages, cooking, reading and walking.

Our program also includes a meal and more networking.
Be sure to bring your business brochures and lots of business cards for our networking time when we build community as we get to know each other. Fees: $15.00 Standing Members; $20.00 Non-members.

description:
Join us for an AFTERNOON of HANDS ON CREATIVITY, ENGINEERING, and IMAGINATION! BOYS and GIRLS are invited to come create with ROOMINATE! Have your little one LEARN as they PLAY!

On Thurs. 8/7 from 3-6 pm, drop by anytime! We invite your child and you to come and CREATE with ROOMINATE.

ROOMINATE is hosting this wonderful playdate and we want to invite you and the whole family to come on out and learn through hands on play. Let's show you how it all works!

Through hands on play, we'll have stations with modular building pieces so they can build whatever their heart desires, a station to build furniture to add to their structures, another station where they will learn about motors, lights and circuits so they can make their structure come to LIFE while learning about the engineering that is involved and another station for them to decorate their creation.

 Intro Talk and Welcome Chat will take place every hour at 3:15 pm, 4:15 pm, 5:15 pm.

Come build a structure, with stairs, a balcony, and even spiral staircases! Then design furniture, from bunk beds, ping pong tables and more! Then the best part about ROOMINATE is adding the working circuits, by wiring up everything from spinning windmills, to merry-go-rounds, even elevators and more to make it light up! We will also share a bit of history & how parts get made, with a station called "Roominate through the ages!"

There's a bunch of old prototypes so kids can see the process of making pieces and how it started from laser cutting to injection molding. EVENT COST: FREE! If your Child enjoys the product and so do you, ROOMINATE'S kits will be available for purchase on site so that your child can continue to develop their creativity and engineering savvy at HOME!

Want to purchase so your child can continue to create, learn and build?

Basic Roominate kit $30*

2 for $55

Deluxe Roominate kit $50*

2 for $90 Free $15 value of additional pieces with every purchase

*Same price as on Amazon

WHAT is ROOMINATE? WHAT is the PRODUCT ALL ABOUT?

Roominate, toys to inspire the next generation of innovation. Roominate is a wired building system for children that inspires creative learning and empowers innovative open-ended play. It develops skills crucial to future success in STEM: hands-on problem solving, spatial and fine motor skills, self-confidence, and creativity.


Roominate is an innovative combination of building, circuits, design, and creativity that allows for endless creations. Roominate kits come with modular building pieces and motor and light circuits that kids can wire up to create spinning windmills, carousels, and lamps! With Roominate, kids can build anything they can imagine: dollhouses, schools, amusement parks, and more.

Roominate teaches through hands-on play. Every kit is completely open-ended, which encourages girls to learn by doing. Every child makes something completely unique with Roominate, from the golden gate bridge, to spinning car washes, even a rocket ship!

With Roominate, every child is an inventor. You can see the breadth of ideas here: http://www.roominatetoy.com/young-inventors/

Kids love Roominate because they can build anything they want. Parents and teachers love Roominate because they know that kids are learning as they play. It’s completely open-ended and kids are coming up with things we never would have dreamed of!

Website: roominatetoy.com Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/roominatetoy
name: PLAYDATE! Come DESIGN, LEARN & CREATE w/ ROOMINATE

Click here to REGISTER NOW</a>. This is a paid event. Meetup RSVP will NOT be considered registration for the event.

Online Pricing:
Members - Free
Non Members - $20

Onsite Pricing:
Members - $20
Non Members - $30


Do you want to become someone who can move and inspire others with innovative ideas, turn those ideas into reality, then create a dedicated group of friends, fans and followers to help you replicate and scale those ideas into sustainable change? This is the work of a thought leader. In this program, we'll explore what it takes to be a thought leader and why it matters and explore the behaviors and characteristics of successful thought leaders.

Audience members will learn how to:

• Use thought leadership to gain visibility for you, your team and your ideas across your company, community or an entire industry.
• Gain inspiration and best practices from the stories of others who advanced their careers through thought leadership.
• Create a plan to become more ‘discoverable’ this year.

AGENDA:
6:00 PM - Registration, Dinner & Networking
7:00 PM - Program
8:15 PM - Q & A
9:00 PM- Adjourn

Speaker:
Denise Brosseau is the CEO of Thought Leadership Lab where she consults with fast-track entrepreneurs, executives and their teams on how to increase their influence, expand their impact and become recognized for their big ideas. She is the author of Ready to Be a Thought Leader? and a frequent keynote speaker and trainer for companies, conferences and associations.

Denise is a serial entrepreneur who co-founded Springboard Enterprises – the women’s startup launch pad that has led to over $6.5B in funding for women entrepreneurs. She was also the founding CEO of the Forum for Women Entrepreneurs (now Watermark) and the co-founder of the Invent Your Future Conference. Denise was honored in 2012 by the White House as a Champion of Change and by the Silicon Valley Business Times as a 2014 Top 100 Woman of Influence in Silicon Valley.

Learn more about her book at <a href="http://www.thoughtleadershiplab.com">www.thoughtleadershiplab.com and follow Denise on twitter: @thoughtleadrlab
name: Are You Ready to Be a Thought Leader?

Look-a-thon


Come hack with Looker founder Lloyd Tabb. All participants will work as a team using Looker to generate unique and useful insights from the DonorsChoose.org dataset. Sign up in advance for the Look-a-thon to get a sneak peek at the dataset; then join us at 4 PM on Aug 7th to share your findings.

Office Hours

Get 1:1 time with Looker analysts between 4 PM - 6:30 PM to get answers to any questions you may have about Looker or LookML. Create dashboards with our new charting library, develop advanced metrics, or find new insights in Explore. Come ask an analyst.


Bring a friend

description:
Confirmed RSVPs have priority.

Come and play tennis at Fremont High School!

Players of all levels are welcome, especially 3+ players. Play is courteous, self-organized, with orientation from the organizer, to keep games/skills more or less even and maximize the fun. You are expected to follow the lead of the organizer when pairing up players or waiting, if it comes to that. We can play singles or doubles depending on the availability of courts.

We expect all people that RSVP to attend. We ask that you change your RSVP by 2pm if you cannot attend the event. No-shows will probably lead to not being allowed to participate in future events.

Please try to be there on time. If you are early, try getting courts (starting on the leftmost court is best). Attendees to the meetup are expected to bring their own balls. Fresh balls for play are encouraged.

The meetup goes on until everyone is depleted, often after 9 or 9:30pm.

Waitlist: What do you do if you are in the waitlist? You should definitely plan to attend the event, but 45 to 60 minutes from the start. At that time, things start to ease and spots open up. We ask that you always wait outside, at the entrance, until the next re-shuffle of partners or a court opens up. In the rare event that there are a lot of people waiting due to lack of courts, confirmed RSVPs have priority, but even then we will try to shuffle everyone in.


Parking: The courts and parking are on the West Fremont Ave. entrance (about a block in from the Sunnyvale-Saratoga road), inside, after 9 rows of parking spots.

This is a sister event to the "Tuesday Tennis in Sunnyvale" meetup.
how_to_find_us: Ask a couple of people if they are with the meetup group.
name: Thursday Tennis in Sunnyvale

description:
Nick Gorski will be joining us to give a talk about the Data Science involved in personalized marketing.  Note this talk will be held at TellApart, which is in Burlingame (right next to Burlingame Caltrain).  I hope to see many of you there!

Abstract
This will be a technical deep-dive into TellApart's personalized marketing solutions: the machine learning data pipeline that powers the models, real-time calculations of the expected value of shoppers, and how to translate that value into a bid price for every bid request (and we receive hundreds of thousands per second). This is the first time that we've pulled back the curtain and detailed TellApart's secret sauce!

Speaker
Nick Gorski is a software engineer at TellApart, where he applies data mining and machine learning to build personalized marketing products. Over the past three years at TellApart, his work has spanned platform development building the machine learning data pipeline to product development using predictions to deliver targeted shopping experiences. He holds a PhD in Computer Science from the Artificial Intelligence Laboratory at the University of Michigan.


Schedule 
6:30 - 7:00pm Social (food + beer served) 
7:00 - 8:30pm Talk 
8:30 - 9:00pm Social
name: Data Science at TellApart

description:
Join us for After Hours at the Tech Museum of Innovation. Open from 7 pm until midnight, "After Hours is the monthly (first Thursday of the month) evening event where adults 21 and older enjoy science, technology, entertainment, and cocktails together with their friends. Explore the entire museum with other adults under moody lighting and music. Each month provides an exclusive and fun setting of music, giant games, hands-on exhibits, and more!" Dress to this month's theme of Hawaiian Night Luau by wearing a Hawaiian dress, shirt or Lei. As always, please arrange for a safe ride home if you plan/decide to become inebriated.


Since opening in 1978, the Tech Museum of Innovation "has exhibited the timeless principles of science while also celebrating the latest in technological achievement. In doing so, the institution inspires visitors to apply that same spirit of creative problem-solving to all aspects of life."

Pricing


After Hours Admission: $10

Special Annual Membership Pricing: $15.
Available on a limited time basis when purchased as a group through Groupon. I will purchase the Groupon first and forward the code to anyone who is interested. But don't delay if you are considering this option as this deal will end soon. The normal pricing for this offer is $40.
