group.name: The Oakland Real Estate Buying & Investing Meetup Group

description:
The purpose of the meeting is to educate potential buyers/sellers/investors and 1031 exchanger's on  the real estate market, how important it is to make the right decision before you transact taking your personal requirements into account, as well as market forces and investment criteria. If you do consider your home as an investment, then make sure you understand this asset class and how future values will impact your returns.

This meeting is not for other agents, brokers or wholesalers to come and present or discuss their deals. There are plenty of other sites and forums that do that already. I will take you off the member list.

I will not give any advice on "investment opportunities" outside my area of knowledge or state. I have had several people in the group who invested outside CA and may have trouble with that investment (ROI, and management). It also means that agents or investors who would like to "sell" their goods (real estate investment opportunities or books or tapes, etc), are not welcome in this meeting.

This meeting is specifically geared towards the consumers, owners and investors, not the agents. Agents have plenty of other channels to market their services/goods or learn how to buy real estate from tapes or webmeetings. Allow me to inform you that I have gone through many of those myself without success. I am happy to share that with you.

I am very protective of my potential clients, who have a chance in these meetings to "interview" me. I am looking forward to meeting with you and discuss your specific requirements.

Antoine
name: The Oakland Area Real Estate Monthly Meetup Group

description:
Occupy the Economy: Challenging Capitalism (City Lights Open Media) 

Richard D. Wolff, David Barsamian 

Today's economic crisis is capitalism's worst since the Great Depression. Millions have lost jobs, homes, and healthcare. Many with jobs watch pensions, benefits, and job security decline. While most live with increasing uncertainty, the system makes the very wealthy even richer. In eye-opening interviews with prominent economist Richard Wolff, David Barsamian probes the root causes of the current crisis, its unjust social costs, and what can and should be done to turn things around. While others blame corrupt bankers and unregulated speculators or the government or even the poor who borrowed, the authors show that the causes of the crisis run much deeper. They reach back to the 1970s when the capitalist system itself shifted, ending the century-old pattern of rising wages for Americans and thereby enabling the top 1% to become ultra-rich at the expense of the 99%. Since then, economic injustice has become chronic and further corrupted politics. Occupy's indignation with the whole system mobilizes a diverse range of Americans who seek basic change. Occupying the Economy not only clarifies and analyzes the crisis in US capitalism today, it also points toward solutions that can shape a far better future for all.

Richard Wolff is professor of economics at U. Mass, and visiting professor at the New School in New York City. He hosts a program on WBAI and is author of the hit bookCapitalism Hits the Fan.

David Barsamian is director of Alternative Radio and author of many interview books, including What We Say Goes with Noam Chomsky.
name: August Book Club! Occupy the Economy: Challenging Capitalism

Meeting format: 1) Quick intros ~ who you are and why you're here (2 minutes) 2) Travel questions & tips ~ be brief so that everyone gets a chance to talk! 3) Help us to maintain one conversation between 7-8:00 pm--that is, no side conversations, please! After that we can socialize more informally.

Come with your questions/suggestions or fun facts!

We've been discussing destinations for bigger trips, comparing travel preferences, and sharing what's worked and not worked in our varied travel experiences--and, very importantly, developing friendships!

This meeting is free, but please come prepared to buy at least a beverage ($2) so that we can continue to be welcome to take up space at this wonderful Palo Alto landmark cafe. Prolific Oven (downtown Palo Alto) has sweets and beverages only, in the evening, but you can bring a sandwich, if you are hungry, they won't mind. (Note that MeetUp website maps are not always accurate, it's a good idea to google directions on your own as well, if this is your first time. Meetup website seems to want to direct us to a different prolific oven; this one is in downtown Palo Alto - 550 Waverley Street, 94301).

description:
Come join PyLady Vanessa Shen as she talks about data visualization and how to get the most out of your data. 

In her words:

As it becomes easier and easier for companies to collect huge amounts of information, they are realizing that they are sitting on terabytes of data whose insights they haven't explored. Data visualization allows us to detect patterns and relationships in data that would otherwise remain hidden.

Though it's tempting to dive right in and start pumping out charts, there are concrete goals to consider before typing a single line of code. This presentation will cover goals, examples, resources, and tools so that next time you're curious about what's in the data, you'll know how to find out.

Hope to see you there!

                      Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and                                                       rightdoing, there is a field.          

                                  I will meet you there.

                                                  -Rumi

Our August Women's Circle will be a chance to play in the field of infinite possibilities. 

We often know all too well as women the harried feeling of routines, commitments, responsibilities and the pressure of our 24/7 lives. We are often limited in what we think is possible; so it is. 

Let's investigate the field of subtle energy and create infinite possibilities that celebrate this last month of summer. We will exercise our wise souls and expand our consciousness through inspired conversation and intuitive exploration.

We will share best practices, energetic exercises, and play-full ways to bloom in a whole new way for the fall. 

Great women, food, and soul-inspired experiences await. 

The field awaits . . . let's play.

        1 additional Level 6 Item

Mundane equipment valued at less than 50g can be had for free; purchase equipment valued at 50g or more.


• Returning characters can purchase items using gold they had before the start of Cairn of the Winter King.  They can add items they hadn't added according to initial Level 5 guidelines.  Unless anyone has strong objections, returning characters can tweak themselves as they wish outside the normal leveling limits now that the players have some experience with how their characters play.

• Wishlists - those who don't have enough gold to buy everything they'd like or those who want a particular item or ritual for their character can send me a wishlist and I'll try to work it into loot for the adventure.


For any new players:


Please check Resources for links to a free character builder and a pdf of the Player's Handbook.


What to bring:

• Your printed character sheets, we want to keep this analog.

• A pencil w/ an eraser and some extra paper.

• A set of 7 die dice!  You can get these online or somewhere like Gamestop.

• Player Handbooks and miniatures if you have them. 

Lastly

We have some really great people with a lot of experience in this group.  Please feel free to ask questions on this thread or in the Discussion area.  You will only get great advice. 

Hope to see you soon!

description:
Hello Climbers!

We've decided to put up a weekly climbing meetup intended for experienced climbers.  We'll still do our 2-3X per month Friday nights which are open to beginners, but Tuesday night climbs are not open to new climbers.  Our Tuesday night events are intended for regular climbers who are serious about working hard and increasing their climbing skills.  You absolutely need to be self-sufficient in terms of knowing how to tie in properly, belay properly, etc.  We ask that those coming to Tuesday night climbing sessions be comfortable climbing 5.10a at the very minimum as we really won't be spending any time on routes that are rated under 5.10. 

If you're not a member of Mission Cliffs, it's $20 for a day pass (or $100 for a 1 month pass).  We'll meet @ 7:30pm, and climb until we're done - likely going close to closing at 11pm.  Focus will be on pushing ourselves and each other to climb hard and try new, harder routes.

Hit me up with any questions, otherwise I'll see you Tuesday nights!  Members may bring 1 guest, but the guest needs to be an experienced climber as well. 

Release of Liability:

By joining us for this event you hereby RELEASE and DISCHARGE it's owners, principals, affiliates, presenters, organizer, hosts and participants from any and all liability, claims, demands or causes of action that you now have, or may have in the future, for injuries, damages, death and/or economic loss of any kind or nature, arising in whole or in part out of the activities, advice or information contained herein
how_to_find_us: Past front desk, meet at cubby-bench @ bottom of stairs (place  where people store their clothes in cubbies)

description:
TurnON: [turn{on}]  


verb (something that happens in the body)

To raise the body heat, leaving the individual feeling as though they may perspire

To feel tingles in random parts of the body, letting the individual know those parts are awake

To encounter cheeks getting flushed, often leaving the individual feel seen

To ignite, as to feel more alive and alert

TurnON occurs from many different things. Maybe you saw someone you thought was cute. Maybe you had an inappropriate thought cross your mind.

Maybe you saw something that inspired or even pissed you off. Many things/people/conversations leave us with this ignited feeling in our body. (yes, deep down we all like the feeling of TurnON!) You know it's TurnON because it ignites -- as though your body is giving you a cue, shouting out "I'm ALIVE in here"!

TurnON leaves you feeling more alert, ignited and happy.

At OneTaste, we believe TurnON is the ignition that leads to a more of what we really want in life. We believe it is the first step to knowing what is possible.

So, we started an evening event designed specifically to give people the opportunity to feel TurnON in themselves. (p.s., it's totally PG-13) It's an evening where, through only talking, we begin to experience these exhilarating, normal, often ignored feelings -- referred to as TurnON. A room of people (cool, fun people) engage in honest, humorous, playful conversation around topics we mostly only consider having in our head.

TurnOn leads to authenticity and authenticity leads to the kind of connection we hope for around the globe.

The evening leaves you invigorated, happy and inspired. We are meant to live TurnedON.


Details:
Singles & Couples Welcome
This event is $10
how_to_find_us: On the corner of N Pacific Ave and River St, downtown Santa Cruz
name: TurnON Santa Cruz

description:
Born in New Orleans, Donald Harrison grew up in a home environment saturated with the city’s traditional music of brass bands, parades, modern jazz, r&b, funk, classical, world ethnic, and dance music. His connection to New Orleans roots were deepened by his father, a Big Chief in the African and Native American influenced culture of New Orleans’ Black Mardi Gras Indians. The culture is an offshoot culture of Congo Square, one of the only known places in North America where Africans openly participated in their culture in the 1700’s and 1800’s.

Harrison recorded, “Quantum Leap” in 2012 which musicians and critics agree is a next step for jazz. With quantum jazz Harrison has opened up new areas for time, harmony, and melody. The record also melds cutting edge jazz with New Orleans funk - connecting the past with the present with jazz music that transcends boundaries.

Harrison co-founded and became the artistic director for the Tipitina’s Intern Program, and The New Jazz School where he along with a staff of his hand pick of seasoned veterans teach jazz theory, music and history to students 13 to 21. Taught and mentored the following musicians: trumpeter Christian Scott, trombonist/singer Trombone Shorty, rapper Notorius BIG, guitarist Josh Connelly in addition to saxophonists Louis Fouche, Chris Royal and Aaron Fletcher. His working groups have proven to be an incubator for jazz band leaders such as trumpeter Christian Scott, guitarist Mark Whitfield, pianist Cyrus Chestnut, bassists Christian McBride, and Esperanza Spaulding.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=YZ-bVDAl8xI

Tickets are $23 and can be purchased on Yoshi's website (bellow)

http://www.yoshis.com/oakland/jazzclub/artist/show/4341
how_to_find_us: Lets meet in the lounge @7:30pm
name: The Donald Harrison Quintet!

description:
Gordon Goldstone is a former Israeli Tour Educator and spent more than five years living in Israel, mostly at Kibbutz Gezer. Gordon holds an MA in History and has lectured on topics of Jewish and Zionist history. Gordon has worked in the Jewish community for almost 20 years in synagogues, Hillels (Jewish student centers), youth groups and at J Street, a political advocacy organization. Gordon is also a avid cyclist and was a finisher of the 2010 LoToJa, a 206 mile race from Logan UT to Jackson Hole WY.

Host: Karen Crommie
name: Gordon Goldstone: J Street Political Advocacy

description:
Join us for free at one of our highly-innovative business-networking meetings - in your city! View our full calendar of business-networking meetings. We welcome anyone to attend a GoRampUp! meeting, once, for free as our guest, so you can learn what the innovative GoRampUp! business-networking experience is all about. Note, we are not able to give you a free meeting at more than one of our many locations.

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting athttp://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance. Without this ticket you will, unfortunately, be declined access to our innovative and exclusive business-networking meeting. WITH a GoRampUp! Golden Ticket, you will be welcomed with open arms!

It can be too difficult to attract new clients. We help you fix that! We're a business-impact community. We're informal and fun, yet, by design, we're extremely effective!

We help people who work for a living to get a much greater payoff from working. We do this in three specific ways under our three CoreSuccess Platforms: 1) We help you move toward mastery with business-networking, 2) We help you move toward mastery with business performance, and, 3) We help you move toward mastery with personal development.

How do we deliver on this promise to our community members? Each month we conduct dozens of business-networking meetings in more than a dozen cities in the SF Bay Area. A member may attend all of our "OpenConnect" business-networking meetings. And our members are welcome and encouraged to attend any and all of these meetings and locations.

Each month we introduce and emphasize a learning and development subject under each of our three CoreSuccess Platforms. For each of the three learning and development subjects that we introduce and emphasize each month, we give you four different ways to learn it: We produce written learning guides, video learning guides, audio learning guide, and we cover the subjects as 15-to-20-minute mini-workshops inside of our 60-minute business-networking meetings. There's no registration or initiation fee to join. Membership in GoRampUp! is month to month. You enroll when you like, even mid-month, and you depart when you like.

Be sure to see our website to learn about our generous enrollment incentives

Also, be sure to learn about our 100-Satisfaction Money-Back Guarantee

Would you care to come to this meeting, at no cost, to see if there’s business-value for you?

• Free-Meeting Guest-RSVP and Golden Ticket Request

• View complete meeting details

• Invite a Buddy to join you

One last thing: You REALLY should check out actual testimonial videos by our members: See them here

This page was created to produce awareness of our event. However, OUR PAGES ON THIS SITE CAN BECOME OUTDATED. The authoritative source for our meeting dates/times is http://www.GoRampUp.com/calendar. Be sure to check it prior to traveling to a meeting.
name: Concord Business Networking

description:
HTML 5 Application Development Class

2 Day Training

What: This is a 2 day HTML5 training class that begins at 9:00 AM and ends at 5:00 PM each day.

Description: Get the insight into HTML5 Application Development with this 2 day it training course. 

The class begins with an introduction to HTML5, Document Object Model and an overview of JavaScript. Following this, Event Handling mechanism is explained. Following this Forms, Audio and Video APIs are explained. The morning session concludes with exercises that cover AJAX, HTML Forms, Video and Audio API.

Following lunch we start out with HTML5 Canvas. Canvas API is explained. Following this, a couple of HTML5 Canvas/Graphics libraries are explained. Students will work on building an HTML5 Applications from scratch using Canvas, Canvas Libraries that integrates Canvas with Audio, Video and Drag and Drop APIs. This concludes the session for first day.

Day 2 morning session starts with Communication API. This follows an explanation of AJAX, XMLHttpRequest and Cross-Domain Messaging. Then we cover Web Workers, Web Sockets and GeoLocation APIs. This session concludes with hands-on exercises using these topics.

Following lunch, we cover storage API. This covers how to store HTML5 data on local machine and in remote cloud. Following this, how to develop and configure offline applications. Then WebGL is explained. The session concludes with the review of topics covered in the class and how to improve performance of HTML5 applications. 

This is a 2 day it training course that requires a commitment from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on both days. Morning coffee and Lunch are included for both days. The class size is small so that individualized attention can be paid to all the students. Many opportunities for Q&A are offered to the students. The instructor for this class is an experienced programmer/instructor. We have been successfully teaching this class since 2011. 

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

Summary

[DAY 1]

------MORNING------

- Introduction to HTML5

- Review of DOM and JavaScript

- Event Handling in HTML5

- Forms API

- Video and Audio API

------AFTERNOON------

-Canvas API

-Drag And Drop API

-Integrate Audio and Video API with Canvas

-HTML5 Graphic Libraries

-Developing Canvas Applications using Custom Libraries

------------------------------------------------------------

[DAY 2]

------MORNING------

-Communication API

-XMLHttpRequest and Cross-Domain Messaging

-Web Workers and Web Sockets API

-GeoLocation API

------AFTERNOON------

-Local Storage API

-Storage over Cloud

-Introduction to WebGL

-Offline Applications API

-Optimizing HTML5 Applications

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

Contact: [masked]

 Benefits 

Career: Lay your own path to success. Learn HTML5 and taste the fruit of success that comes from being in demand. 

Make more money: HTML programmers make on average $30,000 more per year than professionals who only know Microsoft Office. 

Be in control on the web: HTML is the foundation of the web and knowing HTML is essential for developing and managing a successful online presence. 

Increase strategic value: Become indispensible to your employer. 

Get a promotion: If you are looking for a promotion or a new job then knowing HTML will increase your chances of success. 

Mobile applications: HTML is used for Cross Platform Mobile Application Development; learn the language that is powering mobile applications. 

Value to businesses: HTML is of importance to all businesses because of its integral value to the web. 

Better work life balance: Knowing how to code can lead to a circumstance in your life where you have better control over your career choices and work options. Most employers allow programmers the freedom to decide their own schedule and also offer more opportunities to work from home for programmers than non programmers. 

A standard practice: It is integral to know how to program in todays competitive environment. If you have been looking for a language to learn then make HTML your 1st choice. It will give you a lot of power in a very little time. Let’s face it; sooner or later you will have to learn how to program. Why wait? 

You can do it: Learning to program is not as hard as you think. With our coaching you will be able to bridge the programming gap. 

Beneficial to all employers: Getting training in HTML5 is of value to all companies as it helps employees produce better quality work. HTML5 can make the difference between average quality output and excellent quality output. It is of value to any position that requires communication or data interaction. The skills learned in this class are applicable to all departments of any company including but not limited to IT, Data Analysis, Sales, Strategic planning and Marketing. The skills taught can be implemented in daily online tasks. 

Why:

-  HTML5 offers faster image downloads, especially for mobile users

- HTML5 offers improved SEO

- HTML5 offers Sophisticated animation effects

- HTML5 offers Easier Web and Mobile App Development

- BBC is turning towards HTML5 for application development

- Zynga used HTML5 to make Words With Friends, FarmVille Express, Zynga Poker Mobile Web and CityVille Express. Zynga continues to use HTML5 for product development globally.

- SAP is using HTML5 for Enterprise Mobile Apps

- HTML5 is one of the most desired skills by employer

 How to Register:A. Please sign up on eventbrite:  

http://startupsaturdays.eventbrite.com/

B. If you are already on Eventbrite then please select the number of tickets you would like to purchase from above. C. If you have an employer sponsored education program then please contact us at: [masked] can work with various reimbursement and employer sponsored educational programs. 

Startup Saturdays - Complete Listing

http://startupsaturdays.eventbrite.com/

group.name: San Jose & South Bay Area Tennis Meetup

description:
This is a weekly Wednesday meet-up held in Sunnyvale.

Due to the popularity of these local courts after 6:00 p.m., we'll start at 5:30 p.m. Please try to arrive on time to help us secure as many courts as possible.

If you don't see us when you arrived at Mango courts during the busy USTA leagues seasons, look for us at our alternative location at "Fremont High School", 1279 Sunnyvale Saratoga Rd., Sunnyvale, CA 94087

https://maps.google.com/maps?hl=...

Please be sure to RSVP, and kindly remember to update them in a timely manner should your plans changed, preferably by noon. (Members with a history of no-shows or last minute cancellations will be removed from my future invitation and event lists).

Should you plan to arrive later than the scheduled time, please mention it along with your RSVPs, but keep in mind that if you are more than a half hour late, you may lose your spot to a waiting list member. Also note that you may or may not be able to play beyond one hour depending on how busy the courts are.

Members who are on the waiting list are welcome to come out and check to see if there are spaces available around 7:00 since we normally play until about 9 or 9:30. Priority will be applied according to the order of your RSVP.

description:
Startup Finance: Valuation

About: Learn how to value a startup.

Finance is a powerful global force and valuation lies at its core. Valuation makes or breaks a company. It is critical to understand valuation as an investor, entrepreneur, consultant and employee.

There are many circumstances in which valuation is critical:

A. You are looking to raise funding for your company.

B. You are looking to invest in a startup.

C. You are looking to work for a startup and your success is tied to the startup’s success.

D. You are about to get paid in equity.

E. You are interested in selling your business.

This class is focused on startup valuation with entrepreneurial and non-public valuation needs in mind. We cover concepts such as pre-money, post money valuation and valuation equations used for private companies. We will be looking at Startup Valuation from the financial perspective. You can expect to walk away with a few equations and ideas on how to make financial projections.

This class is ideal for entrepreneurs, investors and anyone interested in working for or with a private company. Attendees to this seminar will walk away with a better understanding of the valuation process.  Attendees can expect to walk through a financial example of valuation.

Testimonials:

“This is one of the best finance classes I have ever taken.”

- Andrew

“I took the “Startup Finance Valuation” class; excellent job. This class is a must for all entrepreneurs. MBA classes do not teach how to value a startup, this class does.”

- Danny

“After taking this class I have a clear perspective on valuation. I recommend this class to all entrepreneurs. Thank you for a very informative class.”

- Bonnie

“I have been in banking for over 20 years and this class taught me valuable concepts not covered by all the classes I have taken throughout my career.”

- Yaakov

description:
For the fourth year in a row Sustainable Lafayette will be hosting a summer film series at the Lafayette Library & Learning Center that will feature three recently released documentaries on weekday evenings. A $10.00 donation is requested for adults $5.00 for students. Light snacks and coffee will be provided. Check our website, sustainablelafayette.org, for more details.


The 3rd film is Watershed on Wednesday, August 13, @ 6:30 pm


Executive produced & narrated by Robert Redford

Produced by the Redford Center and Kontent Films

Executive Produced and Narrated by Robert Redford and Directed by award-winning filmmaker, Mark Decena, WATERSHED tells the story of the threats to the once-mighty Colorado River and offers solutions for the future of the American West.

As the most dammed, dibbed, and diverted river in the world struggles to support thirty million people and the peace-keeping agreement known as the Colorado River Pact reaches its limits, WATERSHED introduces hope.

Can we meet the needs of a growing population in the face of rising temperatures and lower rainfall in an already arid land? Can we find harmony amongst the competing interests of cities, agriculture, industry, recreation, wildlife, and indigenous communities with rights to the water?

</a>Sweeping through seven U.S. and two Mexican states, the Colorado River is a lifeline to expanding populations and booming urban centers that demand water for drinking, sanitation and energy generation. And with 70% of the rivers’ water supporting agriculture, the river already runs dry before it reaches its natural end at the Gulf of California. Unless action is taken, the river will continue its retreat – a potentially catastrophic scenario for the millions who depend on it.

In WATERSHED, we meet Jeff Ehlert, a fly fishing guide in Rocky Mountain National Park, Colorado rancher Dan James, Delta restoration worker Edith Santiago, Navajo Council member Glojean Todacheene, Rifle Colorado Mayor Keith Lambert, Los Angeles native Jimmy Lizama and a group of Outward Bound teens rafting down the Colorado River as they all reflect a compelling new water ethic—one that illuminates how letting go of the ways of old can lead to a path of coexisting with enough for all.

The Redford Center created WATERSHED as a inspirational social action tool for people who want to engage. Promoting personal water conservation pledges of 5% – symbolic of the small amount of the rivers’ flow required to reconnect the river to its delta – and garnering donations to help purchase the water rights necessary to restore the connectivity, WATERSHED is a central tool in a larger grassroots effort focused on saving the Colorado River and supporting the communities throughout the river basin.

Presented by the Redford Center

A Production of the Redford Center and Kontent Films

Writer / Director: Mark Decena

Executive Producers: Robert Redford, Teri Heyman, Lee Bycel

Producers: James Redford, Jill Tidman

Producer / Post Production Supervisor: Renata Foucré

Co-producer: Scott Compton

Director of Photography: John Behrens

Editor: Matt Notaro

Story Editors: John Dilley, Forrest Pound

Assistant Editors: Joanna Hidalgo, Luke Shock

Editorial House: Remedy Editorial

Additional Photography: Fearghal ODea, Forrest Pound, Renata Foucré, Mark Decena

Associate Producers: Forrest Pound, Tye Davis

Content Advisor: Barry Nelson, NRDC

Distribution Partners: NRDC, McSweeney’s, Save The Colorado and Sonoran Institute

Associate Story Developers: Jordan Bass, Ira Chute, Chris Ying, Emily Doe

Publicity, Marketing and Distribution Consultant: Diana Iles Parker

description:
This is an opportunity to get expert feedback on your photography, to improve your work, and learn professional tips and tricks. Gain insight into your own photography, learn from the work of others, and benefit from the opportunity to network with a small group of fellow photographers.

What We Do

We get together monthly at a photography studio in San Francisco, where Photojournalist and Photographer Khaled Sayed will perform a live interactive critique of up to 10 photographs submitted in advance by attendees. 

Everyone is encouraged to join us at a local coffee shop after the critique session for more intimate discussion of images and portfolios brought in by attendees.


Attendance is limited to no more than 20 photographers each month and no more than 10 photographs in each critique, to provide focus and attention. 

How To Participate

Submit your photographs to the group's public gallery on Tumblr no fewer than five days before the meeting for the opportunity to have your work published on the group's site, and have them be part of the live critique. Each attendee may submit up to three photographs for consideration for each meeting. The moderator will choose the pictures to be discussed before the event, but not all photos submitted will be included in the discussion, or added to the group site.


Please bring your own work to share, or just come to be inspired by your fellow photographers. Everyone is encouraged to bring your portfolio with you in print, on your tablet, or on your own notebook to share with others at a local coffee shop after the presentation.

We do ask attendees for a donation of $5.00 at each meeting to help cover the cost of maintaining the space and the equipment. If you want to pay in advance, or make a different donation, please visit our Eventbrite page.
name: Photography Critique and Portfolio Review

group.name: Jaunty Bay Area - Enhancing our Social Intelligence!

description:
It’s summer and everyone’s coming out to play. Fortunately, Jaunty is in full force in San Francisco to help you brush off those social skills! Ever wonder why some people exude magnetism and charisma? Are you ever stuck making small talk or unable to get up the courage to approach that awesome person at the party? This class starts at the beginning. This fun, interactive workshop is Jaunty's first step into social mastery and includes a mix of theory, exercises, and time to mingle. We’ll look into the science of attraction and practice tried and tested techniques that will change the way you connect with people. This workshop covers body language, conversational agility, and belief systems, examining what’s holding you back. If you want to create connections for romance, friendships, or business this workshop will teach you how to become a social dynamo. Please arrive early. Register online or at the door.
Free Ride sponsored by Hitch! Hitch is taking care of our transport, offering a free ride to/from the event! Use promo code "enhanced14" after downloading the app from takehitch.com/download
About your Instructor:

Eric Waisman is Jaunty’s founder. A fourth generation entrepreneur, Eric left his corporate career with MetLife, Merrill Lynch and American Express to follow his true passions – teaching communications and being social. He has spent the past ten years studying human behavior and the science of attraction. Eric holds a bachelor’s degree in business from the University of Northern Colorado and studied cultural studies at the University of Jerusalem. A former punk rock musician, in his spare time Eric enjoys traveling, playing his guitar, exercising and of course...socializing.

FAQs
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
Free Ride sponsored by Hitch! Hitch is taking care of our transport, offering a free ride to/from the event! Use promo code "enhanced14" after downloading the app from takehitch.com/download

4v4 pickup (4 simultaneous games if there are enough folks). First session begins at 7pm. Each session is one hour long. Teams are capped at 5 per side to ensure playing time for folks. The vibe is laid back and fun. Like all SoccerFours sessions, teams are made up at the field, and scores aren't kept. There are no leagues. It's just organized pickup soccer run by a facilitator. $7/person for the session. RSVP here and bring cash to the field or sign up on our main site if you'd like. (If the slots here are full, try our main site to see if there are any left.)

Let's have some fun! :)

description:
I know it's been awhile, but this one's for you, East-Bay-ers!

Although I'm not super familiar with the East Bay, I know that's where many awesome people live -- people who can't always make it into the city for karaoke. That being said, I am excited to travel to a new place and meet new people, and hope that many of you will be able to join me at Nick's Lounge (close to the Ashby BART station, which is an added bonus)!

If you love singing, getting your drink on, or just enjoy watching others sing, please join me in Berkeley! I look forward to seeing old friends and making new ones!

description:
Dubbed “a wonderfully engaging P.I.” (The Times, London), Tarquin Hall’s irresistible protagonist Vish Puri has become an international favorite through a series that “splendidly evokes the color and bustle of Delhi and the tang of contemporary India” (Seattle Times). Now the gormandizing, spectacularly mustachioed sleuth finds himself facing down his greatest fears in an explosive case involving the Indian and Pakistani mafias. 

When the elderly father of a top Pakistani cricketer playing in a new multimillion-dollar cricket league dies frothing at the mouth during a post-match dinner, it’s not a simple case of Delhi Belly. His butter chicken has been poisoned. To solve the case, Puri must penetrate the region’s organized crime, following a trail that leads deep into Pakistan—the country in which many members of the P.I.’s family were massacred during the 1947 partition of India. The last piece of the puzzle, however, turns up closer to home when Puri learns of the one person who can identify the killer. Unfortunately it is the one person in the world with whom he has sworn never to work: his Mummy-ji. 

With riotously entertaining prose, a boisterous cast of characters, and a pitch-perfect sense of place, Tarquin Hall has crafted a gripping whodunit that takes us deep into Indian history and society. He brings a hugely appealing culture to life with all its sights, sounds, smells, foods, and complexity. As the title implies, The Case of the Deadly Butter Chicken is a succulent read by a writer at the top of his game.
how_to_find_us: We'll b e in the community room to the left when you first enter the library
name: August's Book: The case of the deadly butter chicken" by Tarquin Hall

description:
Recently, Joyent published results of using the YCSB benchmark with MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and Postgres. The results of the benchmarks can be found  here. To discuss these benchmark results, Joyent is planning a meet-up at the Joyent office in San Francisco on the evening of July 9th. During this meet-up, we'll do some active benchmarking using YCSB and one or two of the target benchmarks (MongoDB, etc.). Doing this will confirm that the benchmark tests what it says it tests, and will help in understanding the results. In active benchmarking, performance is analyzed while the benchmark is running. This will use tools available on SmartOS (DTrace, iostat, mpstat, etc.). We'll also examine some issues we have run into, and how we have solved those issues.

Click here to register for this meetup.

Speakers: 
Max Bruning, Joyent

Vladimir Drndarski, ThotSpot
name: Benchmarking Meetup

description:
Join us for free at one of our highly-innovative business-networking meetings - in your city! View our full calendar of business-networking meetings. We welcome anyone to attend a GoRampUp! meeting, once, for free as our guest, so you can learn what the innovative GoRampUp! business-networking experience is all about. Note, we are not able to give you a free meeting at more than one of our many locations.

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting athttp://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance. Without this ticket you will, unfortunately, be declined access to our innovative and exclusive business-networking meeting. WITH a GoRampUp! Golden Ticket, you will be welcomed with open arms!

It can be too difficult to attract new clients. We help you fix that! We're a business-impact community. We're informal and fun, yet, by design, we're extremely effective!

We help people who work for a living to get a much greater payoff from working. We do this in three specific ways under our three CoreSuccess Platforms: 1) We help you move toward mastery with business-networking, 2) We help you move toward mastery with business performance, and, 3) We help you move toward mastery with personal development.

How do we deliver on this promise to our community members? Each month we conduct dozens of business-networking meetings in more than a dozen cities in the SF Bay Area. A member may attend all of our "OpenConnect" business-networking meetings. And our members are welcome and encouraged to attend any and all of these meetings and locations.

Each month we introduce and emphasize a learning and development subject under each of our three CoreSuccess Platforms. For each of the three learning and development subjects that we introduce and emphasize each month, we give you four different ways to learn it: We produce written learning guides, video learning guides, audio learning guide, and we cover the subjects as 15-to-20-minute mini-workshops inside of our 60-minute business-networking meetings. There's no registration or initiation fee to join. Membership in GoRampUp! is month to month. You enroll when you like, even mid-month, and you depart when you like.

Be sure to see our website to learn about our generous enrollment incentives

Also, be sure to learn about our 100-Satisfaction Money-Back Guarantee

Would you care to come to this meeting, at no cost, to see if there’s business-value for you?

• Free-Meeting Guest-RSVP and Golden Ticket Request

• View complete meeting details

• Invite a Buddy to join you

One last thing: You REALLY should check out actual testimonial videos by our members: See them here

This page was created to produce awareness of our event. However, OUR PAGES ON THIS SITE CAN BECOME OUTDATED. The authoritative source for our meeting dates/times is http://www.GoRampUp.com/calendar. Be sure to check it prior to traveling to a meeting.

description:
Jafar Husain is a Technical Lead at Netflix, with over 16 years of experience in the industry. He's currently a member of the TC39, the Javascript standards body designing the next version of JS. He specializes in building web servers and clients using functional reactive programming, and was the first user of the Reactive Extensions Framework. He's also responsible for "Falkor", a RESTful data access framework that powers most Netflix clients. A highly-rated speaker, he has spoken about reactive programming at YOW!, QCon, CodeMesh, and given Channel 9 interviews on the subject. He has also authored interactive training software to help developers learn about functional reactive programming.

What does a mouse drag event have in common with an Array of numbers?
     The answer to this question may surprise you: they are both collections. This key insight holds the key to dramatically simplifying asynchronous programming in Javascript. In this talk you will learn how you can use the familiar Javascript Array methods to create surprisingly expressive asynchronous programs. Using just a few functions, you will learn how to do the following:
     * Declaratively build complex events out of simple events (ex. drag n' drop)
     * Coordinate and sequence multiple Ajax requests
     * Reactively update UI's in response to data changes
     * Eliminate memory leaks caused by neglecting to unsubscribe from events
     * Gracefully propagate and handle asynchronous exceptions


      In this talk we'll be exploring the Reactive Extensions (Rx) library (https://rx.codeplex.com/) which allows us to treat events as collections. You'll learn about how Netflix uses Rx on the client and the server, allowing us to build end-to-end reactive systems. We'll also contrast Rx with Promises, another popular approach to building asynchronous programs in Javascript.   


Please come and join us for a fun, informational evening where you can hear Jafar speak as well as meet other interesting people.

Snacks and beverages will be served. Please RSVP so we have an accurate headcount.

See you there!

============================

Note on Logistics:

Meet Up is at: https://goo.gl/maps/2Jxla


4655 Great America Parkway, Harvest Training Room, Santa Clara, CA 95054


  Harvest Training Room is in the ground floor of the building.
how_to_find_us: Shutterfly Inc, Harvest Training Rm, 4655 Great America Parkway, Suite 601 Santa Clara, CA 95054
name: Jafar Husain - What does a mouse drag event have in common with an Array of #s

Our gracious host and sponsor for food and beverages is New Relic, at their wonderful SF location 188 Spear Street (on the corner of Spear & Howard) San Francisco, CA.  All event are located on the 10th floor.

description:
Nowadays, most web developers are using "MVC" concepts and frameworks to organize the JS that powers their website and better separate the presentation from the data.

In this evening workshop, we'll give an overview of MVC frameworks and spend most of our time actually getting our hands dirty using MVC concepts. We'll give an overview of popular frameworks, like Backbone, but we will not focus on any framework in particular.

As a prerequisite, you should be fairly familiar with JS, jQuery, AJAX, and OO, either by attending our workshops or learning elsewhere. Bring a laptop, a charger, and a smile.

Thanks to Adobe for the great space.

If you'd like to attend but cannot afford the cost, please request a GDI scholarship.

Please note that we cannot issue refunds, since there's an overhead to issuing refunds via Meetup.com and we already offer the workshops at such a low-cost. We put proceeds into the chapter fund, which we use as our scholarship fund.
name: JS 205: Intro to MVC Frameworks

group.name: The South Bay Women's Social Group

description:
We are a diverse group of women! We are all about socializing and getting to know you over a book…………in between some food and drinks, of course! This is a unique way to discover new authors, new books, and decide for yourself if a book is “2 thumbs” up, and at the same time make new friends and hopefully discover new ideas along the way.


We meet on the second Thursday of the month. We rotate amongst ourselves to host the monthly meeting. We will all bring a dish and engaging discussion to our monthly book meet. Our book discussion may be intense, but our atmosphere is always casual and fun, and conversations happen while we eat.

Process of selecting book read is done by the rotating host of that month. The host recommends 3 choices for voting. The winning vote by the members is the book choice of the month. 

This Book Club is currently full, please email the organizer to be put on a waitlist. Do check out the other Book Clubs with openings in our Group.

Your responsibility as a member?

• Commit to reading one book a month
• Commit to monthly attendance
• Able to take turns hosting the monthly meetup at your home
• Must be able to tolerate lots of good fun, great friendship & stimulating discussion  

Laurie is hosting this month

Our Book read for this month:
name: Reading Between the Wines

description:
2-hour Android Hands-on Learning Session where you can get a tour of the Android platform, ask questions and hack on Android projects.

So you want to develop Android apps...

If you are interested in meeting other people learning to build Android applications, building a project or you just want a quick tour of what it takes to be an Android app developer, come check out this session. There are two sections for this meetup.

For those totally new to Android development, we will be providing a high-level tour of Android development concepts with a live demo and answer any questions you may have along the way. 

Hands-on

This is a hands-on session and that means you should be sure to setup your Android environment beforehand. If you want to follow along, make sure to have Android Studio installed before attending.

Sponsors

Thanks to Yelp for sponsoring this session! We're always looking for office space to host these events and maybe provide snacks and drinks.  Let us know if you know someone who can host!
name: Android Tour plus Hands-on Session

description:
We hold Civic Hack Nights in downtown San Jose every other week. Typical hack nights have the following structure:

6:30-6:45pm: Mingling, chatting, eating pizza

6:45pm-7pm: Introductions and updates

7pm-8:45pm: Work on projects in teams or as individuals 

8:45pm-9pm: Share progress with group and wrap-up

We welcome new members! At your first meeting, we'll take time to introduce you to the group and help you identify a project to work on. 

Pizza will be provided. Bring your ideas, enthusiasm, and if you can, a laptop.
name: Civic Hack Night

description: I know its a Thursday, but what the heck lets see whose wants to come and watch an amazing classic movie where we also get to sing and dance our way through the night if we choose too. The Grease Sing-a-Long is being held at the Vine in Livermore. If you don't have a chance to grab dinner first don't worry, you will find they serve a wide variety of beer, wine, and other beverages as well as food brought to you by Alehouse and Zephyr Bar and Grill and regular movie concessions. I expect the theater may be busy so I am setting the meet up time for 30 minutes prior to the start of the movie.
name: Grease Sing-A-Long

description: Experience Reiki Reiki can help you to feel better! Reiki is a healing energy that flows in all of us This Meetup Group is Organized and Facilitated by four Reiki Masters; Jennifer, Ted, Rebecca and Jeff. They have made it possible for you to give and receive Reiki without having had the attunements. You do not want to miss this event. Reiki is a unique healing experience, rediscovered in Japan in the late 19th century but originally dating back at least to the days of the The Second Temple and of Jesus. This is not a structured training, but an opportunity for all to experience Reiki and for trained Reiki practitioners to practice by enjoying a Reiki exchange. We start at 7:00 and we are usually complete by 9:00 $10.00 Suggested Donation</p>
how_to_find_us: Just knock on the door, take your shoes off and make yourself at home!
name: SBAY: Reiki Share

description:
UPDATE: This Meetup is now closed to newcomers as tickets for the event have now sold out.  Only add yourself on this meet up if you already bought a ticket for yourself and no other reason.

This is the second attempt for this meet up due to another show date being arranged by James Rolfe for San Francisco.  I must ask that you only RSVP for this meet up if you buy your ticket right away before they sell out, and they will quickly.

TICKETS ON SALE HERE:
https://tickets.landmarktheatres.com/(S(ly3hnikb2gj3qhkq5whhu0rt))/Ticketing.aspx?TheatreID=226&MovieID=15735&ShowDate=8/14/2014&ScheduleID=58636

Angry Video Game Nerd: The Movie is an independent movie based on the Web Series known as The Angry Video Game Nerd (Formerly The Angry Nintendo Nerd) which is a Video Game based comedy series where The Nerd (Played by Filmmaker and Actor, James Rolfe) plays and reviews bad video games which fills him with foul mouthed anger and rage, and at many times during these reviews, he faces many adventures and meets many characters.

This movie is a on a larger scale where The Nerd goes on an adventure to unearth the truth about the so called worst game of all time, E.T. for the Atari 2600 which he has a huge phobia of.  James Rolfe, the creator, director, writer, and actor of The Nerd has insisted upon more practical effects over CGI, so it will have a B Movie feel to it, but it's also part of what James is going for.

Please keep in mind that this movie contains a lot of foul language and humor, so this is not advised for those under 18.
name: Angry Video Game Nerd: The Movie in San Francisco

description: Another author talk! We'll read Lean Customer Development, http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KECAM98/. Cindy Alvarez will give a short presentation (5-10 minutes) and then be available for Q&A.
name: Read Lean Customer Development: Building Products Your Customers Will Buy

group.name: Audacious Dames of The Bay Area

description:
What's better than an evening of wine and decadent desserts, surrounded by powerful, bold women who are shucking status quo and pursuing their fullness?

This evening will be the official launch of Audacious Dames of the Bay Area.  We are a group of women who are dedicated to cultivating and celebrating our uniqueness, expanding our edges, exploring our vulnerability, deepening our confidence and living life from the heart out.  We are growing in our awareness that our own healing heals the world.  

We will hear briefly from two powerful women~ Audacious Dames founder Lisa Vallejos, and owner of Aphrodite's Closet, Laura Sargentini.  This month's topic will be Courage & Confidence and both women will share tips on how to maximize your mojo in every area of your life.
name: Eat, Drink & Be Brilliant!

description:
Join this lecture by one of our investors.

Kevin will share his recent year of investing activity.

He will talk about:

• Actual investments done: rentals and flips

• Lessons of what worked well and what did not work so well

• Goal setting

• Major items we need to have to be safe and successful 

• Take questions

Meeting is free!

We start at 7pm and finish around 9pm.

description:
The book selected for the month of August is: The City and the City by China Mieville. Tentatively  venue for now is Fuzio at Embarcadero. I will update you if any changes.  Meeting as always is schedule for 7pm  but you may join us for Happy Hour before that (and maybe we can discuss Ulysses ).  See you there! :) 

The City and the Cityby 

China Miéville

Inspector Tyador Borlú of the Extreme Crime Squad finds deadly conspiracies beneath a seemingly routine murder. From the decaying Beszel, he joins detective Qussim Dhatt in rich vibrant Ul Qoma, and both are enmeshed in a sordid underworld. Rabid nationalists are intent on destroying their neighboring city, and unificationists dream of dissolving the two into one.
how_to_find_us: Look for book or Mindbers Sign
name: The City and the City by China Mieville

description:
Tea and Tarot is our opportunity to chat generally about tarot and metaphysics. I  This is an evening meant to be a potpourri of the different inquiries the group is making into metaphysics these days. If you have an interest that you are currently investigating, bring it along and give a little "show and tell". If you are a novice, this is a great time to ask questions about things that are confusing you. Come along for a great conversation with like minded people.

As always, a $5.00 contribution is appreciated to cover the costs of the group. No one is turned away for lack of funds, however.
how_to_find_us: Balboa and 7th Ave in San Francisco
name: Tea and Tarot

description:
Once a month come to Potrero home of infinite parking spaces.  Dog and female friendly.  

Usual life drinks poker format of $20 buy-in tournament style, unlimited re-buys until a few hours into the game at which point one is not allowed to re-buy so the tournament finishes in a timely fashion and people aren't kept out too late.
name: Potrero Poker And Pups Madness Thursday

group.name: SF Bay Area Kizomba and Semba

description:
*** REMEMBER: on Meetup.com, only a small percentage of a group's members actually RSVP to events. Our weekly classes and socials have been going for a year and a half, and are well-attended. Don't hesitate to join us :) ***

Want to learn to dance the exciting and sensual dance of Kizomba? It's a great way to socialize! Watch this video to see it danced: http://youtu.be/xpWNYC_NXEg

If you're already comfortable dancing the basics, are comfortable with saidas and combinations, and your musicality is good, come to our Improvers class at 8p. Otherwise, join us at 9p for our Beginner+ class (studio 2). Our weekly social starts at 9p and goes until midnight.

Snacks provided and refreshments provided. ALL LEVELS WELCOME.

$12 payable at the door. Social-only $8. (cash, check, cc, multi-class discounts available)

See you there!
name: Learn to Dance Kizomba and Stay for the Social!

group.name: Sol Mamas | Baby-Friendly Outdoor Fitness, Fun & Travel

description:
Baby Boot Camp is offering a FREE TRIAL CLASS +  20% OFF any package to SOL MAMAS!!!

Please let me know ASAP if you are interested in Sol Mamas pursuing this as a group!

http://vimeo.com/59748361

Baby Boot Camp is a great way to get back in shape, connect with other moms, and benefit from being outdoors! The classes are in Oakland at Lake Temescal Mon.-Fri. from 9:30am-10:30am, or at Joaquin Miller Park on Saturday from 9:30am-10:30am. Weekday classes meet in the large North lot off Broadway (NOT the small lot off Broadway Terrace). The Saturday class meets at the small playground at Joaquin Miller Park.

WHAT TO BRING:
- yoga mat
- blanket or towel for mat work
- Water
- A jogging stroller isn't necessary, though it is recommended.

 

Class package pricing is as follows:

single = $20
6-class = $84
9-class = $117
12-class = $144
4-week unlimited = $110
8-week unlimited = $180
name: BABY BOOT CAMP - FREE Trial Class

description: I think it is natural for villagers with children of the same age to meetup together. Please RSVP and introduce yourselves to each other. I have to admit that I didn't leave the house much for the first year. But, I think if you guys can meet together with blankets and strollers under some shade, it would be a great break from the isolation of having a baby.
name: Newborn/non-walkers Online Meetup

description:
About the Class:

Come to this class and learn how to make a mobile application. This class teaches the process of making cross platform mobile apps. It is simpler than you think; no prior programming experience necessary. 

Attendees to this class will get equipped with the tools necessary for Mobile Application Development. 

Learn to make applications for:

Android

iOS (iPhone and iPad)

mobile web

Don’t miss out on this awesome opportunity!

75 % of all Smart Phones in the World are Android Devices

15 % of all Smart Phones in the World are iOS Devices

Please remember to bring your laptop

Please follow the directions on the confirmation page

Before Class 

Please follow the directions on the confirmation page

~~~~

Who is this class for?

This class is for everyone; no prior programming knowledge or experience required.

~~~~

Why should you take this class?

You should take this class because technology is a very important part of every business and knowing technology will give you an edge. Regardless of if you plan on making mobile apps yourself or you plan on working with someone to make a mobile app. This class will empower you with useful tools that are required for success in the app world.

~~~~

What will you learn?

The objective of this class is to set you in the right direction for Mobile Application Development.

1. We will set you up with the tools necessary for mobile app development

2. You will learn about the interface of the software development kit

3. You will get an overview of the various options available for app development

4. You will learn about app planning; how to put it all together

5. You will do exercises and make applications in class

6. You will learn about the mobile industry 

~~~~

About the instructors:    This class is taught by the combined effort of 2-3 instructors depending on the class size; all instructors work in the technology industry.

~~~~

~~~

Please bring your laptop!

~~~

How to Register:

A. Please sign up on eventbrite:http://startupsaturdays.eventbrite.com/

B. If you are already on Eventbrite then please select the number of tickets you would like to purchase from above.

C. If you have an employer sponsored education program then please contact us at: [masked]

We can work with various reimbursement and employer sponsored educational programs.

Early Bird Special: Please check our eventbrite site for the early bird specials.

~~~

Startup Saturdays - Complete Listing

http://startupsaturdays.eventbrite.com/

~~~

description: Let's meet in our home for cookie baking. I will provide safe cookie cutters and healthy decorating like nuts, raisins and shredded coconut. Let's make cute cookies with our little ones and have tea party and coffee with them afterwards. Kids can also enjoy a playtime after they are done making and eating the cookies :) We will need a healthy cookie dough with less sugar for all of us. Who can make it? Kids can take the cookies they made to their dads too!
name: Fun Shapes and Textures. Cookie baking.

group.name: Tiny Tots of San Ramon Valley

description:
The For six years now, Octopretzel has been delighting young Bay Area audiences with their colorful and inspired performances. Their shows feature handmade puppets, bubbles of all sizes, and at times, hula-hooping Kindergarteners. They have been known to inspire spontaneous kiddie mosh-pits, while still maintaining focus and interactive participation. Their songwriting presents imagery of things such as spinning tops, roly polies and whimsical imaginary creatures. From unique interpretations of traditional folk classics to fun and catchy originals, this is music that parents love and has kids asking for more!

$3 per ticket, you need only buy as many tickets as you need seats (lap children are free)
name: Octopretzel - Preschool Performance

description:
Hello Villagers!

We've had a great response in the first week of our existence.!!

I'm new to being the organizer of a Meetup. I want to welcome everyone to the group and value your input. I'd love for you to invite other villagers from your preschool or other playgroups. We would love to cross post with other Meetup groups. 

There are lots of summer events in the Bay Area. While I cannot host events centered around each festival/event, I have posted some of our favorite ones on the calendar with "yellow post-it's". Please let me know if you would like to host a meetup in your neighborhood. I'm attempting to put things on the calendar in Sunnyvale and Fremont. 

We will be posting photos on the site. We usually have one person documenting things, but sometimes we are just having too much fun to take any pics! If you would not like your child or yourself to be posted in any photos, please let us know. 

Please keep your RSVPs current as a courtesy to your event hosts. 

To help defray the website's costs and material fees, please pay $2 at the next event you attend. 

Lastly, please RSVP to this event so that I know you have read this posting. Thanks,


Elaine

description:
Join us for free at one of our highly-innovative business-networking meetings - in your city! View our full calendar of business-networking meetings. We welcome anyone to attend a GoRampUp! meeting, once, for free as our guest, so you can learn what the innovative GoRampUp! business-networking experience is all about. Note, we are not able to give you a free meeting at more than one of our many locations.

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting athttp://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance. Without this ticket you will, unfortunately, be declined access to our innovative and exclusive business-networking meeting. WITH a GoRampUp! Golden Ticket, you will be welcomed with open arms!

It can be too difficult to attract new clients. We help you fix that! We're a business-impact community. We're informal and fun, yet, by design, we're extremely effective!

We help people who work for a living to get a much greater payoff from working. We do this in three specific ways under our three CoreSuccess Platforms: 1) We help you move toward mastery with business-networking, 2) We help you move toward mastery with business performance, and, 3) We help you move toward mastery with personal development.

How do we deliver on this promise to our community members? Each month we conduct dozens of business-networking meetings in more than a dozen cities in the SF Bay Area. A member may attend all of our "OpenConnect" business-networking meetings. And our members are welcome and encouraged to attend any and all of these meetings and locations.

Each month we introduce and emphasize a learning and development subject under each of our three CoreSuccess Platforms. For each of the three learning and development subjects that we introduce and emphasize each month, we give you four different ways to learn it: We produce written learning guides, video learning guides, audio learning guide, and we cover the subjects as 15-to-20-minute mini-workshops inside of our 60-minute business-networking meetings. There's no registration or initiation fee to join. Membership in GoRampUp! is month to month. You enroll when you like, even mid-month, and you depart when you like.

Be sure to see our website to learn about our generous enrollment incentives

Also, be sure to learn about our 100-Satisfaction Money-Back Guarantee

Would you care to come to this meeting, at no cost, to see if there’s business-value for you?

• Free-Meeting Guest-RSVP and Golden Ticket Request

• View complete meeting details

• Invite a Buddy to join you

One last thing: You REALLY should check out actual testimonial videos by our members: See them here

This page was created to produce awareness of our event. However, OUR PAGES ON THIS SITE CAN BECOME OUTDATED. The authoritative source for our meeting dates/times is http://www.GoRampUp.com/calendar. Be sure to check it prior to traveling to a meeting.

description:
Wreck Room on California St. is amazing! If you haven't been, it's an absolute must! And if you have already been already countless times, you can attest to this.

Wreck Room knows we're coming and will be packing the place. I've joined up with the super fun social sporting league Zog Sports and they will be promoting this to their members as well and co-sponsoring this!

Thus, turnout is going to be excellent and this will be a sweet way to get your Friday night started, having a few cocktails (their prices are very appreciated) and playing some fun games.

Their list of games include: skee ball, punching bag game, basketball shooting game, pool, shuffleboard, and darts.... and we'll see if we can add anything else to that mix.

Bring friends and come on out. Free event :)

group.name: Bay Area Single Boomers Social Meetup

description:
Hello, boys and girls,

Ready for some summer fun? Let's get together for an evening of merriment, relaxation and enjoyment at Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, for Eddie Money's concert on Friday, August 15, at 6 PM. The Friday night summer concerts are *free*.

***** PICTURE THIS...aahhh:

Imagine sitting in your comfortable beach chair, relaxed, enjoying a cold drink, listening to great music, while the evening breeze from the ocean cools the summer air, and when evening falls, the twinkly lights reflect on the ocean. All that and great company [that would be us :) ]. What could be better. You can even dance to the fantastic beat of Eddy Money and his band if the mood strikes you. Nice, huh...so let's do it!

***** GETTING A SPOT TO SIT:

To get a piece of beach real estate to park our chairs, we need to be at the beach at least one hour ahead, so by 5 PM - and that might be cutting it a bit close. These concerts are well-attended and the beach fills up quickly, especially in the center, close to the band stand.

***** FOOD:

Since 6 PM is dinner time, you can pick up a sandwich or a pizza in Santa Cruz, on the way to the Boardwalk, or bring your food from home, and enjoy it on the beach.

Togo's is at 902 Ocean St., Santa Cruz, [masked] (according to the Internet, but you should double check, just in case);

Domino's is at 2391 Mission St., Santa Cruz, [masked] (according to the Internet, but you should double check, just in case);

OR check the Internet for any other food you might prefer.

***** CARPOOLING (for those who wish to carpool):

It is your sole responsibility to arrange for your carpool.

Meet at 3:45 PM. Traffic is heavy on Fridays, so this should allow enough time to get to Santa Cruz, pick up some food, park, and find a spot to sit on the beach.

Carpooling location/s: Because carpooling arrangements are your sole responsibility, you are free to park wherever you and the other carpoolers in your carpooling group have agreed to do so.

The North Side Municipal Parking Lot, in Los Gatos is a popular carpooling location for groups going to Santa Cruz. I am mentioning this here as one option, for your convenience, in case that you were not aware of this parking lot.

Directions to North Side Municipal Parking Lot: on Highway 17 heading South, take the Los Gatos/Saratoga Road (Highway 9) exit (20B). Bear right and go past the first traffic light, which is University Ave. Turn right into the first driveway into the North Side Municipal Parking Lot. The lot is on the right in the middle of the block past University Ave., but before N. Santa Cruz Ave. It is by Chase Bank, which is at 400 N. Santa Cruz Ave. (Please double check directions, as this information is from the Internet and I cannot vouch for its accuracy).

***** PARKING:

According to the Boardwalk's web site, parking lot fees are $12 on weekdays.

ALRIGHTY, THEN, LET'S GO HAVE SOME SUMMER FUN. :)

----------> IMPORTANT NOTE AND DISCLAIMER: The function of the organizer/s and event host/s for this event is only to schedule the event on the calendar and to write a description of the event. Joining this event is entirely voluntary on your part. It is your sole responsibility, as part of signing up for this event, to make a reasonable effort to independently investigate the risks, dangers, and hazards associated with the activities involved in participating in this event. You agree to freely accept and fully assume all such risks, dangers and hazards, and further agree to release and discharge the Organizer/s, Assistant Organizer/s and the Event Host/s of the "Bay Area Single Boomers Social" Meetup group from any and all liability arising from your participation in this group activity. Each person who signs up for an event/meetup/or outing is responsible for his or her own safety.

It is your sole responsibility to arrange for your carpool. It is important that you be careful who you carpool with and exercise common sense and caution. It is NOT a good idea, especially for women, to carpool with people that you don't know or don't know well.

Please exercise common sense, good judgement and appropriate safety conduct.

description:
Join us for a FREE outdoor concert series featuring a wide array of musical genres that will get your spirits up, your heart pumping, and your feet dancing!

July 18 -- Shane Dwight

July 25 -- Soul Kiss

Aug. 1 -- Sugadady

Aug. 8 -- Usual Suspects

Aug. 15 -- Entourage

Aug. 22 -- Super Bad

Aug. 29 -- Sage

Sponsored by the Morgan Hill Chamber of Commerce and its many business partners, this summer concert series takes place in/on the grassy knolls of the city's outdoor ampitheatre complex.

Bring: Lawn chairs and/or blankets to sit upon, and your favorite portable foods and beverages. You can purchase assorted wines and soft drinks in the venue, too.

Wear: Layers. It's warm when the sun's still up, but becomes chilly when the sun sets, hence, fantastic weather for dancing!

Meetup: 5:45 p.m.-ish to select your spot on the greens, put down your "stuff," and keep watch for other FCMC members! Enjoy your picnic dinner.

Warm-up band: 6:00-6:45 p.m.

Main band, dancing, and fun: 7:00-9:00 p.m.

venue.name: Morgan Hill Community and Cultural Center

how_to_find_us: in the Ampitheatre complex

Bhrigu Raj Jhabua, is a social entrepreneur and Angel Investor based out of India & San Francisco.  Along with several Silicon Valley angel groups and think tanks, Mr. Jhabua is currently involved in developing an internet initiative to empower underprivileged creative people.  His investment portfolio has some fast growing SV startups.

Roger King, (Angel Investor, Founder of Bay Angels and currently raising 1M for www.pree.it Also searching for the next great startup)


Roger Royse, (Angel Investor, founder of Royse Law Firm, invests mainly in early stage startup software and product companies!)

Valeriy Kondruk, (Angel Investor and Entrepreneur, in early stage tech startups. Partner at Unlimited Capital VC. Searching for great projects to invest and help succeed.) 

George Parish, (Startup Entrepreneur, Mentor, Pitch Coach, Business Development Pro., Public Speaker. President * Founder at CONSULTANTS, GP)

Gautam Barua, Gautam Barua has extensive experience in investment management, technology, and entrepreneurship.  Advisor, international private equity firm. Previously involved in $80m of clean water and energy investments. Co-founded and serving on the board of a leading renewable energy company. 


We are searching for the next "Startup" investment!

description:
Pride & Joy

Friday, August 9th

They're the Pride of the Bay Area and a Joy to anyone who loves to dance. They have achieved this by presenting the most timeless Pop/Soul Music of Our Time in an ELECTRIFYING HIGH-STYLE SHOW that pulls the audience directly into the heart of their performance. This band can play anywhere from the most popular clubs on the circuit to wedding receptions the top society parties and corporate events everybody, everywhere, instantly relates to the music.

Let's get together, mingle & dance with friends & enjoy this wonderful FREE upscale venue.

We can meet & mingle around 6 pm. Then some may move to the dance area as the band starts at 7:00-8:30 on the main concert stage on the fountain area.

Look for balloons at our "STANDING ROOM ONLY" initial meeting spot in the rotunda area. When the music starts, the mingling spot may move to the dance area so look for us there too..;)

There will be family activities, food/drinks for sale and dancing! Seating is VERY limited but why sit when this NorCal premiere party band will be rockin'.....
name: 2014 Summer Concert with "PRIDE & JOY" Band

description:
Friday Night Music In The Vineyards

Start: 7:30pm End: 9:30pm

Hannah Nicole Vineyards

East Patio 

Address: 6700 Balfour Road 

(map)

http://wwww.hnvwines.com

Undercover Girls: A Rock and Roll Revival.

Gates open at 6 p.m.

Tickets $20.00 pp, and available on eventbrite.

You can bring in your own food and have a picnic, but no outside alcohol allowed.

Undercover Girls is a unique Rock Tribute is a five piece, all-female a rock & roll revival with complete with costumes, choreography and classic rock.

Covering one end of the classic rock era to the other, Undercover Girls tribute band performs a wide range of artists including, but not limited to, the rolling stones, van halen, heart, the doobie brothers, pat benatar, janis joplin, steppenwolf, prince, and the go-go's.

 

http://cdn2-b.examiner.com/sites/default/files/styles/image_content_width/hash/f1/29/f129a75033d801860cd65f3e2271d97a.jpg?itok=1tFCGXA1
name: Friday Night Music at Hannah Nicole Vineyards

description:
Join us in scenic Moss Beach for a concert in an intimate listening room, in an evening highlighting music and art inspired by our wine country and coast. The show blends the original guitar music of Brian Gore with projected illustrations, animations and one of a kind live digital drawing by Bill Russell, to tell 'stories without words' about our fabled region. Watch a short video of what we do (click here).   The audience chooses a subject from the inspiring local environs of Half Moon Bay to be drawn live in a special finale segment of the show.  Please help us pick which subject to draw in advance at our website (click here). 

This is a one-of-a-kind experience in a stunningly beautiful location. Participants will have a chance to mingle, drink and dine before the show begins. Dinner, drink and show is provided for an all-inclusive price of $30. Dinner and drinks starts at 6:00pm  Show at 7:00pm.

For tickets contact: Sharon via [masked]  or call [masked] . For directions to Cypress Meadows, Directions to Cypress Meadows

.
name: Pairing Wine, Art and Music in Moss Beach

description:
Get psyched to put all the knowledge we've been gaining from these outstanding sessions to use....coming this summer, save the date for the first ever Adventure Design Group ADVENTURE JAM!

This'll work much like a traditional game jam, but with a focus on live immersive experiences that bridge games, tech, theater, physical environments, and public space.

We'll get together, split into semi-random 3-5 person groups with a nice spread of skills, and announce a theme for the jam. From that point through the next 48 hours, you'll crunch like crazy to build the most amazing experience you can! Then we'll share, vote on awards, and either go out for drinks or collapse in a heap, depending on how much sleep we've had.

So start taking notes and stockpiling ideas, I think some great projects and newly forged collaborations could come from this weekend of creative intensity!

Location: South Park (to be shared with attendees)

Snacks: There will be a small attendance fee (probably $10) to cover food and snacks during the jam so we stay energized. To be confirmed closer to event.

Schedule:
- Friday, 6pm: Gather and socialize (Be on time!!)
- Friday, 6:30pm: Reveal theme
- Friday, 7:30pm: Present pitches, shuffle teams if necessary
- Friday-Sunday: Make your experiences!
- Sunday, 4pm: Present your work!
- Sunday, 5pm: Awards!

description:
Let's get together to discuss the first 3 chapters in Brene Brown's "Daring Greatly: : How the Courage to Be Vulnerable Transforms the Way We Live, Love, Parent, and Lead"

If you have not heard of Brene, check out her TED talk link below: http://www.ted.com/talks/brene_brown_on_vulnerability.html

This book is available at most libraries and on Amazon at http://www.amazon.com/Daring-Greatly-Courage-Vulnerable-Transforms-ebook/dp/B007P7HRS4/

There is a reading guide at http://files.meetup.com/1459183/Daring-Greatly-Reading-Guide.pdf if you like reading guides to guide your discussion!

In Daring Greatly, Dr. Brown challenges everything we think we know about vulnerability. Based on twelve years of research, she argues that vulnerability is not weakness, but rather our clearest path to courage, engagement, and meaningful connection. The book that Dr. Brown’s many fans have been waiting for, Daring Greatly will spark a new spirit of truth—and trust—in our organizations, families, schools, and communities.

venue.name: TBD -- somewhere in Berkeley, CA. Will be walkable to BART and the UC Berkeley campus

name: Discuss Chapters 1-3 in Brene Brown's "Daring Greatly"
