group.name: Irresistible Women & Amazing Men: Conscious Singles Events

description:
"Understanding the Awakened Masculine – What Inspires Him to Love, Adore, and Cherish You!"

This is class #3 in the 3-part "Get Ready to Meet Your Soul Mate!" Series for smart, savvy, spiritual women who are ready to attract the love of her life!

Class #1 - How to Be Irresistibly Feminine…Forever! - June 20, 2014

Class #2 - Secrets to Finding Quality, Available Men - July 18, 2014

Class #3 - Understanding the Awakened Masculine – What Inspires Him to Love, Adore, and Cherish You! - August 15, 2014 

Reserve your seat today! Class size is limited and will sell out! Tickets are $15 which you may pay at the door.

Irresistible Women and Amazing Men Members: Bring a friend (first-time only) for *free*! 

* * *

"Understanding the Awakened Masculine" is for you if you're a woman who wants to better understand what makes men tick so you can more joyfully get your relationship needs met, to learn to uplift the men in your life so they are inspired to love, adore, and cherish you. You'll discover what men really think when it comes to love, sex, and commitment and how to avoid making the dangerous mistakes that (unknowingly) repel potential partners

In this special class, just for single women, an exclusive panel of Amazing Men will be answering YOUR most burning questions about men, love, dating, sex, and commitment...from their perspective!

Have You Ever Wondered...

- How could he have suddenly disappeared, when thingsseemed to have been going so great?

- What compels a man to want you and only you!

- What are conscious men REALLY looking for in relationship?

- Where do amazing men go when they want to meet a great woman?

What are YOUR most pressing questions? When you RSVP, please write the question, in the box provided, you would most like to ask the men, and, if your question is selected to be read at the event, you will receive a special Irresistibly Feminine gift from Jan : )


See you there! 
Blessings on Your Path to Attracting the Love of Your Life! 
Love, Jan

* * * 
What past participants have had to say: 

-"Yes..lots of Masculine presence last night...penetrating and delicious...shiny truth and goodness.... I was so touched with the complexity of the emotional make-up of these men and their expression of it....a very good sharing for us women and it is a very big step in healing for us all. Bravo!" ~Jan Cercone 

-"I was really inspired by last night's Understanding the Awakened Masculine event. The group of women who came to this event were beautiful, open and really game for new and different experience of men." ~Patrick Wyzorski 

-"This was a fun and interesting event. We were blessed with a panel of conscious appreciative men who generously shared from their hearts. They were honest and real." ~Linda K. Grace

-"It was truly AMAZING, Jan!! So appreciating YOU and all the wonderful men who came tonight !!! The ENERGY was off the charts ... so much fun, so inspiring, so filled with wonder-full expectancy in ALL AREAs of my life ... YES, it was THAT MAGICAL !!! Thanks so much for all of your FOCUS, BEAUTIFUL ENERGY .... and creating space for this to HAPPEN. xo! ~Mahima Gabriel
name: Understanding the Awakened Masculine ~ Class #3 of 3 in the Soul Mate Series

group.name: East Bay Buddies-Free tonight? Let's do something!

description:
Children's Fairyland is having a benefit on August 15th (Friday) from 7-10pm and it's for GROWN-UP'S ONLY! This is what call the Happiest of Hours!  Why?  Because... 1) Happy Hour 2) Beer at Fairlyland 3) Fairlyland is kid free 4) you can feel good because it's a benefit event for an Oakland landmark! This event sells out and tickets go on sale ($25) on July 12th. Break out your fairy wings and Batman capes!

http://oaklandish.com/oakblog/save-the-date-fairyland-for-grownups/

From the Website:

During daylight hours, Fairyland is off-limits to grown-ups. Anyone who wants to enter the park has to arrive with a kid in tow. But not this August 15th from 7-10pm when Oaklandish and Fairyland are teaming up to host a night of pure imagination, for adults only! Ever wanted to drink a beer inside a whale? This is your night.

This is the fourth Oaklandish presents: Fairyland for Grownups benefit. Proceeds from the event will go to Fairyland and help them keep admissions low (or even free) for local kids.

Tickets will be $25 each and will go on sale at 10am July 12.
name: Oakland's Children's Fairyland 4 GROWN UPS!!! Aug 15th

description:
Hi!  I have a regular game night at my house on third Fridays.  Recent games played usually include more social games such as Flux, Apples to Apples, Blokus, In a Pickle, Loaded Questions, etc.  But we could certainly have a more strategy type game if we get enough people interested.  I usually make some food like chili or lasagna. It will be kid friendly as I have a nearly 6 year old who would love to have some kids to play with (XBOX, Wii?). Bring snacks to share.  Warning to allergy sufferers - we have a cat. She will mostly be in hiding.  It might be helpful to have a couple more folding chairs if we get big crowd.  I have about six people (not on Meetup) who regularly show up too.

Hope to see some of you here!    ~Elise
name: Games Night at Elise's house Friday 7pm

description:
ARE YOU LADIES READY TO SHOUT... BINGO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


This is how it works... It will cost $15.00 per person, which includes 8 games of Bingo and pizza. Beer, wine, and soda can be purchased yourself.

If we have 15 women, then each game will be worth $15.00 in value. The last game of the night will be a game of blackout (you have to mark all squares on your card) and this game will be worth double, which means you will win a prize of value of $30.00. The more women we have playing means more money in our prize fund for the winner of each game. 

IF YOU DO RSVP YES AND YOU DO NOT SHOW UP, YOU WILL STILL HAVE TO PAY FOR THIS EVENT TO VERONICA.

You can purchase additional Bingo cards if you would like... 8 extra cards will cost you $5.00. This extra money will be donated to the Greater Bay Area Make A Wish Foundation.

We have the Bingo cards and Bingo daubers for this event so you don't need to bring anything. 

This event is combined with the Tri-City Women's Social so there is opportunity to meet women outside our group also. Feel free to bring a friend but please make sure they are coming as you are responsible for their RSVP.

OK LADIES......ARE YOU UP FOR THE CHALLENGE? LET ME PRACTICE...(CLEARING THROAT) B5.....N32......064.......................BINGO!

description:
Please join us for a Sufi gathering of Dhikr, which is the reciting and chanting of the Most Beautiful Names of God which polish the mirror of our heart and reflect the light of the Divine Secrets contained within.

This dhikr is likely to be primarily seated; you are welcome to bring a cushion and a blanket or prayer rug.  There will be chairs for those who prefer them.  We hope to have some tea and refreshments after the dhikr; you are welcome to bring finger food to share.

Leading us will be our beloved teacher Jeff Rahim Bronner. Rahim is a healer, teacher, and Muqaddam Murabbi Ruhi in the Shadhiliyya Sufi. He leads workshops all over the country and loves to help people heal their hearts and
come closer back to God.

A donation of $10, $20, or whatever you can give would be appreciated; no one turned away for lack of funds.
name: Dhikr with Jeff Rahim Bronner

group.name: Berkeley | Oakland Center For Shamanic Healing  Circle

description:
Friday Night Munay-Ki Rites

Community Circle Meetup!

WE"RE BACK!!!

Moving to the 3rd Friday of each month

at the Foundation of the Sacred Stream.


March 21, 2014 (3rd Friday new circle meeting date)
April 18, 2014    (3rd Friday new circle meeting date)
May 16, 2014 (3rd Friday new circle meeting date)


We invite you to discover the Nine Rites of Munay-Ki. These rites of Shamanic Awakening, Initiation and Empowerment are given in a Universal form and are for anyone receiving a calling from spirit. We are honored to share these Rites with you... as a FREE "Give Away" from Spirit.

Drop in and receive a different Munay-Ki Rite each Second Friday of the month. These transmissions are passed as a Free "Give Away" from spirit...

Please view the videos below to gain a deeper understanding of the Munay-Ki Rites and what to expect in our community circle!


Many have felt a calling from spirit and are awakening to make a difference in this world. We, as a people, are on a vision quest. Living a vision and questing for more of who we truly can become. We invite you to discover the Nine Rites of Munay-Ki and engage the quest for deeper, broader vision of who and what you truly are.

The Nine Rites of the Munay-Ki are transmissions and attunements kept alive and handed down by lineage keepers of the wisdom traditions of shamanic cultures worldwide. The external form varies from culture to culture but the essence of the transmission is universal. What is handed down are transmissions of energetic seeds that when nurtured, quicken the path to spiritual development and enlightenment. They quicken our journey towards who and what we are becoming as a species. The seeds of these rites can grow within anyone. This is our human birthright and path.

The Munay-Ki rites, as brought to us through the Q'ero Shamans of the Peruvian Andes, are a path of fire and a path of lightning; a fast track to recognizing our true divine nature. This all is a journey in space, time and energy. The  Munay-Ki is the  rocket fuel for this journey.


We are honored to share these rites with you...

Join us now on this journey of discovery.

The adventure continues the 3rd Friday of every month.

For more information please contact:

Kent Dorsey - [masked]

Suzanne Savage - <a>[masked]</a>

Nine Great Rites of the Munay KI
Dr. Alberto Villoldo introduces the rites of the Munay KI. Rites that have the potential to change the world. Munay Sonqo... Thank you for this gift to the world.

undefined

 

This video shows each of the Nine Rites being passed:


undefined

 

NINE GREAT RITES OF THE MUNAY-KI


The Nine Rites of the Munay-Ki consists of two type of rites. The Foundation Rites and the Lineage Rites. The Foundation Rites consist of  The Healer’s Rite, The Bands of Power, The Harmony Rites and The Seers’ Rite prepare us with the needed tools for the initiations to come. These Foundation Rites prepares our luminous energy field to hold the vibration and power available in the next five rites, the Lineage Rites

MUNAY = LOVE FROM THE HEART

KI = ENGAGED AND IN MOTION


Foundation Rites

Healer's Rite

Connects you to a lineage of luminous beings from the past, who come to assist you in your personal transformation.  Awakens the healing power in your hands so that everyone you touch is blessed. There is tremendous spiritual assistance available, and these luminous ones work in our sleep to heal the wounds of the past and of our ancestors.

Bands of Power

Five luminous energetic bands representing earth, air, fire, water, and pure light that are woven into the luminous energy field (LEF) for protection. Through Intent they act as filters, breaking down all negative energy that comes toward the person, into one of the five elements.  These energies then feed your LEF instead of making you sick. The Bands of Power are always 'on', and negative energies bounce right off them. In a world filled with fear, the bands provide essential protection. The Bands bring us into union with all of the elements. They do not insulate us from life, but rather deepen our connection and attunment with the Earth and all the elements.

Harmony Rite

You receive seven allies bringing gifts of transformation and harmony. Four allies,  organizing principles of creation, are placed into your four lower Chakras as well as three "Archangels" into your upper Chakras.  In the first Chakra, you receive the ally of serpent; jaguar goes into the second; hummingbird into the third; and eagle into the fourth; next you receive three archangels:  the Keeper of the Lower World (our unconscious), the Keeper of the Middle World (our waking world), and the Protector of the Upper World (our super conscious). These allies are transmitted into your Chakras as seeds of energy, each a particular vibration. This is a path of literal enlightenment - Infusing light into each Chakra.

Seer's Rite

Reawakens the Shaman's way to perceiving the World. Five luminous Extra-cerebral pathways of light are woven and installed that connect the visual cortex with the third eye and two are woven that connect the heart chakra to the visual cortex. This awakens the "inner seer" and your ability to perceive the invisible world of energy and Spirit.

Vibration of Angels and Archangels

Lineage Rites:

Daykeeper Rite

This is a lineage Rite of the Divine Feminine. You connect to a lineage of master healers from the past who have fully awakened their nurturing ways. Daykeepers are able to call on the ancient altars to heal and bring balance to the earth, call on the sun to rise each day, and bring humans into harmony with mother Earth following the cycle of life.  They are the midwives, herbalists and curanderas.  This rite helps you begin to heal your inner feminine, step beyond fear, and practice peace.

Wisdomkeeper's Rite

This lineage rite offers gifts of the Divine Masculine. You connect to a lineage of luminous beings from the past and the future who have defeated death and stepped outside of time. This rite awakens stories that lift people up, speaking from a mythic realm to engage and lift with teaching stories. This rite is associated with the snow-capped mountains, perhaps a distant memory of our ancestors from the Himalayas. This rite helps you to begin to heal your inner masculine, step outside of time, become steeped in the medicine teachings and taste infinity.

Earthkeeper Rite

This rite connects you to the archangels that are guardians of our galaxy. The Earthkeepers, who are stewards of all life on the Earth, come under the direct protection of these archangels and can summon their power when they need to in order to bring healing and balance to any situation.This rite connects you to the stars, and to the sun, our local star. It helps you learn the ways of the seer and dream the world into being.

Starkeeper's Rite

This rite anchors you safely to the time after the great change, said to occur around 2012.  Your physical body begins to evolve into homo luminous, the aging process is slowed down, your DNA is re-informed, and you become more resistant to disease. When you receive these rites, you acquire stewardship of the time to come and all future generations.


Creator Rite

Awakens the Creator-light within and brings forth a sense of stewardship for all creation, from the smallest grain of sand to the largest cluster of galaxies in the universe.  Once attained only through direct transmission from Spirit, it is now possible to transmit from one person to another.

As you work with the germination of these rites you'll be touched and blessed by angels. You simply need to open yourself to the wisdom of the Earthkeepers, and all will be bestowed upon you.

 

Facilitated by Kent Dorsey & Suzanne Savage

Please visit Munay Ki Awakening .

Please visit the Center For Shamanic Healing website.

The user of said information accepts all responsibility for viewing and/or using this service. Kent Dorsey and Suzanne Savage  Shamanic Practitioners, are not  licensed physicians or surgeons and Shamanic Healing treatments are not licensed by the state of California but are complementary to healing arts services licensed by the state. Shamanic healing is an ancient spiritual method of healing that deals with the spiritual aspect of illness. As shamanic healing deals with the spiritual aspect of illness there is no way to predict the results that will manifest emotionally or physically. Shamanic healing does not replace the need for traditional psychological and medical treatment. The information on this site is not intended to diagnose or treat any medical/psychological concerns. We advise you to contact a licensed physician or Certified Medical Practitioner for any medical/psychological concerns.

description:
Discovery hikers are checking out some new trails this week over in San Ramon up on Rocky Ridge at the Bollinger Canyon Staging area in Las Trampas Park . Not much SHADE on this one . Were Starting off early to Beat the Heat ! 

 The parking area for this hike opens up at 8 am . and were meeting at the trail head that heads up the Rocky Ridge View Trail. This hike is NOT A BEGINNERS HIKE . This Hike is for experienced and well conditioned hikers that are familiar with long sections of somewhat STEEP and SLIPPERY LOOSE ROCKY Sections of dirt hiking trails .

 The Proposed route is for a : 6 Mile Loop along wide open fire trails and is rated Moderate Plus / Plus for the difficulty with the incline and strength needed to keep up with a group at a 2  1/2 mph pace ! The directions were taking is up from the Staging area on the Rocky Ridge View Trail along the top of Rocky Ridge and wind back down along the Elderberry Trail back to the parking area . Total length is shy of 6 miles and estimate finish in 3 hours. 80-90 % of this hike is in the FULL SUN ( Reads Sun Screen ) . Hopefully we will be off the hill around 11 am before the heat of the day !

 

 The Organizers wish to remind all hikers to bring plenty of drinking water for the 3 hour hike and wear sturdy footwear designed for hiking on dirt and or rocky surfaces. Restrooms are available at the start of the hike but not any other while out on this route . DOGS are allowed on this hike route , this is a loop hike can your dog go the full 6 miles ? Come join us for a little fun in the California Sun and hike with one of the Bay Areas active hiking Meetups !

venue.name: Las Trampas Regional Wilderness
venue.address_1: Bollinger Canyon Rd at Rocky Ridge Rd

how_to_find_us: Drive into the Las Trampas Reginional Park at the End of Bolllinger Canyon Rd in San Ramon - Parking available at the end of Bolllinger Canyon Rd. Plan to arrive early for a quick meet and greet and we will get on to the hike alittle after 8 am .
name: Rocky Ridge @ Las Trampas - 6 Mile Loop - Rated Moderate ++

description:
Bike Skills 101 -- Fundamental Bike Handling Skills sponsored by BicycleLawyer.com

 

This 4-hour co-ed clinic is the foundation of everything else you’ll learn on the bike. This is the clinic where we teach the old dogs new tricks and the newbies the fundamentals. You’ll learn about balance and weight distribution and how that affects your ability to ride your bike safely and confidently. We’ll learn skills like riding with no hands, emergency stops, and how to look behind you while holding your line, how to steer, and counter-steer. After just four hours, we guarantee you’ll be a better bike handler and have much more fun on the bike.  PLEASE NOTE:  Bike Skills 101 is the pre-requisite for all other Bike Skills road clinic modules.

This is an outside, on-the-bike clinic.  You will need to provide your own bike, helmet, and cycling clothes.

 

Please note, this clinic is not part of the regular Velo Girls club activities.  There is a registration fee for this clinic.  We are not accepting payment via meetup.  We have posted this event on Meetup for informational purposes only.  You may RSVP on the meetup, but only those who have registered online @ http://savvybike.eventbrite.com will receive detailed confirmation information.
name: Bike Skills 101 sponsored by BicycleLawyer.com

description:
WHO 

Calling all makers, IoT startups, developers, students and hardware novices! This is the event for you! You can work in teams or solo, so just register and come for 36 hours of tinkering with the Intel® IoT Developer Kit!

WHAT 

Kickoff Saturday AM with a workshop to get to know your free Dev Kit. The Dev Kit comes with a Galileo-based on Intel® architecture and hardware and software pin-compatible with Arduino. Plus you'll get lots of sensors, software and accessories. After the workshop, ideas will get pitched, and you can start hacking. You'll have access to tools, yummy food, giveaways on-site, and prizes for the best IoT solutions. 

Followed by hacking through the night and all day Sunday. Final demos will be on Sunday evening!

HOW 
Register here!
name: Intel IoT Roadshow

description:
The Old Mission San Juan Bautista was built on 1797.

It was the fifteens of the Spanish missions established in present-day California.

Barracks for the soldiers, a nunnery, the historic Jose Castro House, and other buildings were constructed around a large plaza in front of the church and can be seen today in their original form.

Famous film director, Alfred Hitchcock filmed a part of film ‘Vertigo’ around the mission.
name: Trip to Old Mission San Juan Bautista

description:
With a steady influx of new filmmakers coming into the group, we have decided to host another One Day Filmmaking Workshop: Intro to Digital Filmmaking.

This will be a full day starting at 9 a.m. with a one hour break for lunch.

This event will cover the ins and outs of what it takes to craft your very own films, web-series or documentaries with insights into storytelling, basic equipment needed (with hands on tutorials), lighting, sound, camera operation and post production.

We will also take a look at camera options for the next generation of filmmakers that will include DSLRs, 4K Cameras and how to shoot with mobile and tablet devices.

As part of the workshop we will screen short films, cover terminology, set etiquette and how best to deliver visuals that help tell the story.

If you are just starting out, need a refresher or just want to cover all your bases - this one-day workshop will help you as you get ready to go into production.

$30 Workshop Fee.

Cash or Paypal, please RSVP and instructions on how to guarantee your spot will be sent prior to the event.
name: One Day Intro to Digital Filmmaking Workshop

description:
Registration - simplydoitacademy.com/ehwRW

Early Fee: $795

Regular Fee: $895

----------------------------------------------------

Relevant for both beginners and experienced investors who wants to learn about becoming private lenders.

Many investors are asking themselves what investment approach they should choose or where do I start.

Private lending offers a method to start or continue investing in real estate.

But where do you start and what does it take to become a private lender.

This FULL DAY class will provide you with the info you need to know about becoming a private lender.

In this detailed class we will teach you:

Part I: Private Lending Foundation

Why Private lending

Private lending systems

Risks in private lending 

Who should utilize private lending

Part II: Evaluation Practices

Vetting the borrower

Vetting the Deal

Onboarding Investors

Part III: Developing your Power Team

Who are the parties you must have in your dealing

What are the roles of each party in the transaction

Part VI: Managing the Project

The construction aspect

Mitigating project's risks

Finalizing a project

Part V: Streamlining the Business

Branding

Goal Setting

Creating your entity

Generating leads

Back office systems & processes


Part VI: Case Studies

Part VII: Resources

Part VIII: Conclusion & Summary
name: Become a Private Lender - Full Day Class on Starting Your Private Lending Biz

In this detailed class we will teach you:

Part I: Private Lending Foundation

Why Private lending

Private lending systems

Risks in private lending 

Who should utilize private lending

Part II: Evaluation Practices

Vetting the borrower

Vetting the Deal

Onboarding Investors

Part III: Developing your Power Team

Who are the parties you must have in your dealing

What are the roles of each party in the transaction

Part VI: Managing the Project

The construction aspect

Mitigating project's risks

Finalizing a project

Part V: Streamlining the Business

Branding

Goal Setting

Creating your entity

Generating leads

Back office systems & processes


Part VI: Case Studies

Part VII: Resources

Part VIII: Conclusion & Summary
name: Become a Private Lender - Full Day Class on Starting Your Private Lending Biz

description:
Save the date and join us for our 4th annual picnic to be held at Sanborn County Park in Saratoga.    We'll make a short approx 4.2 mile hike and have a picnic lunch afterwards in the beautiful Sanborn County Park.

About Sanborn Park: Sanborn County Park is a lushly wooded park with over 3449 acres of mixed evergreen forests that is nestled in the Santa Cruz Mountains and located between the town of Saratoga and Skyline Boulevard. Sanborn Park has over fifteen mles of trails with many options from easy nature walks to challenging hilly hikes all the way to Castle Rock and Skyline Blvd. One of the parks main features is the San Andreas Fault which cuts along Lyndon Canyon, Lake Ranch and Sanborn Road. Expect to see a variety of mixed terrain including Oak, Madrone, Douglas Fir and beautiful tall Redwood Trees.

Hike Details:  We will be taking the Peterson Trail to the Sanborn Trail which we'll will take part way to Skyline.  We'll return on the same route and connect to the San Andreas Trail to the Todd Creek Trail which will take us back to the park for the picnic.  http://www.sccgov.org/sites/parks/parkfinder/Documents/SanbornGuideMapFinal.pdf.  

Food Details:  It will be a potluck.  We will be providing bbq items for everyone as well as all the picnic essentials including the paper plates, knives and forks, napkins, water, sparkling water, soft drinks and ice.   This is provided compliments of your membership dues.

It would be fun if everyone could bring a small dish to share.  Please post in the comments section what you would like to bring.  Items we need are salads (all kinds), desserts and appetizers.  Extra meat dishes also welcome.

Carpool Info: Meet at 8:50 a.m at 4th Street in Saratoga. The lot is located on located behind Plumed Horse Restaurant. On Highway 9 going through the village of Saratoga, turn right on 4th Street. Parking is first parking lot of the left hand side.

Driving Directions to Trailhead: Take 85 exit to Saratoga Avenue . Go through the village of Saratoga and up Highway 9. Take a left onto Sanborn Road. Drive for approximately one mile and you will come to the park entrance which is located on the right hand side. There is a $6.00 park entrance fee.

Get Directions from your location.
how_to_find_us: Please follow the directions below or click on the "Get Directions" link which will direct you to a correct Google map.
name: South Bay Ramblers Annual Picnic - Sanborn County Park Saratoga

description:
Reiki II is a must for all Reiki I initiates. Reiki II brings a whole new level of Reiki to light through the use of symbols. With Reiki II you will get a richer and deeper understanding of this healing art as well as specific tools and techniques on how to use Reiki in practical, every day situations.

In this 1-day workshop you will learn:

- Reiki II symbols
- Healing mental and emotional issues
- Distance healing across time and space
- How to remove negative energy
- How to increase clarity
- How to charge chakras
- Get a brief Reiki I refresher
- Brief introduction of Reiki III/Master

You will walk away from this class with the ability to practice Reiki II on yourself and others with confidence.

I would encourage everyone who has learned Reiki I to learn Reiki II.

The Reiki II Class is $150.

For students of mine who have taken Reiki I previously, please remember to bring your Reiki manuals with you to class.

For students who have already taken Reiki II from other teachers/schools or for students who would like to repeat the class the cost is only $75 (Please bring your previous Reiki II certificate with you to class).

We accept cash, personal checks, Visa, MasterCard, Discover and American Express. Payment is collected at the beginning of the class.

We will have a 1 hour lunch break. You are welcome to bring your lunch with you or you have the option of eating at a number of establishments within walking distance of the Center.

There is plenty of free parking at the Center. For more parking information and directions you can visit our website at: http://www.reiki-energyhealing.com/contact.html.

Space is limited so please RSVP to reserve your seat:

Register Now!

For additional information on the teacher you can visit our website at:
http://www.reiki-energyhealing.com/biography.html


For more information feel free to call or email us.

Looking forward to seeing you all there!

Register Now!
how_to_find_us: Reiki Energy Healing is located in the shopping center across the street from McDonalds and next door to Star Aquatics off of Landess in Milpitas.

description:
Let's spend the day and evening at the pier to check out the Exploratorium on Pier 15, then take a tour to Alcatraz from Pier 33 in the afternoon, and perhaps, if we are still up for it, dine at the wharf in the evening.

You are responsible for getting your tickets to the Exploratorium and Alcatraz if joining this event.

Exploratorium - $22 each for Bay Area residents (But you can get free pass through your public library card)
Alcatraz tour - $30 each (tour time: 3:20 PM)
+ cash for snacks, coffee break, and dinner

Suggested Itinerary:

9 AM - travel time from the Southbay

10 AM - meet at the Exploratorium entrance on Pier 15

1 - 2:30 PM - lunch (suggestion: Pier23 Café)

2:30-3 PM - walk to Pier 33

Alcatraz tour: 3:20 PM (if you are interested in Alcatraz and dinner only, please meet us at Pier 33 at 3 PM with your ticket)

Dinner - 7 PM

After lunch, those who are interested can book tickets for the Alcatraz tour in the afternoon. Pier 33, from where the Alcatraz tour departs, is straight 1/2 mile from the Exploratorium.  If you want to skip the Exploratorium, please meet us at Pier 33 at 3 PM with your Alcatraz tour tickets.

Please purchase your ticket for Alcatraz tour: 3:20 PM.

Otherwise, plenty of time in the afternoon to head to Fisherman's Wharf if not joining the Alcatraz tour. We can end the evening with a nice dinner at one of the piers before heading back to the 'burbs of Silicon Valley. :-)
name: Exploratorium, Alcatraz and Dinner at the Wharf

description:
HTML 5 Application Development Training

1 Day - All levels

What: This is a 1 day HTML5  application development training.

Description: Get the insight into HTML5 Application Development with this 1 day it training course. 

The class begins with an introduction to HTML5, Document Object Model and an overview of JavaScript. Following this, Event Handling mechanism is explained. Following this Forms, Audio and Video APIs are explained. The morning session concludes with an exercise.

The afternoon starts out with HTML5 Canvas. Canvas API is explained. Following this, a couple of HTML5 Canvas/Graphics libraries are explained. Students will work on building an HTML5 Applications from scratch using Canvas, Canvas Libraries that integrates Canvas with Audio, Video and Drag and Drop APIs. 

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

This is an all levels training

Summary

------MORNING------

- Introduction to HTML5

- Review of DOM and JavaScript

- Event Handling in HTML5

- Forms API

- Video and Audio API

------AFTERNOON------

-Canvas API

-Drag And Drop API

-Integrate Audio and Video API with Canvas

-HTML5 Graphic Libraries

-Developing Canvas Applications using Custom Libraries

------------------------------------------------------------

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

Contact: [masked]

 Benefits 

Career: Lay your own path to success. Learn HTML5 and taste the fruit of success that comes from being in demand. 

Make more money: HTML programmers make on average $30,000 more per year than professionals who only know Microsoft Office. 

Be in control on the web: HTML is the foundation of the web and knowing HTML is essential for developing and managing a successful online presence. 

Increase strategic value: Become indispensible to your employer. 

Get a promotion: If you are looking for a promotion or a new job then knowing HTML will increase your chances of success. 

Mobile applications: HTML is used for Cross Platform Mobile Application Development; learn the language that is powering mobile applications. 

Value to businesses: HTML is of importance to all businesses because of its integral value to the web. 

Better work life balance: Knowing how to code can lead to a circumstance in your life where you have better control over your career choices and work options. Most employers allow programmers the freedom to decide their own schedule and also offer more opportunities to work from home for programmers than non programmers. 

A standard practice: It is integral to know how to program in todays competitive environment. If you have been looking for a language to learn then make HTML your 1st choice. It will give you a lot of power in a very little time. Let’s face it; sooner or later you will have to learn how to program. Why wait? 

You can do it: Learning to program is not as hard as you think. With our coaching you will be able to bridge the programming gap. 

Beneficial to all employers: Getting training in HTML5 is of value to all companies as it helps employees produce better quality work. HTML5 can make the difference between average quality output and excellent quality output. It is of value to any position that requires communication or data interaction. The skills learned in this class are applicable to all departments of any company including but not limited to IT, Data Analysis, Sales, Strategic planning and Marketing. The skills taught can be implemented in daily online tasks. 

Why:

-  HTML5 offers faster image downloads, especially for mobile users

- HTML5 offers improved SEO

- HTML5 offers Sophisticated animation effects

- HTML5 offers Easier Web and Mobile App Development

- BBC is turning towards HTML5 for application development

- Zynga used HTML5 to make Words With Friends, FarmVille Express, Zynga Poker Mobile Web and CityVille Express. Zynga continues to use HTML5 for product development globally.

- SAP is using HTML5 for Enterprise Mobile Apps

- HTML5 is one of the most desired skills by employer

 How to Register:A. Please sign up on eventbrite:  

http://startupsaturdays.eventbrite.com/

B. If you are already on Eventbrite then please select the number of tickets you would like to purchase from above. C. If you have an employer sponsored education program then please contact us at: [masked] can work with various reimbursement and employer sponsored educational programs.

description:
Deep inside your heart lies an expansive spirit known as your soul. Few of us have ever touched this place, let alone spend our days and lives there. But through the grace and mercy of Divine Love, it is possible to travel inside to touch this secret garden, and to fly up through the heavens and gather the secret qualities which comprise your amazing soul.

In this experiential, “hands on” workshop, we will take a look at the qualities of your soul, help you get in touch with its beauty and majesty, and then use this foundation to begin healing yourself and your family line. In my experience as a teacher, there is no greater healing power than the beauty and mercy of God. By asking God to heal ourselves and our families, we can become the hands, eyes, ears, mind and heart of the greatest healing force in the Universe.

When:  Sat, August 16, 10:00am - 5:00pm  
Where:  Unitarian Church, 505 E Charleston Rd, Palo Alto, CA 94306 
Tuition:  Donation basis; please give what feels right — everyone welcome! 
Class size:  30 participants max. 
Contact:  Hasna Peggy - [masked]
name: Healing Your Heart, Your Soul, & Your Family Line with Rahim Bronner

description:
Open to everyone.  New and prospective members are especially invited to this New Member Hike at Forest of Nisene Marks State Parknear Aptos. Get to know the Peninsula Regional Group, Loma Prieta Chapter and Sierra Club. There is an entrance fee of $10. No pets allowed.


HIKE DETAILS: 8 miles round-trip, about 1,000' elevation gain, 2B. Moderate hike at an easy pace, most of the climbing is at the start.

START TIME: Meet 10:00 AM at the George Picnic Area.

WHAT TO BRING: Plenty of water, snacks, lunch. A hat, sunglasses, hiking poles and a camera may be useful. Wear hiking boots.


CAR POOL LOCATIONS:

9:00 AM at Los Gatos Municipal Parking Lot (Highway 9 between University Ave & Santa Cruz Ave, behind Chase bank). If you end up on Santa Cruz Ave , Chase bank, Starbucks or Safeway, look out for driveways leading to the back of those place, which connect to the Municipal Parking lot.

No host 8:45AM at the Home Depot Parking lot in Morgan Hill off of Dunne, for South County carpool.

Like us on Facebook.

Mapping Party Details.

 

 

Climb the mountains and get their good tidings.

- John Muir

venue.name: Forest of Nisene Marks State park - George's Picnic Area

how_to_find_us: 8:45, 9:00 AM at the car pool locations; or 10:00 AM at the George’s Picnic Area, I'll be holding a clipboard.

name: Stitch 'N It time

description:
6th Annual SF Street Food Festival!

I went last year and had a blast! If you'd like to meetup with me and my crew, we plan to meet at Philz Coffee (24th & Folsom) at 11am. Leave your cell number in your RSVP comments if you'll be joining us. Guests are welcome!

Like them on Facebook, follow them on Twitter, and Instagram. And naturally, there's an iPhone app!

Get a sneak peek of the day’s tasty treats. With trucks from Bicycle Bahn Mi, Radio Africa & Kitchen, Nojo, Curry Up Now and many more, this event is not to be missed!!


WHERE IS THE FESTIVAL?

The Festival will take place in the Mission District from 11 a.m until 7p.m on Folsom St. from 20th to 26th, 21st and 25th from Treat St. to Shotwell St., as well as the Cesar Chavez Elementary School parking lot, Parque de los Ninos Unidos and Jose Coronada Playground.

LOCATION/DIRECTIONS

</a>

<a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=2948+folsom+san+francisco&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=19.588751,56.513672&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=2948+Folsom+St,+San+Francisco,+California+94110&ll=37.755821,-122.413874&spn=0.0095,0.027595&z=15&iwloc=A">

</a>

<a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=2948+folsom+san+francisco&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=19.588751,56.513672&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=2948+Folsom+St,+San+Francisco,+California+94110&ll=37.755821,-122.413874&spn=0.0095,0.027595&z=15&iwloc=A">

</a>

<a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=2948+folsom+san+francisco&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=19.588751,56.513672&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=2948+Folsom+St,+San+Francisco,+California+94110&ll=37.755821,-122.413874&spn=0.0095,0.027595&z=15&iwloc=A">

 

HOW DO I GET THERE?

Parking will be impossible so I strongly suggest taking public transportation. Skydiving, paddleboat, lawn chair with a million balloons…but these methods are probably safer:

• BART: 24th St Bart Station

• MUNI: 12, 14, 14L, 27, 48, 67

• BIKE: SF Bike Coalition will provide monitored bike parking located on 22nd St. between Folsom & Treat Streets.

 

Hot Tips

• Arrive early to beat the long lines.

• Bring cash (atms are avail but they charge fees).

• Bring a hat & wear sunscreen.

• Bring a water bottle/naglene and fill up at the water bar stations. Some foodtrucks will even serve drinks in your adult sippy cup. You gotta ask nicely. :)

• Bring your BIG appetite!
how_to_find_us: Late or lost? Call/text me at 510-684-7665
name: Street Food Festival in the Mission (SF)

description:

The San Francisco English Bulldog Meetup is held at Crissy Field.
Bring your bully to start the weekend off right and meet some great people at the beach.

When you arrive at the beach, we'll be towards the left near the tidal marsh that flows into the ocean. It's technically called the the East Beach parking area. NOTE: It's not the North Parking area.

Can't wait to see you at the meetup.

Cheers!
Lehua, Ryan, Poi Boy, and Bella
name: The San Francisco English Bulldog Monthly Meetup

description:
To quote a buddy who took this hike,

"Lush hills, pristine beach cove, and great views...this hike had it all".     


The Plan:


This will a 9 mile hike rated moderate to strenuous (depending on your condition).  Parts of this hike are flat and easy, while others are more challenging. 


We'll hike from Tennessee Valley out to Tennessee Cove, where we'll have a vino/snack break, then follow the Coastal Trail to to Muir Beach, where we'll have lunch and enjoy chilling on the beach. 

Optional:  go out for a meal/drink after the hike.

 I'm rating this one moderate, though parts may be considered strenuous (depending on your condition).

<a>Directions</a>:

From US 101 in Marin County, take the CA 1/Shoreline Highway exit.

After about 0.5 mile, turn left onto Tennessee Valley Road, and go about 1.5 miles to the parking lot at the end of the road.  The trailhead is at the end of this parking lot.

GPS  37.860758,-122.536003

What To Bring:

Vino! (and cups)

Good Hiking Boots/shoes

Layered clothing, hat, sunscreen

description:
Startup Finance: Valuation

About: Learn how to value a startup.

Finance is a powerful global force and valuation lies at its core. Valuation makes or breaks a company. It is critical to understand valuation as an investor, entrepreneur, consultant and employee.

There are many circumstances in which valuation is critical:

A. You are looking to raise funding for your company.

B. You are looking to invest in a startup.

C. You are looking to work for a startup and your success is tied to the startup’s success.

D. You are about to get paid in equity.

E. You are interested in selling your business.

This class is focused on startup valuation with entrepreneurial and non-public valuation needs in mind. We cover concepts such as pre-money, post money valuation and valuation equations used for private companies. We will be looking at Startup Valuation from the financial perspective. You can expect to walk away with a few equations and ideas on how to make financial projections.

This class is ideal for entrepreneurs, investors and anyone interested in working for or with a private company. Attendees to this seminar will walk away with a better understanding of the valuation process.  Attendees can expect to walk through a financial example of valuation.

Testimonials:

“This is one of the best finance classes I have ever taken.”

- Andrew

“I took the “Startup Finance Valuation” class; excellent job. This class is a must for all entrepreneurs. MBA classes do not teach how to value a startup, this class does.”

- Danny

“After taking this class I have a clear perspective on valuation. I recommend this class to all entrepreneurs. Thank you for a very informative class.”

- Bonnie

“I have been in banking for over 20 years and this class taught me valuable concepts not covered by all the classes I have taken throughout my career.”

- Yaakov

description:
Interested in taking Jewelry courses here at Handmade, but bothered by the prerequisite of "Jewelry 1 required"? Well, here is BOTH Jewelry 1 and Jewelry 2 in one LONG, almost 4 hour, combined course.  In this double course, we'll explore everything that you would normally learn in Jewelry 1 and 2 in one afternoon session.  Our course will cover:

-Wire Temper and Gauge - what is structure wire, what is work hardening and how to make these work for you

-Proper and Safe use of pliers and tools

-How to make a simple loop

-How to make a wrapped loop

-How to make jump rings

-How to make coils

-How to make spirals open and closed, vertical and horizontal

-How to connect beads and wire

-How to make findings (hooks, eyes, rings)

-How to wrap a leather cord

-How to make head pins--simple, hearts, circles, stars

-How to use a coiling tool

-How to texture and hammer wires for durability and aesthetics

Students should bring:

-1 Round nose plier (jewelry grade pliers for all projects, please, not hardware pliers)

-1 Chain nose plier

-1 Flat nose plier

-1 Flush cutting plier

-1 spool of 20 gauge craft wire

-1 beading mat (not a beading board with grooves...just the mat)

- Steel Bench Block (optional, but highly recommended)

- Low Domed Planishing Hammer (optional, but highly recommended)

Purchase beads (4-8 mm in size--not seed beads, but a large string of beads) that you'd like for a necklace, and also other beads for your necklace.  We will make a COMPLETE necklace in this class.  (The instructor will have additional beads for the class as well as design assistance)

1 Bottle of Water

Snacks if you want them...turning wire is hard work!

 

Please keep your RSVP current at all times.  This is a very popular class, and we try as much as possible to ensure that our members have the opportunity to take these important prerequisites.  Because this is a "double" class, payment will be required by members prior to RSVP.  The higher cost covers the Paypal transaction charges.
name: NEW - Combined Course  Jewelry 1 and Jewelry 2

description:
We are declaring WAR! And not the thumb kind either. Our fellow gamers at the Petaluma-based Meetup The Geekery have challenged our established behavior of hating humankind by inviting us to have fun with them. The gall! How very dare them! We'll show them just how much we hate humankind by banding together and playing games and stuff.

A neutral field has been chosen for this (let's face it) unequivicable defeat, just north of where the misanthropes normally meet and just south of where the geekery meets. Hopefully that will accommodate the most people. We already have some ideas for some fun (Nerf vs. Zombies), but feel free to add some comments below if you are looking for anything specific. And, if you're one of the few people (read: traitors) that are part of both Meetups, you don't need to RSVP to both, but it certainly can't hurt.

Misanthropes vs. geeks. North vs. South. Pink vs. orange. Brains vs. brawn. Alien vs. Predator. The State of Tennessee vs. John Thomas Scopes. Who will win? And, more importantly (if moms everywhere can be trusted), who will have fun? You decide!

More about the park can be found here:


http://www.ebparks.org/parks/miller_knox

Our meeting place will be near Lagoon View (for now), located at #2 on this map:

http://www.ebparks.org/Assets/_Nav_Categories/Parks/Maps/Miller+Knox+map.pdf

More about the enemy can be found here:

http://www.meetup.com/geekery

More about squirrels can be found here:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squirrel

Disclaimer: This is an outdoors event. Sunlight may touch your skin without proper precautions. While I take every precaution against such a thing, I am not responsible if you turn to dust.

Note: Call Ryan at (510) 859-4RYE. Newcomers always welcome!

description:
By Katherine Boo
Rated 3.98 on Goodreads
262 pages


From Pulitzer Prize-winner Katherine Boo, a landmark work of narrative nonfiction that tells the dramatic and sometimes heartbreaking story of families striving toward a better life in one of the twenty-first century’s great, unequal cities.

In this brilliantly written, fast-paced book, based on three years of uncompromising reporting, a bewildering age of global change and inequality is made human.

Annawadi is a makeshift settlement in the shadow of luxury hotels near the Mumbai airport, and as India starts to prosper, Annawadians are electric with hope. Abdul, a reflective and enterprising Muslim teenager, sees “a fortune beyond counting“ in the recyclable garbage that richer people throw away. Asha, a woman of formidable wit and deep scars from a childhood in rural poverty, has identified an alternate route to the middle class: political corruption. With a little luck, her sensitive, beautiful daughter — Annawadi's "most-everything girl" — will soon become its first female college graduate. And even the poorest Annawadians, like Kalu, a fifteen-year-old scrap-metal thief, believe themselves inching closer to the good lives and good times they call “the full enjoy.”

But then Abdul the garbage sorter is falsely accused in a shocking tragedy; terror and a global recession rock the city; and suppressed tensions over religion, caste, sex, power and economic envy turn brutal. As the tenderest individual hopes intersect with the greatest global truths, the true contours of a competitive age are revealed. And so, too, are the imaginations and courage of the people of Annawadi.

With intelligence, humor, and deep insight into what connects human beings to one another in an era of tumultuous change, Behind the Beautiful Forevers carries the reader headlong into one of the twenty-first century’s hidden worlds, and into the lives of people impossible to forget.
name: Behind the Beautiful Forevers: Life, Death, and Hope in a Mumbai Undercity

description:
The torches are lit, the theme is set... we're having a luau you'll never forget! 

We're going tropical on August 16, so break out the flip flops and leis and hula on by and come joins us for a "Lei'd Back" Hawaiian Luau Party!


Robert is kind enough to host this event at his house in Oakley where we can enjoy a day on the delta from his backyard! We will be BBQing shishkabobs so bring your favorite shishkabob meat to skew and BBQ, and a side dish to share (I will get a list going of hawaiian favorite side dishes to sign up for).

There will be a Tiki Bar with tropical drinks served, so bring a bottle of rum or other alcoholic beverage of your choice.

Music, games, water fun, hawaiian entertainment (more on that later), and a hula dancer are  just some of things you can expect, along with dancing the limbo and a hula hoop contest.

Dress code is Tacky Tourist (go ahead, show us your worst!). Put on your craziest Hawaiian shirts and a lei, bring a swimsuit, sunblock and shades!

Come join us for a hawaiian luau as we  play in the water, and hula on the Delta!


Mahalo.

P.S. Robert's real address will be emailed to those who RSVP.

History of the Luau


A luau, a feast to mark an important celebratory occasion, such as a coming of age or visitors, is culturally rooted, festive and all about food, fun and family. Luaus have been part of Hawaiian culture since long before Westerners arrived to the islands. Up until about 150 years ago, Polynesians called their big celebratory feasts ‘aha ‘aina. These events were usually somewhat formal, with more ceremony and not such a party atmosphere. 

The modern term Luau may have originated from the great coed feasts of the Hawaiian King Kamehameha II. In traditional Hawaii, men and women were not allowed to eat together and all women were forbidden to eat certain kinds of foods in Hawaii. King Kamehameha II abolished these laws and many other religious laws in the year 1819 and validated this change by having a symbolic feast with women invited. 

At this feast one of the main dishes involved the wrapping of chicken in the young leaves of the Taro plant and baking it in coconut milk. This dish was called 'Luau' and as a result of its being one of the main courses of these feasts the feasts themselves came to be called 'Luaus.' Traditional Luaus are eaten on the ground, with food placed on Ti Leaves that cover a type of woven mat called the 'Lauhala' mats. 

the lei

Guests at Luaus receive Leis as they arrive. The Lei  is a necklace or headdress of woven flowers or shells and is given as a display of affection. A lei should be a welcomed celebration of one person's affection to another. Therefore, always accept a lei, never refuse. 

The proper way to wear a lei is gently draped over the shoulders, hanging down both in front and in back. It is considered rude to remove a lei from your neck in the presence of the person who gave it to you, so if you must, be discreet. 

Also when dressing up for the Luau women can place a flower behind their right or left ear. Placing a flower over the left ear indicates that one is taken or in a relationship and placing a flower over the right ear indicates that one is available.

pu: the hawaiian conch shell

Pu, a Hawaiian conch shell , is a large seashell that is blow into like a trumpet and often played for ceremonies. Made of two kinds of large shells, Triton or Cassis cornuta, it is capable of emitting a loud sound carrying as far as two miles. The volume depends on the style of blowing rather than breath volume capacity.

In ancient times, the Pu was sometimes used to accompany chants, and most often used to announce the beginning of a ceremony and also to communicate the arrival of incoming ships.

Today the Pu is used to announce the opening of the Hawaii State Legislature, presentation of the royal court at hula festivals and for traditional ceremonies. The Pu is also a popular commencement tool at weddings and luaus, and also has been used to honor royalty and famous people.

fire dancing

Fire dancing, now very popular on the Hawaiian Islands, is a tradition that came from traditional Somoan knife dancing. The ailao, a fierce traditional dance that involves the twirling of the nifo oti (war knife), was a pre-war ritual in Samoa used to psyche up warriors. Letuli Olo Misilagi was the first man to add fire to the traditional Samoan ailao, or knife dance.

The Samoan fire knife dance

 is more than a popular spectacle that adds sizzle to a Hawaiian luau. It’s a tradition that has been passed from generation to generation, with each adding a new layer of style, boldness and skill.

Today, of course, the Samoan fire knife dance is a show-stopping staple in Polynesian revues or luaus. There are fire knife dance competitions held throughout the Pacific, including the annual World Fire Knife Dance Competition at the Polynesian Cultural Center (PCC) on Oahu.

Says event founder Pulefano Galeai, "This unique event combines great athletic skill, unflinching bravery and ever-present danger to bring out the best in these competitors. It’s exciting to see the culture of Samoa take center stage with participation from people around the world." 

grass skirts

The most famous symbol of the Hawaiian hula is the grass skirt . The grass skirt was introduced to Hawaii in the early 1800s by laborers who arrived in Hawaii from the Gilbert Islands. Traditionally the Hawaiians used Ti leaves; the Ti leaf is wider than the thinner strands of grass that are used today.
name: LEI'D BACK HAWAIIAN LUAU PARTY

description:
<strong style="font-size : medium">About the class
Learn to make mobile applications! It is simpler than you think.
We will review the technologies being used in making applications and give you enough guidance for you to come up with your own strategy.

This is a beginner level class and can be of assistance to you if you don’t have any background in programming and are interested in building an app. It is also very helpful to those interested in or are currently working with programmers.

We hope that you take time to come to this class and walk away with a better understanding of Mobile Application Development.

name: Deadfest Day 2

description:
Once again we will get together, for more Fun, Food, and Frivolity with fellow film fans! 

Yes, it's time for our:

Summer Movie Meetup Party!!

We'll gather at a private club house, in Los Altos on Saturday, August 16. The exact address, and a map, will be emailed to everyone who RSVPs "yes," a week prior to the event.  There'll be lots of food and drink to share.  See the Pot-Luck list below.  Enjoy the socializing and conversation with other witty sophisticates.  Challenge yourself and others with trivia; two, new games and the return of the diabolical, "Connect the Clues" game!!! Vie for "valuable" prizes. RSVPs, open Sat., July 19!  

Important: We are inviting members from both SF Bay Area Classic Films and Palo Alto Independent Films to attend, and we need to limit the number to a *total* of thirty-five (35) people. So, the only way to ensure your spot, is to RSVP early!!! 

Admission price (payable when you RSVP) is just $10.00, per person (you don't need a PayPal account to pay; a credit or debit card will work just fine). We won't be taking payments at the door, so please pay when you sign up! To help us prepare, we will be closing RSVPs a week prior to the event, on Saturday, August 9, so don't procrastinate, and risk missing out! 

The Pot-Luck

We will provide drinks and condiments (plus all cups, plates, napkins, utensils, ice, etc.), but the food we'll do potluck style! Bring a dish from one of the categories below, sufficient to share with three (3) other people, and note the category in your RSVP comment, so we can balance the menu, if needed. Here are the categories:

• Appetizers/Snacks

• Salad

• Entreé (meat or vegetarian; please indicate)

• Vegetables/Side dish

• Dessert

Please bring any serving utensils you may require. (Gas grills, a full range/oven, and fridge/freezer will be available, if needed. Please provide your own equipment (pot holders, spatulas, roasting pans, etc.))

So, that's it! As always we'll have lots of food and fun with some of the most enthusiastic film fans in the Bay Area! What's not to like? Don't miss out: RSVP starting July 19th!!! 

We'll See You on Saturday, August 16!!!

P.S.: As a special treat, hang out after the party (but help clean up first -- the sooner we're done, the quicker the fun) and enjoy a light, summer movie. Stay tuned for details!
name: Summer Movie Meetup Party!: Great fun for movie buffs!

description:
Synopsis:  The classic tale of King Arthur and and his Knights of the Round Table...as told by Monty Python.  Really, need I say more?

Spamalot is an outrageously goofy musical with an upbeat score and clever lyrics, lovingly ripped off from the classic cult comedy Monty Python and the Holy Grail.  This will be the second time I will have seen it; it's that good.


Audiences everywhere are eating up Spamalot which tells the story of King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table on their quest for the Holy Grail in the irreverent signature style of Monty Python. Flying cows, killer rabbits, taunting Frenchmen and show-stopping musical numbers add up to one of the greatest and funniest Broadway musicals of the modern age!


The 2005 Broadway production won three Tony Awards, including Best Musical, and received 14 Tony Award nominations.

We'll meet for Happy Hour and appetizers near the City Lights Theater.


Happy Hour: 6:30  located TBD

Play Begins: 8:00

Buy tickets at http: www.cltc.org

The Light Rail stops just a few blocks away in case you don't want to pay for parking.
name: PLAY: Monty Python's Spamalot!  + Happy Hour

TIME AND <a>LOCATION</a> ARE TENTATIVE AND WILL BE UPDATED WHEN THE <a>INFORMATION</a> BECOMES AVAILABLE.

Storyline

In the span of a single day, the town of Silverton is ravaged by an unprecedented onslaught of tornadoes. The entire town is at the mercy of the erratic and deadly cyclones, even as storm trackers predict the worst is yet to come. Most people seek shelter, while others run towards the vortex, testing how far a storm chaser will go for that once-in-a-lifetime shot.

Told through the eyes and lenses of professional storm chasers, thrill-seeking amateurs, and courageous townspeople, Into the Storm throws you directly into the eye of the storm to experience <a>Mother Nature</a> at her most extreme.

PG 13 - for sequences of intense destruction and peril, and language including some sexual references.

http://www.movieinsider.com/m10404/into-the-storm/videos/
name: Into the Storm ~ A Movie That Will Keep You on the Edge of Your Seat!

description:
Race Thru the Redwoods is run entirely in Henry Cowell Redwoods State Park in Felton, California. The race starts near the main picnic area and runs one mile on paved roads followed by scenic trails next to meadows and the San Lorenzo River. The moderate to challenging course then rises approximately 300 feet in elevation between mile 2.5 and mile 3.5. Return is on downhill paved road and dirt trails with the finish near the starting line. Water/aid stations, mile markers.

All participants will receive a t–shirt and a free Pancake Breakfast at the Felton Volunteer Fire Department located at Kirby off Hwy 9 in downtown Felton. Electronic timing results immediately after race are provided by the Santa Cruz Track Club. During the awards ceremony prizes will be drawn for those present!

Proceeds from the race go to the Felton Business Association, San Lorenzo Valley High’s cross country program, local charities and the Felton California State Parks.
1-mile trail fun for ages 2-12

Make this a family day! For kids we have a one mile trail fun run for ages 2 - 12. Medals go to top 3 boys and girls in each age bracket: 2-6, 7-8, 9-10, 11-12
Start times
8:10 am – Kids Mile
8:30 am – 10K

Directions

Take Hwy 17, exit at Mt. Herman Rd., Scotts Valley, go west 3.5 miles to Graham Hill Rd., then right ¼ mile to the light at Hwy 9 and turn left on Hwy 9. Travel .7 mile and enter Henry Cowell State Park. The start is at the main picnic area just to the right after passing the kiosk.

The race is in the Henry Cowell State Park picnic area. You can not drive to the race start via the Graham Hill Rd campground entrance. Parking

There will not be a park entrance fee charged for Race Thru The Redwoods participants. Parking in the main lot is only available to race participants who show proof of park entrance payment ($10 or Annual Park Pass).

Parking is limited. Carpool if possible or meet friends outside the park and drive in one vehicle. There is additional parking available at Roaring Camp off of Graham Hill Rd. until 11:00 am without charge. Overflow parking will be at the Pro Build parking lot. Both Roaring Camp and San Lorenzo parking are .7 mile form the start.
name: Race Through the Redwoods!

description:
The Sunday Hikers are Meeting over at Hap Magee Ranch in Danville this week . 8 : 30 am Start time for this 5 mile ,Moderate rated - Half Urban (neighborhoods of Alamo ) and Half Wide Fire Trails that include the Las Trampas Park hillside on the Prestigious West Side Alamo .

           THIS HIKE IS RATED MODERATE :  Depending on the groups pace for this hike , it is not especially difficult , but could be considered somewhat challenging if a fast pace is kept up . The group as a whole sets the speed of the hike -we do wait for the group to catch up at trail intersections - if all attendees want to walk fast then we walk the speed of the group as a whole group effort - It is not our intention to walk / hike the pace of the slowest hiker. PLEASE understand your physical hiking ability and hike within your means !

        Come see a awesome route that includes the chance to see some great views from the top of Las trampas and several interesting homes along the quiet lanes in a high end neighborhood , great for anyone who enjoys Architecture and Landscape details . This is the one hike everyone will be talking about .

      Dogs are welcome on this hike , must be leashed up when on the city streets and free to travel the trails when on the fire roads. Can your dog walk the full 5 mile loop route  - you have to decide .

      Reminder to all hikers ,bring ample drinking water for the 2 1/2 hour event and wear sturdy footwear designed for hiking on loose dirt surfaces !
how_to_find_us: Look for Meet up members toward the back parking lot close to the dog park, were gathering next to the Sand Vollyball Court, plan on arriving a little early for a quick meet and greet and we will get on to the hike by 8:30 am .
name: Nieghborhood Hike in the hills above Alamo - 5 mile Loop - Rated Moderate

group.name: Sleep Late & Take a Hike at 1 pm

description:
ABOUT THE HIKE

This will be 7-3/4 mile moderate hike, from sea level to 739' elevation, starting at the Crissy Field Warming Hut and going across the Golden Gate Bridge to the Marin Headlands and the Golden Gate National Recreation Area to Kirby Cove.

On a clear & warm day, there will be beautiful photo opportunities. 

THINGS TO BRING (suggested)

• Water, Snacks, Lunch

• Hydration

• Sunscreen

• Layered clothing

WHERE TO MEET 

Warming Hut Bookstore & Cafe

There is bathroom at the parking lot outside the Warming Hut, where we will meet @9;30. The warming hut sells coffee, hot chocolate, tea, pastries, and some snacks but not meals. Another option if you want to buy your food, is to get it at Safeway in the Marina that is 1/2 mile away. You'll get alot more choices and variety there.

Depending on our pace of our group, we can probably get to the beach in 1.5-2.0 hours. We will eat when we reach Kirby Cove, a very beautiful cove with awesome views of the GGB & Bay, where you'll also have plenty of opportunity to snap pics. After our lunch, we will head back. There will be another vista point stop for those who are interested in photography. There will be bathrooms in 3 spots during the walk. 

• Extreme high temperature or extreme fog/cold &  will call for a re-schedule of the hike.


Safety Disclaimer: The organizers of this meet-up are unpaid volunteers and not expert hiking guides. All participants agree to assume 100% responsibility for their own safety, conduct, and well-being and recognize that possible hazards exist while participating in outdoor (or any other) activities, and agree to participate solely at their own risk. If you RSVP “Yes” and/or attend any of our events, it shall be conclusively presumed that you understand and agree to this policy.
how_to_find_us: Meet outside Warming Hut Bookstore & Cafe
name: Scenic Crissy Fields -GGB-Marin Headlands

description: I love doing this run and ending up at the Ft. Mason Farmer's Market then getting a fresh crepe or rice and chili bowl from Greens. For 10 miles I run along the Marina and the Bay to Crissy Field, then take the Park Trail through the Presidio and along the Presidio golf club to the Bay Trail to the GG Bridge, then back along Crissy Field and the Marina to Ft. Mason. There's about 400 feet of elevation on this run, and mostly non-paved surfaces. My pace is average, around 12-13 minutes per mile. Bring water, especially if it's sunny!

description:
Join us for another day of local wine tasting...this time in the South Bay hills!  We'll start out at Spread, where you can pick up a picnic lunch or other yummies to accompany the wine.  We're going to visit four local tasting rooms, so you will need some sustenance along the way!  Feel free to pack your own lunch instead if you like.  Just know that we cannot live by wine crackers alone!

We will spend a leisurely day visiting Ruthe Robert Wine Collective, Savannah Chanelle Vineyard, Black Ridge Vineyards, and Testarossa Winery.  There are great views, a nice walking path, and live piano on the journey.  So dress comfy, and be prepared to unwind!

Wine is (of course) available at each stop for $10-20 per flight, which is generally waived/refunded with bottle purchase.  You are welcome to share a flight, or skip something altogether as you wish.  No pressure, and please be sure to drink responsibly.

We will end our day back in downtown Campbell.  There, we will find a place for dinner or go our separate ways.  As you wish.  This is a day to enjoy.  :)

Note: I will be driving, but we will need additional drivers if more than one other person signs up!  Please post a comment if you have a ride or need a ride.
name: Wine Tasting...because no good story ever starts with salad!

description:
This workshop is an introduction to Backbone.js, a popular front-end javascript library for creating dynamic, interactive web interfaces. It will be co-taught by Pamela Fox and Brenda Jin, and will include lunch.


We'll cover Backbone.JS Models, Views, Events, and CRUD, with hands-on exercises throughout. As a prerequisite, you should feel comfortable with JavaScript/jQuery and hopefully have attended our JS MVC/OO workshops.

If you're interested in helping out as a teaching assistant, please let us know.


Many thanks to our sponsor HackReactor for the wonderful space.


If you'd like to attend but cannot afford the cost, please request a GDI scholarship.

Please note that we cannot issue refunds, since there's an overhead to issuing refunds via Meetup.com and we already offer the workshops at such a low-cost. We put proceeds into the chapter fund, which we use as our scholarship fund.
name: JS 302: Intro to Backbone

name: Monthly Meet Up

description:
If a tree falls in the forest and no one is around to hear it, does it make a sound?

In the conclusion to the lecture and lab series on the science of the senses, the question of reality will be addressed in a self-exploratory session led by Matt Harbowy, scientist, hacker, and advocatus diaboli.  The question of "what is real?" will be investigated, and the viewpoints of the philosophers of science will be discussed. You will learn how to spot when a scientist is lying to you. The truths and lies discussed in the prior five sessions will be reviewed, and participants in prior sessions will be invited to conduct encore sessions of their favorite experiments. The process of peer review will be discussed, and you will learn how to peer review the work of other scientists. Most of all, we will have fun exploring our sixth sense.

You are encouraged to bring a smartphone or tablet computer to the presentation so that you can collect data in our online lab notebook and share your results with the whole class- and will be provided online tools to continue the discovery at home. Technology is not needed to enjoy the class- bring your curiosity. 

This class is planned for June 21st, 2013 and is part 6 of a 6 part lecture and lab on the senses.
name: The Science of Perception

description:
Bring your projects - patterns you're about to make, WIPs (works in progress), or completed garments  (successes and failures) - and let's discuss fabric choices, including why you chose a particular fabric and why it worked (or not), what fabrics you're considering for an upcoming project, mixing prints, working with directional fabrics, and more!

What fabric do you choose for a garment? Do you follow a pattern's recommended fabrics or do you ignore the suggestions? Is there a "wrong" fabric or not? What "wrong" fabrics have you used in a garment? 

This month's pattern giveaway is Thread Theory's oh-so-cool Goldstream Peacoat! Thread Theory is a Canadian menswear sewing pattern company. You can buy their paper patterns via their website or as PDF downloads. 

As always, Bay Area Sewists receive a 20% discount at Stonemountain & Daughter Fabrics on meetup days! And this time, all you need to do is go downstairs to shop. :)

Date: Sunday, August 17
1:30pm to 1:45 pm - Introductions and announcements
1:45 pm to 3:25 pm - Show & Tell and discussion of fabric
3:30 pm - Pattern drawing and group photo!

Location: Stonemountain & Daughter Fabrics, 2518 Shattuck Ave., upstairs classroom space. Street parking is available (watch the meters!). The store is within walking distance from the Downtown Berkeley BART stop.

NOTE: They only have 15 chairs so the RSVPs are limited to 15. BUT if you can bring your own chair, we can likely fit 5 more people. I'll wait to see how many people are on the wait list and whether they can bring their own chair before I increase the RSVPs.
name: Fabric Choices, Show & Tell and Pattern Giveaway!

You can join the Meetup at all of or any point of the 3-part day plan. As it gets closer, I will post some car-pool info in the comment section.

description:
In memoriam this month of the centenary of World War One, we bring you Maugham's scathing indictment of its results on British Society. Set in 1931 at the country estate of Leonard Ardsley a well-off solicitor and patriarch, the interactions of his four children with family friends, spouses, and lovers reveal the extent of the war's mental and physical destruction, and the need for change. Loaded with emotive scenes and tidbits of cultural history, this reading will give us a feast for discussion.

For Services Rendered is a play in three acts - set in a house in a small country town near Kent. 

This is one of Maugham's most famous plays. 

There are twelve characters, six women and six men.

Characters

Leonard Ardsley 

 Charlotte Ardsley, his wife 

 Sydney, his son 

 Eva, his unmarried daughter 

 Lois, his unmarried daughter 

 Ethel Bartlett, his married daughter 

 Howard Bartlett, her husband 

 Collie Stratton, Commander, RN 

 Wilfred Cedar 

 Gwen, his wife 

 Dr Prentice, Mrs Ardsley's brother 

 Gertrude, the Ardsley's parlourmaid

The action takes place in the Ardsley's house at Rambleston, a small country town in Kent, near the cathedral city of Stanbury.
name: FOR SERVICES RENDERED, by Somerset Maugham--FIRST READING

description:
LOCATION: Alexis's house near Geary and 22nd Ave in San Francisco. Exact address will be emailed to RSVPed attendees the day before the meetup.

I've been doing a lot of bead crochet ropes lately because it's an easy and *very* portable project to do when you have a bit of free time.  I'm not an expert by any means, but I figured I could show people how to do it if they're interested.

The youtube video included here and this tutorial really helped me figure it out, so take a look.  You can use whatever size/shape beads you want, but for learning I would recommend size 6 or 8 beads, size 10 thread, and a size 7 crochet hook.  

The very first step of crocheting a rope of beads is to string ALL OF THE BEADS.  So if you want to get a head start, you could string all your beads before you arrive.  Otherwise, you could just string a bit when you arrive and then use that to make a sample.  Here is a chart that tells you how much to string (pdf) for a 6-around rope for a few different sizes of beads (but start with big beads, I promise you'll be MUCH happier.)  

I recommend starting with a spiral of colors like you'll see in the video.  I really, really, really recommend it.  :-)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oXpXqde-PKY

If you're not into this, feel free to bring whatever you're working on and hang out with us. There is no charge for meetups, though we love it when people bring snacks. Beginners are welcome!
name: Bead Crochet

description:
Are you still hungry? Say: CHEESE PLEASE!

The Cheeseballs just added a new concert to their event calendar in Crockett on August 17. If you were unable to see them at Barone's on July 10, will here's your chance to recover a lost opportunity-and it's free!  They will be performing at the community center in Crockett. If you have never seen them then let me assure you this is worth the drive on a quiet Sunday afternoon. This is the day after the Luau and what better way to end the weekend then to soak in some sunshine while snackin on some Cheeseball's.   

The Cheeseballs. The name says it all: groovy, funky, danceable FUN! Just ask the tens of thousands of fans who have already experienced them. They will tell you stories of standing on the bar singing "I Will Survive" at the top of their lungs or dancing so hard to "We Are Family" that getting out of bed the next day was quite an event.

That's what The Cheeseballs do; they make you "Shake Your Booty" like it hasn't been shaken in years. The band members pride themselves on serving up a helping of non-stop 70's disco dance hits and 80's and 90' s pop classics with an uncanny knack of performing songs that you will be surprised to discover you knew all the words to, such as "YMCA," "Stayin’ Alive," "Dancing Queen," "Le Freak," "Disco Inferno," and many more (see song list). The result is always an audience dancing along and singing along.

Over the last decade The Cheeseballs have performed everywhere from Las Vegas to Hawaii, at large public events, private parties and capacity-filled dance clubs. They have rung in the New Year at venues ranging from the Atrium of San Francisco's landmark Hyatt Embarcadero Hotel to historic Union Station in Kansas City, MO. The Cheeseballs memorably sung their own groovy acappela rendition of "The Star Spangled Banner" to 50,000 San Francisco Giants fans at SBC Park. Whether playing to a crowd of 100 or 10,000, they'll make sure everyone ends up on the dance floor. The Cheeseballs headline and sell out at all of the Bay Area's premier venues, including Bimbo's 365 Club, The Great American Music Hall, and Slim's.

The band is comprised of 8 performers dressed in dazzling retro disco outfits and presents a parade of personalities who alternate lead vocals with plenty of exuberantly choreographed dance moves. You won't be disappointed. Just pick up the phone and say... "Cheese, Please!"
name: FREE CONCERT WITH THE CHEESEBALLS
