description:
Join us for free at one of our highly-innovative business-networking meetings - in your city! View our full calendar of business-networking meetings. We welcome anyone to attend a GoRampUp! meeting, once, for free as our guest, so you can learn what the innovative GoRampUp! business-networking experience is all about. Note, we are not able to give you a free meeting at more than one of our many locations.

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting athttp://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance. Without this ticket you will, unfortunately, be declined access to our innovative and exclusive business-networking meeting. WITH a GoRampUp! Golden Ticket, you will be welcomed with open arms!

It can be too difficult to attract new clients. We help you fix that! We're a business-impact community. We're informal and fun, yet, by design, we're extremely effective!

We help people who work for a living to get a much greater payoff from working. We do this in three specific ways under our three CoreSuccess Platforms: 1) We help you move toward mastery with business-networking, 2) We help you move toward mastery with business performance, and, 3) We help you move toward mastery with personal development.

How do we deliver on this promise to our community members? Each month we conduct dozens of business-networking meetings in more than a dozen cities in the SF Bay Area. A member may attend all of our "OpenConnect" business-networking meetings. And our members are welcome and encouraged to attend any and all of these meetings and locations.

Each month we introduce and emphasize a learning and development subject under each of our three CoreSuccess Platforms. For each of the three learning and development subjects that we introduce and emphasize each month, we give you four different ways to learn it: We produce written learning guides, video learning guides, audio learning guide, and we cover the subjects as 15-to-20-minute mini-workshops inside of our 60-minute business-networking meetings. There's no registration or initiation fee to join. Membership in GoRampUp! is month to month. You enroll when you like, even mid-month, and you depart when you like.

Be sure to see our website to learn about our generous enrollment incentives

Also, be sure to learn about our 100-Satisfaction Money-Back Guarantee

Would you care to come to this meeting, at no cost, to see if there’s business-value for you?

• Free-Meeting Guest-RSVP and Golden Ticket Request

• View complete meeting details

One last thing: You REALLY should check out actual testimonial videos by our members: See them here

This page was created to produce awareness of our event. However, OUR PAGES ON THIS SITE CAN BECOME OUTDATED. The authoritative source for our meeting dates/times is http://www.GoRampUp.com/calendar. Be sure to check it prior to traveling to a meeting.

description:
We are excited to announce we are helping promote Dan Ariely & Irrational Labs’ StartupOnomics. This behavioral economics summit is 2.5 days and 2 nights of engaging, interactive lectures and workshop sessions. At the end of the weekend, teams will walk away knowing how to move the needle on their biggest customer problems and with tangible ideas to immediately test and implement.  

StartupOnomics will accept only 25 teams, with a requirement to bring 2 people per team accepted. This is intended to create an immersive and intimate discussion environment with the speakers and mentors.

Just for the SF Fintech Meetup


We have got an extended deadline to apply only for our group from July 10th to July 13th. You can use this link to apply up until Sunday July 13th

If you are in Fin-tech and solving something related to financial inclusion, they will likely be able to subsidize the fee for your company.


Details of Event 

The 4th annual StartupOnomics will cover 

1) consumer financial decision making and 

2) healthy life choices. 

Speakers include three of the field's leading experts in the psychology of our users: Dan Ariely (Duke University), Mike Norton (Harvard Business School), and Hal Hershfield (NYU Stern School of Business) and top experts specifically in healthy living: Brain Wansink (Cornell) and Gregg Rap (Menu engineer)

Dan Ariely has authored three New York Times bestsellers and dozens of academic papers about the psychology of money. Brian Wansink is the leading researcher on behavior in relation to food choices. Mike looks at the intersection of time, money, and happiness and collected his insights in a new book "Happy Money: The Science of Smarter Spending." Hal looks at the role of emotions when we make tradeoffs between immediate pleasures (a slice of cake) and future costs (adding on extra pounds).

StartupOnomics brings together TOP academics that study human behavior with the companies looking to change the world. It's literally the only place to catch the people who write the studies on decision making - and in one room. To reiterate (we are purposely emphatic) it is highly unusual for professors of this caliber to take a weekend out of their schedule to come and chat with companies. This is like getting a permit to raft the grand canyon, front row at the Masters or consecutive blue bird days in Tahoe - the chance to hangout with these guys together is something super special.

Hot discussion topics include:
• Product adoption and growth
• Increasing addictive usage
• Building loyal customers that love you
• Payment strategies
• Building a team that loves what they do
• Measuring what matters
• Testing approaches and best practices

For more information visit http://www.startuponomics.com/ or email [masked]. Please reach out with any questions
name: StartupOnomics - THIRD PARTY EVENT

description:
Structure and Formation - From the Depths to the Shallows

We are pleased to announce a special Meetup event, a collaboration of Silicon Valley Nexus, Helix, a project of the San Francisco Exploratorium, and Nature Gallery.

Meet artist Cris Benton, geologist Naomi Marks, and science communicator Nicole Kurtz in this evening reception intended for adults that bridges Helix and the Silicon Valley Nexus at Nature Gallery.

At Nature Gallery Cris will show his kite aerial photography of the South Bay's salt evaporation ponds and discuss the sublime structures formed through the processes of ecological transformation.

At Helix, Naomi and Nicole discuss their work on Expedition 345 at Hess Deep Rift sampling the rapidly-formed rocks of the oceanic crust, offering an insight into the geological processes that form the structure of the Earth itself.

Start at either venue - Helix is located at 316 State St. Los Altos; Nature Gallery is located at 296 State Street, Los Altos.  We will switch places mid-evening so you can attend the other talk first.  During the evening you will enjoy drinks and hors d'oeuvres and meet others interested in exploring the intersection of art, science, and technology.

Helix by Exploratorium: www.helixlosaltos.org 

Silicon Valley Nexus Meetup: svnexus.com 

Nature Gallery: www.nature-gallery.com 

To learn more about Expedition 345: Hess Deep Plutonic Crust: http://joidesresolution.org/node/2738

To learn more about Cris Benton and Saltscapes: https://heydaybooks.com/book/saltscapes/

Cris Benton

Cris Benton is a retired professor of architecture and former department chair at the University of California, Berkeley. His kite aerial photography in the South Bay began during a sabbatical year spent as artist in residence at the Exploratorium in San Francisco, and it has continued under special use permits from the Don Edwards National Wildlife Refuge and the California Department of Fish and Wildlife. The resulting images documenting the salt ponds have been shown at the Cooper-Hewitt Museum, the Exploratorium, and the Coyote Point Museum, as well as conferences and art galleries.

Nicole Kurtz

Nicole is a science educator and was one of three education officers on Expedition 345. Nicole obtained her BFA in Medical Illustration from the Cleveland Institute of Art with a Minor in Fiber and Material Studies. Upon completion of her degree, she developed a thesis focused on the necessity of art in scientific discovery. Her techniques utilize skills of authoring, communicating, leading and designing scientific content and translating it for the lay audiences as well as the science community. On Expedition 345, she created visuals and animations as well as curricula to help science educators explain the significance of the voyage to diverse learning audiences.

Naomi Marks

Dr. Marks is a geologist who served as a metamorphic petrologist on Expedition 345: Hess Deep Plutonic Crust, undertaken by the Integrated Ocean Drilling Program in December 2012-February 2013. She is a researcher in the Chemical and Material Sciences Division of Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory.

The event will be held on Friday August 22, 2014 6:00PM to 8:00PM at two venues:

Nature Gallery, 296 State St., Los Altos, CA 94022

Helix, 316 State St. Los Altos, CA 94022.
name: From the Depths to the Shallows - A Collaboration with The Exploratorium

description:
Please join us on movie night for the warmly received, The Lunchbox.

Warm, affectionate, and sweet but not cloying, The Lunchbox is a clever crowd-pleaser from first-time director Ritesh Batra. A mistaken delivery in Mumbai's famously efficient lunchbox delivery system connects Saajan (Irfan Kahn), a lonely widower close to retirement, and Ila, an unhappy housewife. As they start exchanging notes through the daily lunchbox, gradually, their notes become little confessions about their loneliness, memories, regrets, fears, and even small joys.

India/France/Germany/USA 2013, 104 min. Color 2. 35: 1 English/Hindi Directed & Written by Ritesh Batra


 This event meets on the last Friday of the month, August 29th at 7:30 PM. The screening usually starts by 7:45. Snacks and drinks are provided.


 


For further questions email Ronald at ronaldsframe at hotmail dot com

description:
The finals for the West Coast Singer-Songwriter Contest will be held at Freight and Salvage. Tickets are $21.00 but if you enjoy seeing talented singers-songwriters work their magic, it's a bargain. This evening will include contestants from the entire West Coast. 

We'll buy tickets beforehand and meet at the door. Details are at http://www.thefreight.org/west-coast-songwriters-competition-finals-3

If you've never been to the Freight and Salvage, it's casual and very Berkeley. They serve beer and wine, but food is limited -it's all about the music.
name: West Coast Singers-Songwriters

group.name: Sac/Bay Area Live Music, Concert & Music Festival Addicts!

description:
From Wikipedia:
Jack White is an American musician, singer-songwriter, record producer, multi-instrumentalist, designer, upholsterer, director, writer, and actor. On April 24, 2012, White released his debut solo album, Blunderbuss, which received wide critical acclaim.

He has been ranked No. 70 on Rolling Stone's list of "The 100 Greatest Guitarists". White's popular and critical success with The White Stripes enabled him to collaborate as a solo artist with other renowned musicians, such as Beck, the Rolling Stones, Jeff Beck, Alicia Keys, Bob Dylan, Wanda Jackson, Electric Six, and Loretta Lynn, whose 2004 album Van Lear Rose he produced and performed on. In 2006, White became a founding member of the rock band the Raconteurs. In 2009, he became a founding member and drummer of his third commercially successful group, the Dead Weather. He was awarded the title of "Nashville Music City Ambassador" by the Nashville mayor Karl Dean in 2011. He is a board member of the Library of Congress' National Recording Preservation Foundation, a music historian, collector and philanthropist, as well as an advocate for analog technology and recording techniques.
name: Jack White

description: So this was in San Jose last year and this year it's in San Mateo. Last year was its first year in the US and it was pretty cool. Not a whole lot of info up yet, but here's their site: http://www.japan-expo.org/

description:
WHAT IS ROC RACE? ROC Race is the original game show-inspired obstacle run featuring 12 larger than life obstacles including the infamous Wrecking Ball, the brand new Sweeper, Jump Balls, and the World’s Largest Inflatable Water Slide! Get ready for the craziest 5k of your life!
This is an untimed event open to everyone, from couch potatoes to track stars, ages 13 and up!

WHEN: Saturday, August 23rd, 2014

WHERE: Santa Clara Fairgrounds
344 Tully Rd.
San Jose, CA 95111

Watch a video here!:

http://vimeo.com/83701120

Early Bird May 29th at 11:59pm $60
Party Planner June 26th at 11:59pm $65
ROC Star July 24th at 11:59pm $70
Procrastinator August 14th at 11:59pm $75
Final August 22nd at 11:59pm $80
Race Day August 23rd $90
name: ROC Race!  FUN 5K/OBSTACLE COURSE!!

description:
Whoever created this race is pure <b style="font-size : 16px">GENIOUS! Simply watch this video and you will be blown away at the awesome, childish, silliness that is this race! Key words: Inflatable Obstacle Course! 

http://vimeo.com/83701120

See their website for more information: http://rocrace.com/

How to register:   go to  https://endurancecui.active.com/event-reg/select-race?e=5840503

By registering for this event you automatically agree to the following for this meetup group and it's organizers: 

I AM AWARE THAT THESE ACTIVITIES ARE HAZARDOUS ACTIVITIES AND THAT I COULD BE SERIOUSLY INJURED OR EVEN KILLED. I AM VOLUNTARILY PARTICIPATING IN THESE ACTIVITIES WITH KNOWLEDGE OF THE DANGER INVOLVED, AND AGREE TO ASSUME ANY AND ALL RISKS OF BODILY INJURY, DEATH OR PROPERTY DAMAGE, WHETHER THOSE RISKS ARE KNOWN OR UNKNOWN.

Cost is $60 + a $5 insurance fee, but I also hope you consider donating to charity through them as well. 

CHOOSE THE "NEED SLEEP" WAVE. Note: the exact start time is assigned one week before the event, so plan on being available from 11-4. Then, when choosing the team select "San Francisco Random Adventures Meetup" as your team if you'd like to run with us. It will want you to enter a password which is "We be random!" It is case sensitive, and be sure to include the excalamation point. 


More deets to come later! I'm looking forward to doing this will y'all!
name: Participate in the Ridiculous Obstacle Challenge(ROC) Race

description:
We've been asked again to be the official Dog Trainer for Best Friends Animal Society's Strut Your Mutt on Treasure Island in San Francisco. So, we're holding out Meetup at the "Ask the Trainer" booth there. 

Let's play & learn together! Free training tips for you and your dog from the Bay Area's expert dog behaviorist, The Pooch Coach. www.poochcoach.com

We'll bring the treats & the canine expertise, you bring your dog and your questions!

Come out, and enjoy the festival AND get some tips! Join the walk if you'd like and raise some money for a great cause. Other fun dog events and contests as well!

For more info on Best Friends and Strut Your Mutt, click here.

For more info on SF Dog Connector's Meetup, click here.

Hope to see you there!

-Beverly

Owner, The Pooch Coach LLC

Any Dog.  Any Problem.

www.poochcoach.com

Like us on Facebook!  - Connect. Share. Ask. Learn.

Check out our YouTube channel for free dog training tips.

description:
On Sat., Aug. 23, House of Thunder (H.O.T.) Harley Davidson in Morgan Hill will host a "Hoofs and Woofs Poker Run" fund-raiser to benefit DreamPower Horsemanship and Operation Freedom Paws, two Calif. non-profit organizations that provide therapeutic interventions for a variety of clients, especially veterans.

Rider cost is $25 and includes one poker hand, BBQ, and one ticket entry into the drawing for prizes. Passenger cost is $10 per and includes one poker hand and BBQ. The first 100 bikers will receive a commemorative bandana.

Register online at http://hwpokerrun.eventbrite.com, or onsite at H.O.T. beginning at 9:00 a.m. on the event day.

First bike out, 10:00 a.m., last bike out at 11:30 a.m., with the last bike in at 3:00 p.m. Enjoy prize drawings, music, food, games, and more!

___________________________________________________

Release of Liability <<---</a><a href="http://www.meetup.com/FourCornersMotorcycleClub/pages/Release_of_Liability/">

Rain will postpone ride.

Full protective gear is encouraged.

Please arrive with a full tank of fuel.

___________________________________________________
name: Hoofs and Woofs Poker Run

Overview of the course:

The Six Sigma for Service and Software Professionals course has been designed to introduce Six Sigma methodology and tools in easy to understand practical terms without the fear of Statistics. The course includes the original intent, Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve and Control (DMAIC) methodology, and an easy to use template to start practicing Six Sigma methodology. This innovative approach to Six Sigma was developed based on the feedback from Software and Service professionals.

Participants gain an effective understanding of intent, methodology, tools and measurements. Participant’s guide covering all material 

Proprietary Six Sigma project forms template

Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification

group.name: And you can bring your dog

description:
Every year the American Cancer Society holds its Bark For Life event in Golden Gate Park . This dog-friendly event raises money for cancer research. Unlike its other 1-2-or-3 day events, this is a short loop around the park, followed by a festival with games, vendors and a ceremony for survivors.  Please join our team.  Invite your family, friends, children, co-workers, etc.  This is definitely a more-the-better kind of event.

Our team is called "DOG FRIENDLY MEETUP GROUPS" Please join by the link below. We are hoping to get members from Meetup groups all over the bay area. Last year a few of us participated on short notice and raised several hundred dollars. We're hoping that by planning ahead we can do better this year.

http://main.acsevents.org/site/TR/RelayForLife/BFLCY14CA?pg=entry&fr_id=56173

Follow the link: Click "SIGN UP", Then "JOIN A WOOFPACK" and be part of the team. (or search for a participant, then type in meet) It cost $25 per dog, and they ask that each person fundraise to a minimum of $100.

Please join the team first, then RSVP yes on the Meetup page.

venue.name: Golden Gate Park - Hellman Hollow (Speedway Meadow)

description:
Save the date! This years Air & Ski show to be held Aug. 23rd at Orwood Resort, near Discovery Bay, California. This year's  show is a fundraiser for the Patriots Jet Team Foundation and Aerospace Academy which is right here in our community! What the Foundation is all about???? Check it out here.
http://youtu.be/gS-85tF116U

The Patriots jet team is a  non-profit based at Byron, CA airport and are focused on our youth. Founded by Randy and Marie Howell and family, they are a team-centric, all volunteers. Patriotic, not partisan. They are committed to community outreach and dedicated to excellence in individual in focus.

The days events will also include water skier performers, and much, much  more. It starts at  10:00 a.m. and runs throughout the day. The date is set, the events are currently being put together. When a full itinerary is released I will post the details.

 

 

George Covereli, barefoot and show skier from Texas will be performing on the water at the Brentwood Air & Ski show.

 

 

 

 

 

Bringing back the old school ski show to Brentwood, Ca.

Brentwood Air & Ski Show

Saturday August 23, 2014

Orwood Resort
4451 Orwood Rd, Brentwood
name: BRENTWOOD AIR & SKI SHOW

description:
HTML 5 Application Development Training

1 Day - All levels

What: This is a 1 day HTML5  application development training.

Description: Get the insight into HTML5 Application Development with this 1 day it training course. 

The class begins with an introduction to HTML5, Document Object Model and an overview of JavaScript. Following this, Event Handling mechanism is explained. Following this Forms, Audio and Video APIs are explained. The morning session concludes with an exercise.

The afternoon starts out with HTML5 Canvas. Canvas API is explained. Following this, a couple of HTML5 Canvas/Graphics libraries are explained. Students will work on building an HTML5 Applications from scratch using Canvas, Canvas Libraries that integrates Canvas with Audio, Video and Drag and Drop APIs. 

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

This is an all levels training

Summary

------MORNING------

- Introduction to HTML5

- Review of DOM and JavaScript

- Event Handling in HTML5

- Forms API

- Video and Audio API

------AFTERNOON------

-Canvas API

-Drag And Drop API

-Integrate Audio and Video API with Canvas

-HTML5 Graphic Libraries

-Developing Canvas Applications using Custom Libraries

------------------------------------------------------------

Please remember to bring your Lap Top

Contact: [masked]

 Benefits 

Career: Lay your own path to success. Learn HTML5 and taste the fruit of success that comes from being in demand. 

Make more money: HTML programmers make on average $30,000 more per year than professionals who only know Microsoft Office. 

Be in control on the web: HTML is the foundation of the web and knowing HTML is essential for developing and managing a successful online presence. 

Increase strategic value: Become indispensible to your employer. 

Get a promotion: If you are looking for a promotion or a new job then knowing HTML will increase your chances of success. 

Mobile applications: HTML is used for Cross Platform Mobile Application Development; learn the language that is powering mobile applications. 

Value to businesses: HTML is of importance to all businesses because of its integral value to the web. 

Better work life balance: Knowing how to code can lead to a circumstance in your life where you have better control over your career choices and work options. Most employers allow programmers the freedom to decide their own schedule and also offer more opportunities to work from home for programmers than non programmers. 

A standard practice: It is integral to know how to program in todays competitive environment. If you have been looking for a language to learn then make HTML your 1st choice. It will give you a lot of power in a very little time. Let’s face it; sooner or later you will have to learn how to program. Why wait? 

You can do it: Learning to program is not as hard as you think. With our coaching you will be able to bridge the programming gap. 

Beneficial to all employers: Getting training in HTML5 is of value to all companies as it helps employees produce better quality work. HTML5 can make the difference between average quality output and excellent quality output. It is of value to any position that requires communication or data interaction. The skills learned in this class are applicable to all departments of any company including but not limited to IT, Data Analysis, Sales, Strategic planning and Marketing. The skills taught can be implemented in daily online tasks. 

Why:

-  HTML5 offers faster image downloads, especially for mobile users

- HTML5 offers improved SEO

- HTML5 offers Sophisticated animation effects

- HTML5 offers Easier Web and Mobile App Development

- BBC is turning towards HTML5 for application development

- Zynga used HTML5 to make Words With Friends, FarmVille Express, Zynga Poker Mobile Web and CityVille Express. Zynga continues to use HTML5 for product development globally.

- SAP is using HTML5 for Enterprise Mobile Apps

- HTML5 is one of the most desired skills by employer

description:
Saturday August 23 and Sunday August 24, 2014

The San Francisco Bay area is one of the places on our planet most visited for photography. If you live here, why not spend a weekend photographing San Francisco as if you were seeing it for the first time for the wonder it is? If you have always wanted to photograph San Francisco but are coming from far away, what better way to go about it with the guidance of master photographer and Bay area resident Harold Davis?


Following a brief orientation, we will carpool and photograph around the Bay area in an exciting and fun weekend with locations depending on weather, lighting and group inclinations. Group size is limited to twelve photographers. There will be time for image review, and Harold will make suggestions for image improvement and creative thinking about image making.


There will be a night shoot on Saturday, and Harold will present material on photographing San Francisco in both color and black & white.

Why not get the imagery of San Francisco you have always wanted?

</a>

<a href="http://harold.wpengine.netdna-cdn.com/images/cable-car-wheels-lg.jpg">

</a>

<a href="http://harold.wpengine.netdna-cdn.com/images/cable-car-wheels-lg.jpg">

</a>

<a href="http://harold.wpengine.netdna-cdn.com/images/cable-car-wheels-lg.jpg">

<strong style="font-size : 16px">When: Saturday, August 23 and Sunday, August 24, 2014


Where: The orientation and classroom sessions of the workshop will be hosted in Berkeley, California. We will car pool to field shooting locations.

Cost: Tuition is $745 per person. Workshop is limited to a maximum of 12 participants.

<strong style="font-size : 16px">About Harold Davis


Harold Davis is a well-known digital artist and award-winning professional photographer. He is the author of many photography books. His most recent titles are The Way of the Digital Photographer (Peachpit) and Monochromatic HDR Photography (Focal Press).

In addition to his activity as a bestselling book author, Harold is a featured columnist for Photo.net. He has been acknowledged as a Moab Master printmaker and is known as a Master Printer. His limited edition artist book Botanique was featured most recently in Fine Art Printing, the only magazine devoted exclusively to fine art photographic printmaking. Harold’s work is widely collected, licensed by art publishers, and has appeared in numerous magazines and other publications.

Harold’s technique and destination photography workshops to such diverse locations as Paris, France; Heidelberg, Germany; and the ancient Bristlecone Pines of the eastern Sierra Nevada are widely popular and usually sell out quickly.

You can learn more about Harold Davis and his work on his website, www.digitalfieldguide.com. Harold’s blog can be found at www.digitalfieldguide.com/blog.

What some folks have said about Harold Davis workshops:

“A great artist and speaker!”

“Harold is genuine, generous, and gracious – He has a world of knowledge and expertise that he loves to share – his wonderful books show his monumental talents and skill set- his workshops shows the depth of his connecting with others in a very real and personal way.”

“Awesome! He patiently addressed questions from the audience, which contained photographers of all levels, molding his answers to the level of understanding for each of us. His presentations covered a wonderful range of technical knowledge as well as emphasizing the need for images to have an emotional quality. The images he shares are breathtaking and he is generous in sharing many facets of how he captures such beauty.”

“Not all photographers are good verbal communicators. Harold is someone who can DO and TEACH. A rare combination of talents.”

“Inspiring!”

“He was very giving of his talents and time. The course was very organized and thorough. Loved it! Learned so much!”

“Very creative and a marvelous instructor.”
how_to_find_us: We'll be waving tripods, smiling and making way cool images!
name: San Francisco Photography Weekend Workshop

description:
Get paired up with a random person at your skill level to hack on a project for 2 hours!

Thank you to DevBootCamp for providing free breakfast, a great space, and helpful TAs.

There will be three group levels: Level 1: HTML/CSS,  Level 2: Basic Javascript, and  Level 3: Advanced Javascript.

Dont have a project or idea?  Visit our website: www.pairuptocode.com for exercises and to share your progress.

Here is our agenda:

10:00 am: Doors Open

Register and get a sticker for your level.

Grab breakfast and say hello.

10:20am: Event Starts

Decide what project to work on, using our recommended list or by brainstorming ideas with your partner

Hack on your projects together for the next 2 hours.

12:30pm: Event Ends.

 

Do you want to help as a TA? Please send us a message to add you to the amazing TA's group.
name: PairUp

description:
WHAT IS ROC RACE? ROC Race is the original game show-inspired obstacle run featuring 12 larger than life obstacles including the infamous Wrecking Ball, the brand new Jump Balls, and the World’s Largest Inflatable Water Slide! Get ready for the craziest 5k of your life!
This is an untimed event open to everyone, from couch potatoes to track stars!

TEAM CONTEST: The largest team will receive 25% cash back!

http://rocrace.com/bayarea/
name: ROC (Riduculous Obstacle Course) RACE-5k sj

group.name: Bay Area Beginner Golf  Meetup Group

description: Tee Time expected to be 10am.
name: San Ramon

description:
THE LOGISTICS:
Everyone--both drivers and carless--meet at Fruitvale Bart at 10:15.  From there we'll carpool and/or catch the 54 bus to the start.  If there's enough car space, we can skip the uphill from the bus stop to the trailhead!

THE RUN:
This scenic loop in Redwood Park has less elevation than many of our past trail runs!  The first half features wide fire trails, while the second half has some narrow sections (take precautions against poison oak if needed).  There's a nice mix of tree canopy and wide open views, which don't get blocked by fog like some in SF/Marin.  Dogs on leash are allowed.
Click here for the printable full-size map.


THE BAR:
We can Bart back to SF and if it's sunny there, enjoy the patio at Palomino.
Drinks: full bar
Payment: cash, credit cards
Serves food: yes, brunch menu link
Allows outside food: no
Dog friendly: on the patio
name: Saturday trail run

description:
Lets have a two-day, three-round Diplomacy mini-con! Saturday, August 23 to Sunday, August 24th.

Edi Birsan has conjured a space in Concord at the Todos Santos /Pacheco Plaza on Salvio between Grant and Mt. Diablo; walking distance from the BART Downtown Concord station.


We will be playing outside around the fountain and in the alcoves. 


Adjacent to the plaza is an Italian restaurant and the Hop Grenade which is a micro-brew Beer joint plus tons of restaurants in walking distance."

Your Tournament Director will be Andy Hull.

Round 1: Saturday 10:30am - 4:30pm (6 hours)

Round 2: Saturday 5:00pm - 11:00pm (6 hours)

Round 3: Sunday 9:00am - 3:00pm (6 hours)

Given that each round is going to be relatively short, each board will run it's own clock and we will use drop-dead timing. This is where there is no additional time for order-writing; all orders must be submitted prior to the end of the negotiation deadline.

As is the ancient and noble way of our people, we're asking for volunteers willing and able to host any players traveling from outside the area and cart their sorry hides to and from the event.
name: August Double Con

description:
The starting spot is the new Lands End Lookout Visitor Center which is close to the Cliff House near the Sutro Baths. Our route includes Baker Beach, the Seacliff neighborhood, and Marshall Beach.
(by the way, clothing is optional in Baker Beach.)

Lunch is in Crissy Fields by Warming Hut. They have sandwiches and drinks.

Length: it is 10 miles total; however, once we get to the bridge, there is an option to return back by public transportation (Bus/Taxi/Uber/Sidecar). I am leaning towards that so the hikes ends up being approx 5 miles.

Dog: Dogs on leash are welcome
name: Hike to Golden Gate Bridge

description:
It's a Craft Play Day! Create in Niles.

Join The Piece By Piece at a fabulous venue in Historical Niles, Fremont! 

Come create and enjoy the day crafting with your friends. Take a break and enjoy the charm of Niles with its many shops of curiosities… just footsteps away!! 

EVENT INCLUDES: 

• Snacks, Lunch, and Dinner Provided. (We are aware of special diets and allergies, but cannot accommodate to all the individual needs, so please plan accordingly.) 

• Make and Takes 

• Thank You GIFTS 

• Ce Ce Caldwell Painting Demos with Lonae 

• Giveaways 

•  Trunk Shows

• Special Discounts to participating stores (List of participating shops will be given to you on day of event)

… and more!! 

• Sizzix, Cuttlebug, and Cricut available for use.

• Bring your own mats, dies, trays, and cartridges. 

REMINDER: Please bring your extension cord or Ott Lamp if you think you will need it. 

RATES: Early Bird Special $75 if you book before June 1st. After June 1st Rate will be $90. 

To Reserve your spot today call The Piece By Piece [masked]. 

NOTE: You MUST reserve your spot with The Piece By Piece BEFORE you RSVP with ACT. Please indicate that you are with Around the Crafting Table so your spot at the table will be with us.

*Please note that there are no refunds, but you are welcome to find someone to take your place. Just notify us of any changes.
name: Create in Niles Day with The Piece By Piece {Public}

description:
About our host:

Chef Joni Sare is a trahttp://photos2.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/d/6/2/event_327408482.jpegined therapeutic chef and nutritional educator who believes in igniting love and passion in the foods we eat. She has been cooking professionally for 6 years. Her overall goal is to help people create a healthy future for themselves, their families, and communities by choosing and preparing the right foods to eat. Joni says “Like so many other nutritionists, I started my professional journey by healing myself.” To read more about Joni visit http://www.jonisare.com/.

 

The Urban Farmers Coop events are working/learning sessions where we all pitch into a project at the hosts location.

What to bring
For this event, please bring any of the following:

Harvesting tools: gloves, a shovel, spading fork, trowel, weeding tools Potluck item: that either contains something that you have picked from your yard, something that you would like in the future to come from your yard, or something that you have made.
Crop Sharing item(s): Food items you have harvested from your yard to exchange with other members (if you have any) Some good positive energy AGENDA

1) Garden Harvesting

As guests arrive we will be harvesting things from the garden that will be used in the cooking demonstration.  Everyone is welcome to participate in the harvest.

2) Cooking demonstration and tasting

Joni will give a half hour cooking demonstration with tasting.

3) Pot Luck and Socializing

After we have learned new culinary secrets to making many delicious things we will spend time to socialize and eat the wonderful food from our gardens. During the pot luck we will have time to discuss the following:

Q & A about gardening/ farming. Anyone can ask anything about a gardening or farming topic for others in the group to give their insights. News and updates from our members: each member share progress on urban farming projects. Future MeetUps, Volunteers for future hosts, Ongoing discussion on our Urban Farmers coop group. Crop Sharing-- Everyone that has harvested something from your yard please bring it and exchange it. Take what you DID NOT bring.  

About Urban Farmers Cooperative
The Urban Farmers Cooperative events are working/learning sessions where we all pitch in on a project at the host's location. Here is what we do:

We meet to help out a fellow host farmer We do some work, exchange ideas, and learn something at the same time We bring food from our gardens and share all the wonderful foods we are raising After the meeting we all take home something that we did not bring By RSVPing YES to any of our MeetUps you are agreeing to our posted waiver:

http://www.meetup.com/urbanfarm/pages/Waiver%2C_Indemnification%2C_and_Hold_Harmless

Our goal is to bring our community together through safe and fun learning events.

We look forward to seeing you at our upcoming MeetUps.
name: Garden Cooking with Chef Joni

description:
Some of what you'll see on this hike... 

 This will be about a 7+ mile hike w/ an elevation gain of approx 600'. Oh and very pretty. The rating is Pretty (for good views) and Easy-Moderate (for hiking). Obviously the rating depends on your condition. For me, I expect this one will be difficult  ;-)

An online 5 Star review had this to say... "Great place to: ride your bike, run, site see, critter watch, take in the natural beauty, make out!, reflect, skip rocks and get away from it all."

That's enough for me - hike, enjoy the people and scenery, sip some vino - YES!


What To Bring:

Vino! (and cups)

Good Hiking Boots/shoes

Layered clothing, hat, sunscreen

1-2 liters of cold water (1/2 fill and refrigerate, then top w/ ice in the a.m.)

Snacks for the vino/snack break

Food for the potluck (sliced sandwiches, salads, meats/cheeses/breads/crackers, wraps, chicken, dried fruit/nuts/seeds, chips, dips, salsa,  - be creative.)   Sharing the meal is part of connecting w/ everyone.

Drinks, drinks, drinks! Vino,  tea, juice, beer, - whatever whets your whistle.

If you've been on any of my hikes you know what to expect - if you haven't, then be prepared for fun!

$5 activity fee

Your sense of humour is an absolute must!

 Please note:

There are no wineries in the park, sooooo bring those bottles!

There will be a vino/snack break along the hike, and later we'll stop at a picnic area for the potluck. 

<a>Directions</a>:

From Highway 101 in San Rafael, exit at N. San Pedro Road and follow to China Camp.

GPS  38.009486,-122.495352

Plan on parking outside the park, on the side of the road by the park entry.

We will be joined by folks from other grps, so make some new friends!
name: Hike & Potluck w/ Bay Views at China Camp State Park

group.name: The San Francisco Meditation Meetup Group

description:
Peace in the Park festival brings together the diverse San Francisco and surrounding communities to unplug and explore activities of peace and happiness in a fun, inspiring and healthy atmosphere. The festival was created in response to the growing concern - we are an overly stimulated, ADD-afflicted and tech-saturated culture. After the success the first time (2013) with over 2,000 people from all over the Bay Area in attendance, and rave reviews from the sponsors, performers and partners, the community has called for it to become an annual event.

On August 23rd, the 2nd annual festival will feature world music and visual artists; tai chi, hatha yoga; life-changer seminars, arts, crafts, exhibits by local non-profits and meditation experience. At the majestic Bandshell of Golden Gate Park, this event will demonstrate how to nurture peace and happiness even while living in a fast-paced urban environment. You'll be among some of the best artists, scientists, peace makers and policy makers in the Bay Area at this event. The festival is offered free of charge by a coalition including Brahma Kumaris, YogaTree of SF, Stanford University CCARE, Institute of Noetic Sciences, United Religions Initiative,  and ServiceSpace. More information at www.PeaceInTheParkSF.org. Here's a 2-min video from last year to give you a glimpse into the spirit of the festival.

Confirmed Line-Up:

Dan Siegel, MD, Jim Doty, MD, Gurmukh Kaur Khalsa, CHP Sergeant John Carman, Christine Carter, PhD, Chhandam School of Kathak, Chinkayare Ensemble, Temple of Poi, Yaocuauhtli Danza Cultural, Ballet Folklórico Compañía Mexico and Lily Cai Dance Company

Calling Volunteers:

If you'd like to be a part of the awesome festival team, please email [masked]. We have from very simple to sophisticated tasks waiting to be filled. All volunteers get meals, T-shirt and great friends you'll remember for a life-time!

venue.name: Golden Gate Park Bandshell
venue.address_1: 50 Tea Garden Dr., Golden Gate Park

how_to_find_us: You will see flags and activity between the two museums (Cal Academy of Sciences & de Young)
name: Peace in the Park Festival

description:
They say if you ride motorcycles you have a family forever. I know that many of us have had our lives enhanced by joining the moto meetup groups and consider many as family. So this picnic is family ~ friends ~ food ~ and fun.

Let's have an old-fashioned barbeque picnic with good eats, drinks and games. 

Many of you have games so bring them with you, think Tug A War, Balloon Toss, Sack Race, Frisbee, Croquet, Softball, Volleyball, Football, etc. adults and kids can all play. Bring along what you have and like to play at the park. We can have some friendly competition.  I'll be bringing a golf ball toss game. 

This is for the motorcycle friends to all get together and share good old-fashioned camaraderie so bring your partners, kids and grandkids.

Cost will be $7 per adult (15+) and $3 per child (under 5 free). This will cover many items: ice, paper products, utensils, mustard, catsup, bbq sauce, relish, mayo, salt & pepper, garlic, some hot dogs, buns, charcoal, fluid. 

**What to bring: Each family should bring something to barbeque and beverages enough for you and their guests and a side dish to share (feeds 10-15). Chairs, blankets, sunscreen, games, what ever will make you have a comfy enjoyable day.

Who would like to man/woman the grill?
name: Family & Friends Picnic

description:
Enjoy the spectacular clifftop views of the sea on this 1-mile hike. Some of it is paved; some is dirt. Mostly flat with a short, steep dirt section (about 20 feet in elevation). Bring a walking stick for that part if you're unsteady. We may go farther if everyone wants to.

Dogs are welcome.

Bathrooms and free parking are at the meeting spot. I'll hold an 8.5 x 11 meetup sign at the entrance to the Lands End Lookout Visitor Center.
how_to_find_us: I'll hold an 8.5 x 11 meetup sign at the entrance to the visitor center (aka Lands End lookout).

description:
Startup Finance: Valuation

About: Learn how to value a startup.

Finance is a powerful global force and valuation lies at its core. Valuation makes or breaks a company. It is critical to understand valuation as an investor, entrepreneur, consultant and employee.

There are many circumstances in which valuation is critical:

A. You are looking to raise funding for your company.

B. You are looking to invest in a startup.

C. You are looking to work for a startup and your success is tied to the startup’s success.

D. You are about to get paid in equity.

E. You are interested in selling your business.

This class is focused on startup valuation with entrepreneurial and non-public valuation needs in mind. We cover concepts such as pre-money, post money valuation and valuation equations used for private companies. We will be looking at Startup Valuation from the financial perspective. You can expect to walk away with a few equations and ideas on how to make financial projections.

This class is ideal for entrepreneurs, investors and anyone interested in working for or with a private company. Attendees to this seminar will walk away with a better understanding of the valuation process.  Attendees can expect to walk through a financial example of valuation.

Testimonials:

“This is one of the best finance classes I have ever taken.”

- Andrew

“I took the “Startup Finance Valuation” class; excellent job. This class is a must for all entrepreneurs. MBA classes do not teach how to value a startup, this class does.”

- Danny

“After taking this class I have a clear perspective on valuation. I recommend this class to all entrepreneurs. Thank you for a very informative class.”

- Bonnie

“I have been in banking for over 20 years and this class taught me valuable concepts not covered by all the classes I have taken throughout my career.”

- Yaakov

description:
I'll be providing study materials to get people started.  Bring a pen or a pencil and a notebook if you'd like to take notes.

 

We'll use Gaeilge gan Stró as a general basis (I have both the introductory and intermediate texts) as well as other various resources gathered from the private tutoring and classes that I attend.  We'll also use some conversations from the TEG (Teastas Eorpach na Gaeilge - The European Certificate in Irish).

 

If you own an iPhone, iPod Touch, or iPad that is running iOS 6.0 or later, I can share a my photostream of Irish children's texts that you can use for translation practice.
how_to_find_us: There will be a sign on the table.

Danville CashFlow Game Meetup - EastBayPlus Cash Flow club is an official RichDad Cash Flow club. Unfortunately, we cannot accommodate children at this location. If we find a different venue that is more "kid-friendly" then that, of course, can change. Let's have some FUN!

description:
Action shooters!

We will be doing an Epic Greco/Roman themed shoot in San Francicso!
We will have both male and female models in Greco/Roman style costumes to bring to life the historical age of Rome with the magnificant backdrops of the Legion of Honor and Palace of the Fine Arts.

More details to follow but here are base details as of today:

Action shoot 1 - Legion of Honors
100 34th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94121
3PM - 5PM

The Legion of Honor is a part of the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco. The name is used both for the museum collection and for the building in which it is housed.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legion_of_Honor_(museum)

Action shoot 2 - Palace of Fine Arts Theatre
3301 Lyon St, San Francisco, CA 94123
6PM - 8PM

The Palace of Fine Arts in the Marina District of San Francisco, California, is a monumental structure originally constructed for the 1915 Panama-Pacific Exposition in order to exhibit works of art presented there.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palace_of_Fine_Arts

description:
Intellectual Property Issues for Biotech Startups

At this event we'll have Intellectual Property Attorneys from Alston and Bird who specialize in Biotech issues.

They'll give some introduction to the issues and will be available to answer whatever questions you may have regarding your own IP coverage, conflicts with IP of others, process for arranging protection etc.

 

You'll get the best answers and coverage if we can have some dialog in this Meetup page so they can see what areas are most useful to those attending.  Ask your questions here and we'll get some discussion started. The event may exceed capacity so sign up early.
name: Intellectual Property Issues for Biotech Startups

description:
Come and join us on Saturday, August 23rd from 4:00 to 7:00 pm at the Magnum Hangar, South County Airport for a SCAPA and Magnum Aviation joint summer BBQ - at no charge for SCAPA members and their guests.

We will provide gourmet burgers and hotdogs, sodas and water, and a cake. Please bring side dishes such as salads/veggies or an appetizer. And if you would like an adult beverage, please bring your own.

This has been a fun, well attended event each Summer. In addition to the food, we will have a raffle with great pilot-oriented prizes. This is a great opportunity to relax among friends and to get to know some of our newest members.

When you RSVP you will be asked to indicate the number in your party and what type of dish you will bring. For more information, contact [masked] or [masked].

We hope to see you there!
name: SCAPA and Magnum Aviation Summer BBQ

description:
GG Amos, the most electrifying female guitarist of contemporary blues, and her 4 piece will swing the back patio hard at San Jose's fabulous New Orleans bistro!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6-NYHq2LnCU

GG Amos has entertained audiences her whole life.. but she's made blues and the blues guitar her specialty for the last 26 years. She's known as a riveting performer and unique songwriter, focusing on the west coast blues style— a blend of blues, jazz, funk & latin elements. Soul jazz has increasingly become a bigger part of her repertoire.


***********
How to meet up: Miki will be there 15 minutes before the show starts at one of the tables near the stage wearing a Meetup badge.

description:
Saturday - Audust 23rd

                    Mike Amaral's CALIFORNIA BEACH BOYS Band

Well, its now summer & its another wonderful outdoor setting to see this band.

description:
I've decided to extend this tasting to this grp as a courtesy since you guys have been showing up a lot lately.  Typically this event is only open to my Vino grp. 

So w/ this in mind - don't wait to sign up, as there is a limit to how many we can fit in the house and on the deck, and my guys usually fill the place.


                                                     ~~~IT"S WINE TIME!!!~~~


The featured varietal for August is Merlot.


This will be a blind tasting of the stated varietal - No you don't have to be blind to participate - just wear cool sunglasses.

It works like this:  We get together for hors d'oeuvres, vino, and fun before the tasting starts.

Then we'll start the actual tasting, and then have more food, vino, and fun!


There will be a social hour beginning at 6:45pm, then we'll start the tasting sometime thereafter.

Ea member brings a bottle of Merlot in the $15-$25 price range.

The bottles will be bagged and numbered and we'll have note sheets w/ categories for rating the wine.  At the end of the night (or sometime) we'll determine which bottle wins ( this will be determined numerically) - pls no questions yet!

If this isn't clear I'm sure it's just because I'm a kindergarten dropout, and has nothing to do w/ the fact that you're just not grasping what I'm saying.

Just kidding.  Well not about my education, or lack thereof.  Ah, but I digress.  Don't worry about the details, as they will sort themselves, after you've done this once you'll love it.

For August we'll be tasting Merlot - remember the required price range is $15-$25


What To Bring:

~A bottle of Merlot in the $15-$25 price range (this insures a relatively consistent tasting).

~Hors d'oeuvres - be creative (brie and sourdough is always popular - especially when the brie is hot - we can heat it for you), meats, hard cheeses w/ bread and/or crackers, soft cheeses, etc.  At the last tasting we had a great assortment of food, snacks, and hot food (yes, you can use the oven).   Thx guys!

~ If you can, PLEASE BRING EXTRA VINO for drinking before the tasting begins (red, white, purple, whatever).   Purple???

Beyond that bring whatever you think we'll enjoy.  There's no pressure to spend a ton of $$$ on this event, other than for the required wine and hors d'oeuvres - so just come enjoy yourself and have fun.

As always, PLEASE update your RSVP early if you think you won't make it, out of consideration to the host and grp - thx!  Since this is held at a members home it's important to let us know if your plans change.

My top priority is for everyone to have fun and connect, and pls be patient if the tasting doesn't begin at a decent hour - remember we're here to have fun!

Optional, but really helpful:

~A main or side dish - again be creative.

~Extra vino you think we might enjoy during the social hour, prior to the tasting.

As always, your sense of humour is required!

In other words, don't take this too seriously - we're here for a good time!
name: Merlot - Blind Wine Tasting in Fairfax

description:
Open to all Santa Cruz and nearby communities. 4th Saturday evening every month starting 8 pm going till about 9;30 - 10 pm. Calling in the directions, shamanic drumming, send distance healing, personal and group cleansing, journeying, power dancing, divination... A good way to get introduced to shamanism, and for those who are familiar with these practices and spiritual approach, a friendly and grounded way to maintain the practices. 3 dollars donation (please!) to give to the Quaker Center which lets us use the space. Located at the Santa Cruz Quaker Center at 225 Rooney Street, Santa Cruz.

Bring a blanket or small rug to lay on the floor (otherwise it is hard), pillow if you want, something to rest over your eyes during journeying to shield yourself from any light, your drums and rattles, and personal sacred items if you want to lay them on the alter during the gathering.

Gatherings were initially led by Dr. Steve Serr, ex-psychologist-turned-shamanic-mentor. Steve was not only passionate about regathering the ancient ways and wisdom that grew from our ancestral understandings of our natural relationship with a sacred Earth, but has been encouraging this group to continue evolving shamanism and Earth-centered spirituality curriculum to meet the needs of the contemporary era.

For a period of time (unknown! Depends on how many become involved!) Steve and his mentors who teach at Shamanism 101 are letting members of the Santa Cruz Shamanic Spirituality Circle take their online shamanic training course, which is pretty much the same as what Steve was teaching in his circles at the Quaker Meeting House in Santa Cruz. Information about this is tacked below.


His dream and goal is that this circle becomes self-governing and maintaining, and takes the training through Shamanism 101 so that they can easily facilitate for themselves what Steve was facilitating.


What are for now monthly gatherings, provide Santa Cruz and the surrounding communities with the sacred space for personal and group healing and wellness based on safe and time-honored shamanic and Earth-centered spiritual practices and protocols.

Ethical, accurate and safe protocols of practice need to be passed forward that rely on the 'core' shamanic elements from throughout the world and over history, and rest on a recognition and relationship with a sacred Earth from which our indigenous wellness and shamanic healing practices come.
name: Santa Cruz Monthly Shamanic Spirituality Circle

description:
Hey everyone,

I know this is a month in advance, but the Real Escape Room is quite popular and you have to book way ahead of time if you hope to get enough tickets for 5+ people. For those of you who don't know what the Real Escape Room is about, our group will literally be locked in a room together and will have to solve a series of connected puzzles to find a way to get out of the room. Kind of like Saw but we are only mentally tortured, not physically tortured. For more info, please check out this link http://realescapegame.com/rersf1/

I bought out the entire 11-person block for the escape session on August 23rd at 10:30am (10:00am is just our meetup time, to make sure we aren't late starting), which means that it will be only our group playing the game. When buying the tickets I specified that it's my/our group's first time playing, so if anyone has done this before, I imagine that the puzzles will be identical to what you have played before. So don't come unless you are good at not spoiling things for other people :)


The cost of attending is $29 / person. I won't start hounding people for money until a week before / the week of the event, so don't worry about payment for now. All I ask is that if you RSVP, you actually show up and eventually pay me back sometime (I take reimbursement in alcohol as well as cash), and that if you can't make it, you remove yourself from the RSVP list ASAP if there are people on the waitlist.

venue.name: Real Escape Room SF I at New People

description:
A Great Little hike - Perfect for Sunday Morning !

  Discovery Hikers are exploring a little different kind of hike this week. We call these Urban hikes and this is how many of us got started before Meetups Hiking Groups were invented.

  The Route : Climbing ASCOT DR (approx. 850 feet of surface street ) and on to a dirt trail at the end of Ascot dr. to the top of Open Space of Mulholland Dr. then back down ( on surface streets ) to Donald Dr. and return to the Rheem Theater , a 4 1/2 mile Moderate rated URBAN HIKE ! 

  Not considered easy be any means but a nice steady climb of about 800 feet and plenty of flat and mellow sections to catch your breath and check out the valley views of Moraga that make this hike a favorite of ours.

 NOTE :  The Organizers have this hike Rated :   Moderate -  Approx. 80 % on Surface Streets and the balance on Dirt surfaces, single track trails that connect to form a Loop of 5 miles. Allow 2 - 2  1/2 hours round trip

   NOTE :  This hike is among some of the more easier events we do on a regular basis. If you'd like a little more gentle hike on sure footing, and still get your heart rate up then this might just be what you need. Compare this level of difficulty to Lafayette reservoir Lower loop ,maybe 1 1/2 times around .
how_to_find_us: Parking in the lot around the Rheem Theatre . Look for Meetup members in front of the Theatre and be ready to get hiking by 8 :30 am.
name: Hike Mulholland Dr. - Moraga - Urban Hike 5-Mile loop Rated Moderate .

description:
East Bay DFA’s Summer Picnic - Party for Victory 2014! 

CoHosted with Wellstone Democratic Renewal Club 


<strong style="font-size : 15px">We’re having a picnic to celebrate the victories we've achieved over the past twelve months and the opportunities we still have in 2014.

 

<strong style="font-size : 15px">Meet up with old friends and make new ones as we get ready for the election!

 Sunday August 24, 2014 

1737 Alston Way, Berkeley, CA


1pm to 6pm

RSVP Today!
http://www.meetup.com/dfa-78/events/194575672/


Please bring a substantial side dish, salad, or dessert, + what you’d like to drink. Wellstone will supply burgers, dogs, boca burgers, and the fxin’s. 

What victories? 

• Equality for all is coming to pass as more states either vote to allow gay marriage or the courts rule that laws banning gay marriage are unconstitutional. Marriage is a right that we should all enjoy. Enough said!

• Obamacare becomes real and even with it's website's abysmal failure in the first months, more people sign up for insurance than anyone expected. The Republicans lose one of their basic messages "It will never be accepted and it will never work". There's still room to make California a test case for single payer. Let's show the country it can work here.

• The minimum wage is going up.  San Jose raised the minimum wage to $10.15/hr. on January 1.  Seattle just voted to raise their wage to $15/hr. Berkeley City Council just voted to raise their wage to $10/hr. It may not be a living wage or even a fair wage, but it's a good start.

• Janet Yellen becomes chair of the Federal Reserve. The first woman to hold that post beat the odds when her supporters wouldn't budge on her nomination to the post. Her goal is to get people back to work while keeping the economy going. She's not likely to be friendly to big Federal handouts to Wall Street interests.


• This year a slate of four progressive candidates for county council, backed up by grassroots activists were elected over a business slate. Their first order of business was to kill a port expansion to ship coal to China. Grassroots activists can and do win against the monied interests.  We have the opportunity to do that here in the East Bay this year.

What opportunities and lessons learned? 

• Turnout is key! Whether it’s walking precincts, making phone calls or donating to campaigns, your personal effort at the grassroots can make the difference. 

In California we have a chance to pick up 2 of the seats the Democrats need to win back the House and see Speaker Pelosi wield the gavel again. 

In California we are within striking distance of having a 2/3 majority in both the Senate and the Assembly that works together as a team to set the agenda and pass bills we know need to be passed. 

• We can support Progressive candidates across the country. DFA National is in the forefront of identifying Progressive candidates and putting resources into their elections. 

We are in the process of identifying a Congressional race in another state where we can help win two races at once. We want a Congressional race where we can turn Red to Blue and a Senate race where we are preserving a Blue seat and keep control of the Seanate. 

• In Colorado in 2012, we came close to defeating a Tea Party Republican in CD-06. It wasn’t just inspiration that turned the voters out – rank and file union members and progressives of all sorts engaged in massive get out the vote efforts in every corner of the the district to make this happen. This year there's a strong candidate with better funding and a good track record in the State House. More on this at the party.


Tony Thurmond's overwhelming victory in our May Meetup straw poll helped get him out of the gate in the June Primary. Our endorsement of Abel Guillen was an early boost to his campaign.

Now let’s get both of them across the finish line this Fall! 

Tony Thurmond – Assembly District 15 – East Bay shoreline from Pinole to Piedmont including North Oakland, Montclair, Berkeley, El Cerrito, Albany, Richmond, El Sobrante and Hercules.

Abel Guillen –Oakland Council District 2 

With long hours of daylight this summer, we need everyone’s help to work on their campaigns so we hit the ground running in September!

Tony Thurmond – Tony spent his formative years being raised by his aunt. That's where he learned that education is the only way out of poverty. As a social worker and education director of Lincoln Child Center, Tony has developed innovative ways to reduce violence, keep kids in school and provide job training to give hardworking people a path to the middle class. He also has a long record of fighting for clean air and water, reducing pollution and banning toxic chemicals.  He will continue that work with a call to ban fracking in California. 

• Abel Guillen is currently serving his second term as a Trustee for the Peralta Community College District and he’s currently serving as it’s President. As a Trustee, he has established himself as a leader on improving the quality of education, expanding career training programs, and providing strong fiscal stewardship for improving access to healthcare and making the college system greener. As a Councilmember, he will provide this kind of leadership in City Hall on the tough issues facing Oakland and the East Bay. 

Interested in Progressive Change? Want to have fun? Come to our Summer Picnic!! 

RSVP Today to help our candidates to victory in 2014!


 http://www.meetup.com/dfa-78/events/194575672/


We’re always looking for a few good members to join our organizing team at DFA! 

Come talk to any of the team members to consider joining the EB Democracy for America organizing team: Janet, Michael, Norman, Vincent & Yvonne.
name: Summer Party - share ideas & food Co-Host Wellstone Democratic Renewal Club

description:
On August 24,  2014 at 2:30 P.M. the Masonic Philosophical Society will be hosting a study group at the Santa Cruz Masonic Lodge. In each Meetup a different topic, ranging from philosophy and science to religion and metaphysics, is discussed, debated and related to the principles of Freemasonry.


The topic for August is, "Freemasonry and the metaphysical qualities of the spoken word." The spoken language has many associations with creation,  ritual, and Freemasonry. What is it about verbal expression that lends itself to this connection? What are the differences between ritual with definite and consistent language compared to more open, free-form ritual, and how has this affected Freemasonry. 


This group for men and women, which is open to the public, is where non-members can learn more about Freemasonry, as well as meet local Co-Masons.
name: Freemasonry and the metaphysical qualities of the spoken word.

description:
This month we will be reading Misfortune: A Novel by Wesley Stace.

Victorian dandy Lord Geoffroy Loveall is faced with a dilemma. As heir apparent to Love Hall, he must produce an heir of his own; but his obsessive love for his long-dead sister has rendered him a paralytic in matters of the heart. Adding to Geoffroy's troubles is his difficult mother, Lady Loveall, who mercilessly castigates her effeminate son, and a circling mob of greedy relatives anxious to wrest Love Hall from his grasp.

Then, a miracle occurs. As his carriage passes a trash dump, Geoffroy spies an abandoned baby in the jaws of a cur. He saves the child, names her Rose, and declares her his rightful heir. The shock fells Lady Loveall on the spot, and Rose becomes the pampered daughter of Lord Loveall and his bride of convenience, the resident librarian Anonyma. This joyful period lasts until Rose's adolescence, when it becomes increasingly difficult to hide the one great secret of Love Hall: namely, that Rose, now in the position of fending off suitors for her titled hand, is in fact a boy. 

Rose's whiskers, deepening voice, and affection for the daughter of a courtier have not gone unnoticed. Armed with the new revelation, the Loveall's unscrupulous relatives launch a coup, and a desperately confused Rose is cast adrift -- until he finds the renewed vitality that comes from the love of true family and realizes that he can and must go home.


Please join us for some good discussion and social time. Refreshments will be available. (Please feel free to bring a snack or beverage. I will supply at least one bottle of wine.) There is never any pressure to have the book completed (or read at all) in order to attend. We would just love to have you, and it can be enjoyable to hear about the book and meet some cool people. 

Remember that Books, Inc. provides book club members a 15% discount on the books we are reading for the meetup. Call ahead to make sure they have a copy available for you. They can also arrange to have books shipped to you. 

Parking and transportation: 

Parking can be challenging, but there are a number of options. There are the obvious street meters which are free at this time. In addition to these there are two outdoor lots and a parking garage in the vicinity, all of which are also free on Sundays. (Regularly $0.50/hr) The Civic Center Parking Structure is next door to the Alameda Theatre and is located at 1416 Oak Street, between Central Avenue and Santa Clara Avenue. Lot A is accessible from Park Avenue between Central avenue and Santa Clara Avenue. Lot B is accessible from both Central Avenue and Alameda Avenue between Oak Street and Park Street. The bookstore is also not too far from the Fruitvale BART Station on Oakland. It is an easy bus ride from there. Arrangements can also be made with the organizer and/or other members for rides to and from the BART. Just post requests and availability to the comments, or e-mail me through the web page links.
name: August Meetup

description:
About the class: This is a 2 day Mobile Application Development Training with a commitment from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM each day. No prior programming experience required.

2 day class with a commitment from 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM each day 

Learn to make applications for:

Android

iOS (iPhone and iPad)

Mobile Web

Don’t miss out on this awesome opportunity!

75 % of all Smart Phones in the World are Android Devices

15 % of all Smart Phones in the World are iOS Devices

Please remember to bring your laptop

No prior programming experience required

Agenda Day 1:

Intro to JavaScriptOverview of options for cross platform developmentAdopting the right strategyUser Interface FundamentalsWorking with Local DataWorking with Remote DataWorking with Media and the Filesystem Agenda Day 2:Using the cloud for your applicationIntegrating Contacts and Social APIsIntegrating Web ContentDeployment and DistributionApplying newly acquired skills

Is your enterprise ready for mobile?

This class also covers the topic of enterprise mobile solutions. 

The world of mobile application development is evolving very fast. A major driving factor behind these developments is the contributions made by the international community of developers in the form of open source platforms that enable the generation of native apps from a single code base.

Benefits

Access to all markets: The most valuable benefit of taking this class is that it covers multiple platforms in a single training

Mobile application development is here to stay: Smart phone companies have spent 100s of millions of dollars in research and development in order to deliver to the world a product that revolutionizes the way we live. 

To add some numbers to this: Apple spends about $1 billion on R&D each year. 

The result of all this investment is that we now have smart phones with more computing power than many desktops. The ability to make a smartphone is not readily accessible to individuals however the ability to make applications that utilize these smartphones is.

Impossible to avoid: Businesses have to adapt to the smartphone revolution, there is no way around it. This adaption ranges form sending and receiving emails to making presentations and word processing.

description:
This is sure to be a very fun evening together but also one where intention and major shifts will be set in motion!

A vision board is a simple yet powerful visualization tool that activates the universal law of attraction to begin manifesting your dreams into reality.

It is simply a visual representation or collage of the things that you want to have, be and do in your life. It consists of a poster board with cut-out pictures, drawings and writing on it of the things that you want in your life or the things that you want to become.

Supplies I Will Provide:

Colored Markers/Poster board/Scissors/Glue/Magazines

I have made plenty in my lifetime and without fail all my goals have come to fruition!

The purpose of a vision board is to activate the law of attraction to begin to pull things from your external environment that will enable you to realize your dream. By selecting pictures and writing that charges your emotions with feelings of passion, you will begin to manifest those things into your life.The law of attraction states that we attract into our lives anything that we give attention to regardless whether it be positive or negative.

Your personal vision board is only limited by the extent of your own creativity. Having artistic ability is not a prerequisite for creating a functional vision board.

Visual. Your subconscious mind works in pictures and images, so make your vision board as visual as possible with as many pictures as you can. You can supplement your pictures with words and phrases to increase the emotional response you get from it.

Emotional. Each picture on your vision board should evoke a positive emotional response from you. The mere sight of your vision board should make you happy and fuel your passion to achieve it every time you look at it.

Strategically-placed. Your vision board should be strategically placed in a location that gives you maximum exposure to it. You need to constantly bath your subconscious mind with it’s energy in order to manifest your desires quicker than you hope.

Personal. Negative feelings, self-doubt, and criticism can damage the delicate energy that your vision board emits. If you fear criticism or justification of your vision board from others, then place it in a private location so it can only be seen by yourself.

Supplies I Will Provide:

Colored Markers/Poster board/Scissors/Glue/Magazines

If you can, compile your pictures at home to bring into class though we will have time to do in class, as well. Start by going through your magazines and compiling all the pictures that you can find that are relevant to your goal. Don’t evaluate the pictures just stack them into a pile. Make sure that each image that you will put on your board resonates with your heart and makes you excited at the mere look of it.

It’s also important when selecting pictures to include anything that is congruent with your goal, such as any changes in your life that might result from obtaining your goal. So if your goal is to have a six figure income, then select pictures of a lifestyle that is congruent with your six figure income. Asking yourself the following questions might help:

What would you do differently when you realize your goal?
Where would you travel?
Where would you live?
What would you wear?
What things would you own?
What kind of vehicle would you drive?
What would you do for work? Or would you work?
Who would you help?

When the day comes to actually place your pictures onto your board don’t worry about being artistic—that’s not the point. The point is that your board should resonate with your emotions. You should arrange your pictures in a way that gives you an emotional connection to your vision board.

description:
Come join us for an evening of silent meditation in sacred community. Silent meditation gives one the space to unfold and relax into one's natural and undivided self. This practice is excellent for maintaining a life of well being while consciously continuing along a path of self care and discovery.  In practicing together, we support each other in our individual processes as well as being with what is, exactly as it is in the present moment.

This event is led in Satsang style, including a talk about an aspect of the path of meditation and an interactive exploration that gives the participants the opportunity to consciously open into their deepest selves.  This group is offered every Monday evening at the East Bay Healing Collective, and draws upon teachings from many traditions including Advaita Vedanta, Western Non-dualism, and indigenous traditions of North and South America. In the event of a Guest Teacher facilitating, the evening may be lead in a Dharma Talk style. This is similar to Satsang, but different in that it is of the Buddhist tradition.

Open to everyone and well-suited for beginners and experienced meditators alike, a typical evening includes 40 minutes of meditation, a talk inspired by various spiritual teachings, and interactive time of Q & A / discussion.  One only needs the openness to sit with oneself, the curiosity to be with what arises, and the courage to be honest about what is discovered.

If you are new to meditation and would like some extra guidance or have questions, feel free to come a few minutes early and/or stay a few minutes late!  Further your practice with us, or come dip a toe into a quiet reflective space and explore what is here for you.

Administrative Event Host and Teacher: Rain Elizabeth Stickney, teaches the 4th Monday of the month April - July 2014.

Guest Teachers: Adam Baraz, Katherine Roubos, George Peterson, Micha'el Bedar, Mike McGarry, Nicki Koethner.

Teaching Schedule July - August 2014

July 7th - Micha'el Bedar

July 14th - Mike McGarry

July 21st - Mike McGarry

July 28th - Rain Stickney

August 4th - Micha'el Bedar

August 11th - Mike McGarry

August 18th - Adam Baraz

August 25th - Multiple Teachers Present in Celebration of the Evolution of the Group!

If you want to show up earlier, you can! Illusive has an open gaming day on Mondays from 11am to 7pm. (I will try to make it there by 6:30pm, myself.) I've also been told there are demo board games available, if you want a break from Magic, or are waiting to play a match. description:
The Logic and Prop chapters of Software Foundations clarify some of the Coq basics we've been skirting around till now. I don't claim that using Coq won't feel like playing Adventure after we've done these chapters, but we might at least feel like more experienced players.

Note that I'm basing the chapter numbers on the July 2014 issue of Software Foundations, which inserts another chapter (Rel, on properties of relations) in between Logic and Prop. Having skimmed all three chapters, though, I think it makes more sense to postpone Rel.

And don't forget that gate code! *1111 will get you into Mixrank.
name: Do chapters 6 and 8 (Logic and Prop) of Software Foundations

description:
Join us for free at one of our highly-innovative business-networking meetings - in your city! View our full calendar of business-networking meetings. We welcome anyone to attend a GoRampUp! meeting, once, for free as our guest, so you can learn what the innovative GoRampUp! business-networking experience is all about. Note, we are not able to give you a free meeting at more than one of our many locations.

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting athttp://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance. Without this ticket you will, unfortunately, be declined access to our innovative and exclusive business-networking meeting. WITH a GoRampUp! Golden Ticket, you will be welcomed with open arms!

It can be too difficult to attract new clients. We help you fix that! We're a business-impact community. We're informal and fun, yet, by design, we're extremely effective!

We help people who work for a living to get a much greater payoff from working. We do this in three specific ways under our three CoreSuccess Platforms: 1) We help you move toward mastery with business-networking, 2) We help you move toward mastery with business performance, and, 3) We help you move toward mastery with personal development.

How do we deliver on this promise to our community members? Each month we conduct dozens of business-networking meetings in more than a dozen cities in the SF Bay Area. A member may attend all of our "OpenConnect" business-networking meetings. And our members are welcome and encouraged to attend any and all of these meetings and locations.

Each month we introduce and emphasize a learning and development subject under each of our three CoreSuccess Platforms. For each of the three learning and development subjects that we introduce and emphasize each month, we give you four different ways to learn it: We produce written learning guides, video learning guides, audio learning guide, and we cover the subjects as 15-to-20-minute mini-workshops inside of our 60-minute business-networking meetings. There's no registration or initiation fee to join. Membership in GoRampUp! is month to month. You enroll when you like, even mid-month, and you depart when you like.

Be sure to see our website to learn about our generous enrollment incentives

Also, be sure to learn about our 100-Satisfaction Money-Back Guarantee

description:
Jared Diamond convincingly argues that geographical and environmental factors shaped the modern world.

Societies that had had a head start in food production advanced beyond the hunter-gatherer stage, and then developed religion—as well as nasty germs and potent weapons of war—and adventured on sea and land to conquer and decimate preliterate cultures.

A major advance in our understanding of human societies, Guns, Germs, and Steel chronicles the way that the modern world came to be and stunningly dismantles racially based theories of human history. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize, the Phi Beta Kappa Award in Science, the Rhone-Poulenc Prize, and the Commonwealth club of California's Gold Medal. (From the publisher.)
name: Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Human Societies by Jared Diamond
